  7254. First, the electronics are outstanding on two counts: 1) it fully charges in less than an hour, and 2) it continues to run at full speed even as the battery discharges--the motor has the same output at 10% battery reserve that it does at 90% battery reserve.

All Reviews

  1. Best Eledtric razor on the marked for my money
  2. Two years in, and I'm quite happy with this razor. The vibrating foil does a better job than Norelco's spinning blade heads - probably faster blade speed. Also, the recessed on/off button is great. With my old norelco, I had an issue with it getting switched on by accident in my luggage. That's never happened with this razor.
  3. Didn't expect how loud it is. Other than that, it's OK.
  4. This shaver works just fine. Really came in handy on our driving trip.
  5. Great wet/dry razor. This is my second one.
  6. very good product. it is the most powerfull shaver I have ever used. your skin doesn't get hured.it is very smooth and soft.
  7. Sent to my son in the hospital. He is handicaped in many ways & is on blood thinning medicine & they wouldn't shave him unless he had a electric r portable razor. We both read about this one & both got very excited. It turned out to be THE BEST EVER!!
  8. I had high hopes for this shaver, I was hoping to shave my head and face at the same time in the shower. Maybe I asked too much. My 10 year old Norelco shaver still has better battery life than this unit after 1 year of use. This shaver never holds a charge for more than 2-3 shaves anymore. Of course you cannot shave with it while it is charging. So now it dies mid shave while getting ready for work. The pretty lcd display stopped functioning after 6 months of use. Panasonic says they will repair it, but I must send them the razor for a month. Luckily I have my trusty old Norelco or I would be growing a beard with no razor. Speaking of my old Norelco, it still gives me a better shave and shaves while charging. Shaving in the shower was poor anyway. I wish I could get my money back on this unit.
  9. It works perfectly. This is my 4th Panasonic Shaver. Took away one star due to:<br /><br />1) Its LCD readout misses few bars after 2 years<br />2) It has annoying clean it icon even if the unit is clean<br />3) Expensive replacement blades (though mine is working for 3rd year without changing and with daily shaving)
  10. I wanted a great shave in between using my razor on the weekends and this really fits the bill. Gets closer then my razor (G Fusion) ever did without the harsh burn after. Take a few times to get use to, but really made me sold after I saw how long my shave lasts now without the 5 o'clock shadow.
  11. Very happy with this shaver! I bought it to replace a Braun that broke after about 2 years. Braun used to be a fine shaver company with quality support - I think they've fallen down a bit (IMHO). This was an Amazon deal-of-the-day special, so I feel particularly satisfied with the then very low price and the remaining very high quality of this shaver. To me, it shaves closer and smoother than the model Braun that I had. It charges quickly, holds the charge well, and cleans easily. Based on the fact that this model is sort of an entry-level model for the Panasonic line, I can only imagine how well the higher end models perform. I highly recommend this product. This shaver has made me a Panasonic-believer when it comes to shavers!
  12. My husband loves it......he has not tried using it as a wet shaver but so far he loves it for<br />a quick clean up!
  13. I received this shaver about a month ago as a gift and have been using it every day ever since. All my life I've been shaving with a Gillette Mach 3. I'm lucky I received this gift because I was getting tired of the razor. The box documents carefully state that you should give your beard \\"some time to adjust to the change\\", so I did. The first shaves were comfortable but not too close. As the days passed, they got better and my beard wasn't growing back sharp, like it did with the gillette. I was hyped as well by the idea of \\"dry shaving\\" and \\"no more foam\\". However, the shaver seems to work better on my face with some water. If you are considering switching from a razor to this, then this is what you have want to know.<br /><br />Advantages over shaving with the Mach 3:<br /><br />-Very, very close shave, just as good as with the razor.<br />-No water or foam required (Although I always wet my beard at least twice for comfort)<br />-Not having to clean the blade all the time - only once at the end<br />-Beard grows back smooth, not sharp<br />-Chances of facial cuts decreased by at least 90% (I cut myself only once and that was pushing the shaver too hard into my face. Excessive pressure won't necessarily yield a better shave)<br />-Blades are supposed to last 2 years, and the outer foil 1 year. Better than throwing dull blades every week or two.<br />-Shave comfortably in any direction (Moving a razor sideways usually meant 2 days of cleaning blood from my face. Not anymore)<br />-No irritation on my skin whatsoever. Razor shaves usually left me with a bare, red look on my neck.<br />-Yes, you can shave in the shower, which happens to be a great pleasure.<br /><br />And the downsides:<br /><br />-The machine is a little noisy. No big deal, just close the door.<br />-Achieving the same close shave as with a razor takes more passes than it would with a razor. Although that makes the machine shave seem slower, remember that you will recover time by not creaming up your face and only cleaning once.<br />-It doesn't have a lock feature, which worries me that it accidentally activates during a flight, the TSA will go paranoid on me. But it hasn't happened.<br />-The pop-up trimmer is very useful for neck & other body hair. But does not seem spectacular for face hair. No pain whatsoever with this, though.<br /><br />Go ahead and try it. It's useful and fun.
  14. I received it, charged it, and shaved with it. Could not believe how close it shaved on the first time. I haven't used an electric shaver in a few years and was pleasantly surprised how well it worked. I will update once I have used it for a little longer. I recommend a buy.
  15. Working fine after 3 years, however, the digital display has stop working so you don't know if it is charge or not.<br /><br />Likes: Close wet/dry shave; not too noisy<br /><br />Dislikes: Digital display stop working within a year;

  17. Owned and shaved routinely over a year<br />The Shaver Works Fine But Routinely leaves irritation. Thought this would be limited to dry shaving and tried wet shaving (shaving cream and / or in the shower) nope, even more irritation. The Customer service is basically non existent: the attached beard trimmer (which worked more for trimming longer hairs before shaving than actually making lines) broke off several &#34;teeth&#34; around 6 months in and filed a warranty claim to panasonic through their website as it left my face with some long scratches and received no response. Two months later did this again and made sure i got a confirmation on the panasonic website and still no response. For what it's worth, the actual shaving head and overall shave is close and actually closer on my face than i can get with a mach 3 , and leaves less irritation than my old norelco but leaves more irritation than my old braun series 1 (which i replaced with this panasonic as it was on sale here on amazon for $55 at the time). For the price I paid I have no qualms now if I had to pay the list price of $150 I would get a Braun Series 7

  24. This is my first electric razor. The product comes with a money back guarantee if not satisfied. The brochure sez it will take about a month to get used to an electric. More than a month later I still don't like how it feels or shaves. Does not shave like a blade - never will. That being said I still use it to \\"knock down\\" a two or three days growth when I'm too lazy to shave properly. I would never have bought it knowing what I know now.
  25. Years ago I had a Norelco which barely produced an acceptable shave. Never tried an electric-wet shave, always dry. Went to blades and used them for nearly 20yrs. Needed an electric for vacations, so bought a Remington foil. It was a very close shave, but often left me with razor burn, so for years, I used it occasionally. This year I decided to replace it.<br /> Read all the reviews and zeroed in on the Braun... the BMW, with the price to match.<br /> I bought the Series 3, used it for a few days and returned it. The old Remington still shaved closer.<br /> Bought the Series 5 Braun ... and the Series 7... bells and whistles tied to a cleaning solution money pit. Still, the old<br /> Remington was a closer shave. Returned these too.<br /> Decided to give Panasonic a try... liked their stereos etc., but was doubtful as to how they would do with razors.<br /><br />This ES8103S shaves as close as my old Remington, closer than the Braun - any series - and leaves no razor burn. It is easy to clean. Forget the water, just pull off the foil head, blow it out, tap it a couple of times and you are good to go.<br /><br />I packed-up my razor blades and keep this by my desk... shave in the morning as I check email, etc.<br /><br />Oh, BTW, don't believe that hogwash about having to use an electric 30 days or more....
  26. It works but not as great as everyone made it seem. Price is ok for product. I would not really recommend this product, maybe to someone who wants a starter or a travel razor. I say, invest in your face and get a more pricey one. I know price isnt always indicative of quality but just do your research and get a razor a level above this one. The extra 20 bucks will be worth it.
  27. Works great wet or dry. I have a heavy beard and this shaver provides a close enough shave without skin irritation.
  28. This shaver provides me with the closest shave I've ever had from an electric shaver, it glides nicely along my face and neck. I like the fact that it can be used wet/dry. The battery charge seems to last a long time, and it seems to be easy to clean. So functionally, no complaints. I paid around $60, so the price was right for me also.<br /><br />My only two minor complaints about this charger are:<br />1. It's nosier than other shavers I have used -- it's a loud high pitch type noise.<br />2. There is no base for the shaver to set in, and so the charger is a separate charging device (much like a cell phone charger) which plugs into the bottom of the shaver, so the net is, another charger to keep track of.
  29. This is one of the best electric shavers I've ever had. I can get a good, close shave without a lot of effort.
  30. I've been using this shaver for about two weeks now. I had been using a previous Panasonic foil shaver with two blades and the first thing I noticed about this shaver is how much closer it cuts! I get a smoother shave in less time than it took my previous razor to cut. The only drawbacks one might discover is the louder buzz this shaver emits while working and the tendency to heat up considerably after about two minutes of cutting (which is actually beneficial on some chillier mornings). I love the display, and the comfortable design of the unit. I have not used it for wet shaving yet, but do look forward to taking advantage of that feature too! Would purchase again!!
  31. My husband said it felt like it was yanking his hairs out for the first two months.

  34. I tried one of the 4 blade self cleaning ones and it was the biggest disappointment ever so I ordered this and it has been a night and day difference better. I have sensitive skin and this shaver gives a very close shave without irritation. Bought it for the ability to get it wet(use sensitive skin shaving cream) which is a nice option but it also does a great job dry. Charge % display is nice. Flip up trimmer is a little flimsy feeling but does a good job tackling the longer hairs and doesn't get jammed up like my old one. All in all I am a fan of this shaver.

  40. This is my second one so their life expectancy may only be a few years. Unlike some of the others who have reviewed this shaver, the battery lasts about 2 weeks. It gives a close shave but is a bit noisy. It's not possible to shave with it plugged in, but it charges fast if you forget to charge it. My last model still works, but the noise level increased dramatically and the LED screen stopped functioning. I've owned several brands and rate this the best for both shaving and ease of cleaning.
  41.   42. This shaver doesn't meet my expectations. It leaves hair spots on my face after several minutes of shaving. I am also experiencing razor bumps after shaving.   43. This razor works great - I get a clean, comfortable shave every time - and it doesn't grow back with sharp ends like I get with a blade. Wet shaving has also made my skin much softer, which seems to prevent the shaving bumps and ingrown hairs that I would get when using an electric shaver on dry skin.<br /><br />I bought this shaver to replace an ES8109S that got dropped and broken. That model is the same as this, but comes with a cleaning unit. I thought the cleaning unit was a good idea until I got it and realized that it was a waste of time and money, especially once I discovered wet shaving in the shower.<br /><br />I've read reviews that talk about the display quitting or behaving strangely - I experienced that with the 8109 as well, until I started storing it vertically in the shower, out of range of the spray. I think water eventually gets in it if it doesn't drain properly. If that does happen, the display comes back once it finally dries out. I haven't seen that behavior with the 8103 in the month I've been using it.
  44. Having never used an electric razor before, I was a little apprehensive about giving this a go. I have used it for about a month now, having started using it with Shave Cream (as suggested by the Manufacturer). Shaving this way was a breeze. This week I stopped putting shave cream on and used it au-natural. I found that it too was easy and I have not had any irritation of my face thus far. The skin on my face is very tender and can get irritated very easily. I give it a 5 star rating because I can zip through a shave in a relatively short time and can touch up my facial hair in the evening, before going out. In addition lets factor in the cost of razor blades, that I no longer have to buy. THIS IS WIN - WIN SITUATION. Oh, btw, I have a goatee and the pop up trimmer does the trick to get close to do the trimming. The delivery was right on, as expected as well as the packaging. The price that I paid was a little better than WallyWorld. Love you Amazon!!!!
  45. Definitely does not shave as good as a razor blade.
  46. This razor has a Strong trimmer. I think it works better when it is dry. In general it is good for the money
  47. I bought this for husband for Father's Day this year as his old Panasonic was pretty much toast. Really it does a fine job! I'm impressed at how close it shaves and with minimal irritation. He has extremely sensitive skin and just can't do a strait razor.<br /><br />I'm sure the Panasonic Arc 4 is an amazing product but is the extra blade worth $50? Amazon even had a $15 off coupon for the Arc 3 and that makes this an even better value!<br />The fancy Braun with its self cleaning station was on his wish list but I think the wet dry shave option is so much better and I don't have worry about ordering the cleaning cartridges.<br /><br />So far he seems very happy with it and the replacement foil/blade cost is not excessive. If you want a nice shaver and don't want to spend a fortune this for you!
  48. It's the only electric shaver I've ever used that can be compared to shaving with a blade. It charges quickly and I can about a week of use before needing to charge again. This will definitely go with me when I travel. Highly recommended.
  49. This is really great. It shaves much closer than his old one. I love that it is cordless since our apartment bathroom is so small. I hate seeing cords around the sink. This shaver is a bit louder, but you get used to it. The only negative is that it doesn't seem to catch the hair so my husband will shave before he dresses. You'll definitely see some hair shavings fall if your guy is wearing a white shirt. That is the only negative so far. We've had it for about 1 month now.

  55. I got this because I started to shave my head...I use it with shaving soap and for the most part it works well enough for me...I have to go over some spots a few times to be smooth but a tiny bit of stubble does not bother me...My face it works fine on...A couple of passes and its smooth...A little hand soap and water on the screen and turn it on and rinse...Take the screen off and rinse again and I'm done...30 seconds to clean...Battery gives me about 5 or 6 shaves of head and face and I recharge...Charges fast too...Good buy for the $$$
  56. I have a graveyard of electric razors, some expensive some cheap but, this razor, so far, is by far the best little razor I have ever purchased. The power is there w/o all the noise. From the first time I used it I got a better shave than I have had in years. Even after buying all the new blades and foils for my remington MS2 300, it still didn't give me a decent shave. At last I had to leave the plug in because there wasn't enough reserve power to even get a bad shave without leaving it plugged in. I haven't used the wet shave option yet but I am looking forward to it because the shave I get with just pre shave is great, so close and even gets the stubs I sometimes miss. I hope this shaver lasts a good long time, at least until something better comes along, which I doubt. I have had Brauns and others but all left something to be desired. Doesn't seem to matter how much you spend, you just have to keep looking for the right combination and for the moment anyway, I think I have found it. Good little razor...by far...
  57. It's ok. Nothing special or super-duper. It would be better if it had a stand to put it in!
  58. After owning the razor for 5 months, the LCD display has disappeared. It is impossible to determine the charge remaining from the display. The razor itself continues to work fine so I just recharge it once a week. The ONLY option to get it repaired is to send it a Texas repair center. So if you buy this razor be sure to keep your old razor because you may be without a razor for an extended period of time. I wish that Panasonic had repair centers in major cities so that you could possible get it repaired quicker and avoid the expense of sending it out of state. My old Panasonic razors simply had bars that indicated the charge remaining. While they were not as descriptive, they lasted the length of the razor.
  59. I have used Braun shavers ever since my first shave and they always did an adequate job, though not stellar enough that I when it came time for a replacement I couldn't be swayed by the high reviews Panasonic shavers were getting all over the web. The Panasonic, it turns out, is a quantum leap better. The difference with my last Braun feels like, for lack of a better metaphor, the difference between a scalpel and a scythe. The Panasonic goes about its job with surgical precision and efficiency; the high-pitch whine it produces is not super-loud, and not unpleasant in a high-tech kind of way. The ergonomics are good. The fact that you can clean it under running water is nice. The trimmer works great but is a bit on the narrow side, and when deployed it sticks out and away from the shaver's body at an angle that takes a bit getting used to. My two minor gripes are: (a) the battery life isn't exactly phenomenal (I'm getting about 10 shaves on a charge v. 14 per users' manual), and (b) the spiffing 0% - 100% battery indicator is just for show; it moves in 10% increments just like a 10-segment LED. Despite the manual's hedging about needing up to a month to get used to the new shaver, I got a great shave from day one. Also, this shaver makes short work of a 3-day growth; it takes no longer to eradicate than a 24-hr shave. All in all, a great shaver. I recommend it.
  60. Very similar to my 8109, which I've used for years. Great shaver for general trimming.
  61. I did much research on electric razors considering they are verrrryyy hard to shop for and decided to get this one with my price limit. My bf seems to like it, says you don't have to go back and forth constantly to get the job done, doesn't pinch your skin, and can use it wet or dry. The only bad thing is that you cant charge it while you're using it. Also, it is loud... which I didn't care about but I guess that's one thing people look for..? I would def. recommend.

This was a pleasant surprise.

  66. I have been using a rotary razor and Mach 3 for years now. And by far, after the first time I used this razor (about 3-4 hours after I received it from Amazon and let it charge) it was the best shave I have ever had in my life. I had the three day extra long stubble and this shaver cut right thru it all (dry shave). I also have sensitive skin and usually after shaving (electric and Mach 3) I get razor bumps and I have to wait a day in between shaves, but with this I am able to shave every day (even in the morning and at night before going out). I also have tried this with shaving cream while in the shower, and was I surprised once again.<br /><br />pros:<br />-Amazon cut down the price<br />-feels like I used a Mach 3 razor, skin is smooth<br />-says you only have to do one pass over, it takes 2-3 on some sections on my neck where the hair grows at differ angels, but that's better than my old razor<br />-no razor burn/in grown hairs<br />-dry shave is just as good as a wet shave<br />-wet shave in the shower is even better<br />-Battery seems to last long enough (haven't counted yet, but seems to last the week)<br />-The pivoting head is a nice feature to contour to face/neck<br />-You can also lock the pivoting head<br />-Fits good in my hand and is easily maintained<br />-LED readout for battery life<br />-Built-in ultrasonic self-cleaning feature, seems like a good idea, have to wait and see with time and if it really keeps the blades fresh<br /><br />cons:<br />-the motor does hum a bit loud, but as long as hair is being shaved it seems to dull the hum<br />-the pop out trimmer - it is a small in comparison to the shaving head, it is tricky to find the right angle so i can see myself in the mirror to trim my sideburns as the shaving head covers it.<br />-other electric razors have a spot where shaved hair is collected, with this they just fall, not a deal breaker for me as I prefer to shave in the shower, or shave with shaving cream<br />-I do notice that the foil gets warm towards the end of the shave, it doesn't burn me, but I notice an increase in temperature.<br /><br />Overall, to me the pros outweighed the cons. And before buying I read the reviews and have found for the most part, that I am in line with others views.<br />Love this razor and would recommended it to others looking.otice an increase in temperature. Overall, to me the pros outweighed the cons. And before buying I read the reviews and have found for the most part, that I am in line with others views. Love this razor and would recommended it to others looking.

It took me several days to get used to it. The first shave wasn't good but that's because I was new to electric shaver and didn't get used to the handling.   68. Better than a $200 Braun. I loved Braun, but they are excessively over priced. This shaver is so smooth and quite. Before committing to a new shaver, look at the price of the replacement foil. All shavers literally eat through the foils. Some shaver models require really expensive replacement parts that last only 3 - 6 months. Often this quickly exceeds the cost of the actual shaver. For example you can get a $110 Panasonic 4 blade shaver that goes through $50 foils every few months.
  69. I have tried various shavers over the years but always ended up back with a razor blade. This shaver definitely changed that! Very close shave, easy to use either wet or dry! Highly recommend!
  70. For a decade or more I stuck with one of the classic block-shaped Remington shavers. It worked great and I kept it going with new batteries and old parts, but the screens were becoming very hard to find. If I had to change, I wanted a shaver that was easy to use every day, worked well for tough, thick whiskers, charged quickly and had a pop-up trimmer. Based on reviews here, I took the risk of buying this shaver, and it turned out great! I really enjoy using this shaver. It's easy to clean, shaves clean and close (takes a few passes though), charges quickly and works well on my neck. The pop-up trimmer is small, but it does the job. I can only hope that this shaver will last me through a decade of shaves like my old Remington, because I'd love to keep it for a very long time.
  71. This is a fantastic shaver. It replaces an earlier Panasonic model that was also terrific. Extremely close shave, easy to use and clean. I would recommend this over the Panasonic shavers that have a self-cleaning module. My previous shaver had a self-cleaning system and I found it to be noisy and the cleaning process took quite a long time. With this model, you simply add some liquid soap to the top of the foil, add some water, turn the shaver on and let it run for under a minute. It cleans the shaving head perfectly well. Then leave it out in the air to dry.
  72. I can't believe I'm saying an ELECTRIC RAZOR of all things is overrated, but I'm really boggled by the positive reviews of this thing. Here's my take:<br /><br />PROS<br />1) VERY close face shave if you use shaving cream - your face will most likely be baby smooth. I'm one of those guys with a permanent \\"trash stache\\" that's impossible to get rid of with an electric razor, but this one got the job done.<br />2) Great Battery life - lasts forever<br />3) Quick charging time - goes from 0% to 100% in about an hour for me.<br />4) really waterproof - use it in the shower with no fear.<br /><br />Sounds good so far - so why do I say it's overrated?<br /><br />CONS<br />1) Absolutely useless dry - It just plain doesn't work for me. My 10 year old Norelco did a better job while dry. 2) It also doesn't work well without lather- shaving with plain water is difficult and spotty.<br />3) Can't do my neck very well- even with shaving cream it leaves tons of stubble on my neck area. Again, a standard dry razor did better.<br />4) You HAVE to clean it constantly. So I've established this thing is useless dry. But if you use it wet, water gets trapped in the foil/guard and by the time you get home from work - the thing smells like an old towel. So basically you have to pop the lid off/clean the blades/soap the foil/rinse it before and after every use. I don't know about you but that's really the opposite of \\"convenient\\" for me.<br />5) TONS of irritation - maybe my skin is just weird, but since I switched to this razor in June, I've never had so many zits, nicks and cuts. I always shave fresh out of the shower, and clean the heck out of the razor, not sure why I'm so irritated.<br /><br />Other people seem to love this razor, and I don't doubt it's great for them, but I just can't recommend it. If you have your heart set on this razor, the price makes it not that big a gamble. Others, beware.
  73. I bought this for my husband and he loves it. Says it fits contours of face better than old more expensive razor. Charges fast and holds charge well.

  75. I got this to replace an older Norelco and I've only used it dry. Most of us are only going to use an electric shaver dry. If I wanted to mess with a wet shave, I would just use a blade. Compared to the Norelco, it shaves noticeably closer, with less irritation, but not quite as close as with a blade. Compared to the Norelco, it's also pretty loud and feels hot on my skin. Battery life is about the same. Cleaning is a little complex, since you use liquid soap as well as water, but it's not a hardship. Overall, I like this razor a lot, particularly for the price. I purchased from Amazon, which had the best price I found, and it came quickly.

  78. I have had the Panasonic ES8103S shaver for about a month now. I wanted to give it some time before posting a review. My shaving history, is that I am retiring a Remington dual foil I've had for about 6 years, a Pair of Braun foil shavers before that, and started out about 20 years ago with a Norelco rotary. I don't have an especially thick beard, and I don't get 5 O'clock shadow; but I do need to shave once a day. The first thing I noticed with this shaver, is how quiet the Panasonic is versus the Remington. My Remington was very loud, and the Panasonic has a much lower noise level; The Panasonic has a high pitched buzz to it, but it's still about 1/2 as loud as the Remington, and took some getting used to. The next big difference was the amount of vibration difference. The Remington had alot more vibration vs the solid Panasonic. The Panasonic doesn't shake in my hand at all. It did not take any getting used to holding this shaver vs the Remington. At first, because of how quiet the Panasonic was, I was debating if it was really even working - since I was used to the buzz saw Remington. However, right out of the gate, it did give me a much closer shave. Even having been using an electric shaver for 20+ years, it still took about 3 full weeks for my face to get fully used to the new shaver. Especially the area over my top lip for some reason. The first week I used it, I had only minor irritation, nothing severe. This shaver does not cut any faster than the Remington, and it still takes about 5 minutes for a complete shave. It still take 2-3 passes to do the neck and chin area. But as I said before, it is a much closer shave than the Remington, and it is an electric, not a blade so I am used to that extra work. I have not used it wet or in the shower. So I have no opinion on that. I typically shave the first thing out of the shower, with no gel. On 1 full charge, I get about 7 shaves, and it only takes 1 hour to completely charge. After a month, I am extremely pleased with this shaver.
  79. Gives me the smoothest shave of all the electric shavers I have owned. It could have come with a design where it has a stand while charging it, but it is no big deal the product results make up for that lack. I strongly recommend it. Feb 12, 2012 - Close to an year since purchased, work great. Even at 10% charge it works like it is at 100%, without a wimper.
  80. I was very skeptical about electric razors for years. I had a cheap Norelco a many years ago and hated it. I am in the military and purchased a battery operated electric travel shaver a few years ago for the field. I thought it would be a great alternative to walking several hundred meters to use cold water or just shaving dry with a razor. I was wrong. The travel electric left me raw with ingrown hairs. Cold water or a dry razor shave was better than that. I am about to deploy and since the latrine is several hundred meters away (again), I considered the electric option again. I read all the reviews and decided to give this Panasonic a try. I couldn't be happier. I have used it in the shower with a light shave cream, at the sink with a light cream, dry with Williams' Lectric Shave and dry with nothing when time is short. Obviously the wet options are best, but It does a fine job dry, too. I now can shave right in my hootch with no water or anything. It will really save me a bunch of time and waiting for a free sink and no chance of hot water. I will also save money too. I have used it a month and have saved appx 15% of the purchase price by not having to pay ridiculous money for Mach 3 blades. I won't go back to a blade.

  87. I started shaving with an electric razor at age 15, and at 41, I've not used a blade in 25 years. Over the years, I tried several different styles and brands of shavers, but I kept coming back to old faithful, my beloved Remington MicroScreen 3. To date, still the closest shaving electric razor I've owned. It's main drawback was that it tended to go through a couple of sets of blades a year, as I shave daily, and have a fairly coarse beard. It's day finally came to an end when it became too difficult to find replacement blades recently. I did a lot of research to see what was getting top reviews in the $75-$150 range. I've been burned before by cheap shavers, and know you get what you pay for, but then there comes a point when you have to remind yourself it's a shaver, not a Mercedes. I settled on Panasonic, and got a good deal on newegg for the ES8103S. It's well built, has some nice features, and doesn't do a bad job shaving. I find I can't seem to get quite as close of a shave with it, but I believe that is because the shaver screen is a bit more robust than the Remington. I've been using this for 6 months now, and the head shows no signs of wearing out yet. I know I'd be on my second set of the year with the Remington, so I feel good about this. My son's both have MicroScreen 3's yet, but one of them recently suffered a fatal fall, so we decided to buy 2 more of these Panasonic's to centralize on a single shaver blade to have to buy. I rated this shaver as a 4 based strictly on comparison with how close it shaves compared to the Remington. However, on robustness, comfort, good ergonomics overall, I'd be apt to give it a 5. If I could go 4.5 stars, I would have, but I just couldn't go 5, due to the fact that I think the old Remington did a closer shave, and after all, that's what a shaver is for, right? Bottom line here...I think the what you get for your money makes this a good value, and as noted, I'm buying 2 more. Oh yea, Amazon now shows this for $1 cheaper than Newegg, so I'll get these from Amazon this time. Hope this was helpful to someone out there! I almost forgot...be sure to give this shaver a fair shake...the instructions say to give it 2 weeks for your face to get used to the unit, and they are pretty accurate.
  88. Best electric razor I've ever tried. I bought it on the recommendation of a friend, and I love it.

  92. After shaving with a blade for 35 years, I got tired of the ingrown hairs and razor irritation. Shaving was something I dreaded to the point where I got fired from a job because I wouldn't shave everyday (as if guys who work in lumber yards need to be clean shaven!) I scanned Amazon.con reading review after review and settled on my ES8103 Wet/Dry shaver based on the reviews and reasonable cost. I intentionally didn't shave for a few days to see what the shaver could do when up against a tough,course beard like mine. What it did was glide over my whiskers and gave me a shave closer then a single blade razor but just short of a double blade. The pop up trimmer works great,maintainability is very easy with clean up a matter of running the unit under water. I haven't tried it on my face wet,that will be tomorrows test. If you want an electric shaver,this is the one you'll want. BTW, shaving with a razor took me 20-25 minutes due to the coarseness,thickness and curly whiskers. I can shave now in less then 10 minutes!

  94. In my opinion, I really like this razor. I have read other reviews about it. It's amazing how I can read so many different opinions on it from the reviews. I don't mind how loud it is. I have other razors just as loud. it takes a few days for your face to get used to it. I bought it because I wanted a good razor that would do a quick, good job. and it does just that. it cuts great. you have to stretch your skin like the directions tell you. it is very easy to clean. I either run water thru the cap after I take it off the razor, or just blow air thru the foil. and I do the same on the blades. I noticed the foil gets warm after one side of the face is done. that might be a consideration for many people. but I think these types of razors get warm on the foil after a few runs across the face. This warming of the foil doesn't bother me. but I know other people would probably say it gets hot. it cuts very close to the skin, and I like that. its very easy to charge and charges quickly. I used it down to 50%, and it had no bog down on the razor. I don't use it in the shower. I only use it dry. I shave every day, sometimes twice. the pop up trimmer if excellent. it cuts. I thought it would be weak in power and not cut good. but it is all I use on my mustache. the only thing I don't like about the trimmer is the razor blocks the site of the area you are trimming with the trimmer. the head of the razor is in the site line. but I work around this and just lower my face so I can see the trimmer. this part of using the trimmer is a little tricky, but it is for the sideburns, and that you will have no problem doing with the trimmer. I like this razor a lot and I am glad I bought it. I hope this helps point out some points of the razor that should be considered when buying a razor. thank you amazon for your excellent service.

  98. I was really hoping that this shaver would perform a little better. It is only an OK shave in my opinion far from great, and far from even a decent disposable razor. (Yes I have used it over 30 days as well now) It doesn't really shave that close, and misses hairs on each pass, sometimes entirely and then once they get longer it has a VERY hard time getting them. Also even with cleaning as recommended sometimes this thing has a little bit of a funky smell. Not bad, but certainly not great. 2-4-12- Update- Thsi thing went form mediocre to horrible- now takes 6-7 passes to work and still doesn't get everything. Awful will be donating to charity.
  99. I've used various shavers for years and when my old Braun needed a new foil and cutter I figured I'd try something new. After spending inordinate amount of time researching shavers, I purchased this one. I turned around and returned it the next day. Admittedly, I never used it on my skin. But I charged it and then turned it on and it sounded like an annoying mosquito. More importantly, it doesn't shave when plugged in, which means you always have to time the charge correctly. I need a shaver that I can use while plugged in, and don't want a shaver that if the battery is low I need to charge it quickly and wait around while it does so. I can't fathom why Panasonic would make such a shaver. So I decided to spent more and get a the Braun Series 7 720s.
  100. after two months of use, I'm quite satisfied. takes a few days to get used to after years of razors. shave is not as close, but have not gotten a razor cut or any in-grown hairs since i started using this. holds the charge well. have not had an instance where the razor died when in use because there's a power meter that the power meter informs you how much juice is left. am thrilled to not have to buy razor refills and shaving cream. altogether way more pluses than minuses. highly recommend.
  101. [[ASIN:B001DNE3KQ Panasonic ES8103S Pro-Curve Wet/Dry Rechargeable Linear Pivot Action Shaving System, Silver]]so-far-so-good. I have been using the shaver for about a month, about 4-5 times per week and still on the first charge. I have a light beard and use a pre-electric shave; just soap when in the shower - I do not like a dry shave- for a close shave (my wife is happy with the closeness of the shave...).   103. I've had this for several years and am generally happy with it. Shaves nice and close and doesn't irritate the skin. Since it is a Wet/Dry unit, you can't use it while its plugged in (risk of electrocution) so you have to make sure to charge it regularly. The charge lasts 5 or 6 uses and the battery is still going strong after all this time. I've replaced the blades three times but they really should be replaced every 6 to 9 months. Much better with new blades and they stay sharp for a reasonable time.<br /><br />The only problem I've had is the gizmo that should lock the head from moving (floating) broke early on but I haven't been too unhappy with that little failure.
  104. A great shaver. The last one I purchased lasted eight years and still works. Never replaced cutters or screen. The new one works very well and battery charge lasts ten plus days.
  105. The shaver provides a clean shave. Love it's cleaning action. Easy to charge and I've had the charge last for 2 weeks.
  106. i tried the Braun ultrasonic after having great luck with my ultrasonic toothbrush, but I was very disappointed. I should have returned it but instead I left it at my office for when I forget to shave or I'm running late. But this shaver is the least irritating, the closest shaving, and the most effective I've ever used. My only complaint is that I don't like the popup trimmer angle, and that it emits a tiny high pitched whine when charging that you can hear if your hearing is good. Even with those gripes, I would buy again.
  107. This is the second Panasonic Linear shaver I've owned. I bought this one after my Model 8168 wet/dry shaver finally gave out after 6+ years of pretty intense use - I felt like I got my money's worth out of that beast. Bottom line is, my last Panasonic worked really well, and this one works just as well - no better, no worse. I have a tough beard and very sensitive skin, so blades don't work, and most dry-only electric shavers just tear my skin up. I use the shaver with a light shaving cream after a shower, and rinse the foil in cold water while shaving. It shaves as close as anything else I've tried, including blades. I chose the 8103 because I didn't need the massive 4-foil heads of some of the other wet/dry models. It's also a great price for a Panasonic, which is the only brand of shaver I'll buy. Please keep making wet/dry shavers, Panasonic! My only concern is that, while my last one was made in Japan, this one is made in China, and has the lighter (read: less substantial) feel that I for one expected given that piece of information. While less that thrilled with that nugget, only time will tell whether that affects its longevity.
  108. Overall, a great website with most of them being reliable sources.
  109. This is my second Panasonic Wet/Dry Shaver. The first one lasted several years before breaking. A former co-worker recommended it, and I was very happy to discover it. I like how I can use it dry if I'm in a hurry, or can take more time and use water and shaving creme to get a closer shave when I have time. It's easy to clean with liquid hand soap, so the optional cleaning machine is not a necessity.
  110. I've tried many electric razors. Last was Norelco with the 3 rotating heads (about a 5-year old product). The razor was very good; what I liked best was the minutes-to-go could be easily seen so you knew how much \\"life\\" was left before re-charging. When re-charging, if you left the razor unconnected after it was re-charged, it reduced the battery's life. Battery's are costly to replace. This Panasonic razor (#ES8301s) cuts closer and has a head which adjusts to the curvature and contours of your face. It is a \\"softer\\" feel on the face. It is everything I would like in a razor. The negatives is the countdown on the battery's life is in 10% segments, i.e., 100%, 90%, 80%,and so on until it seems to automatically shut down. That's not good. Better to have each percent shown or each minute shown that is left because it gives the user greater control over when to re-charge in my judgment. Unlike the Norelco, if you lose power in your battery, you can't plug in this model Panasonic electric razor. The plug in is only for re-charging. With the Norelco even if the battery is not sufficient to run the razor, you can plug it in with the re-charging cord and it will totally function. You must shut down the razor for it to re-store the battery's life. This model of Panasonic does not work off the electric cord, only the battery, which is why I gave it 4 stars. Another big plus for the Panasonic is when fully-recharged, the charging stops so the battery isn't harmed versus the Norelco. That's a big plus for Panasonic. Lastly, I've had the Panasonic for less than six months when it suddently began shutting down involuntarily at 50% battery life left. I feel I was sold a product in which the battery was not good, for whatever reason. The instructions accompanying the Panasonic razor said there was a two-year warranty. I called them and they told me to ship it back to them. I am about to do that having gone back to Amazon to get the invoice to show my proofof purchase and had the razor for less than 6 months. Since I would be without a razor while the battery was being replaced, I bought a current Norelco product (# 8240XL) and it seems to be as good as the Panasonic or even better flowing over my face and getting a close cut. The extreme negative is it doesn't count down the time left before re-charging; it shows only a \\"low battery\\". That's not good at all. Knowing the time left before needing to re-charge in minutes or percent of battery life remaining is important to me.
  111. The product was advertised as provided a close, comfortable shave and that's what it does. I was actually very surprised at how quiet it was compared to the one it replaced. I have tried it both wet and dry and works equally well. I've only used it for 2 weeks but so far it is a thumbs up item in my book.
  112. I had a Panasonic electric microscreen razor that I had been using for about 7 years. It still cut fine, but the batter could only hold a charge for 1 shaving, so I figured it was time to get a new one and see what new technology has to offer. I decided to stick with Panasonic as I've been very happy with the brand's performance.<br /><br />I decided to get the 3 blade shaver since this was the type of razor I had before. This ES8103S is a great razor. I really like having the display that shows how much batter power is left...no guessing involved. I have found that I can get 6-7 shave cycles on a single charge. As far as the shaving, I can't say I really see much of an improvement over my 7 year old razor. It still takes me 4-5 minutes to shave each morning, but when I'm done it leaves my face smooth and stubble free. My neck hairs are still the hardest to shave and they take the majority of time for each morning shave. Once I move to my face the razor is very fast, one pass usually gets the job done. This razor is much lighter in my hand than my old one. Probably because they use more plastic parts to save on cost, but still it is nice.<br /><br />The razor cleans up easy with liquid hand soap and water and has a nice sonic cleaning mode to really power clean the heads. The swivel ability of the shaving head also is a nice improvement from my old razor.<br /><br />Overall, I can't complain. The razor performs on par with my old razor and since I've been using an electric microscreen razor for many years my face is used to it and I get a very close and comfortable shave with no irritation. The battery lasts a long time, the razor has a nice contour that fits in my hand well, and the display feature with the batter power is great. I would highly recommend this razor, especially if you've been shaving with an electric razor already.<br /><br />UPDATE: It's now October. I've been using this razor for about 10 months now, and I must say I'm very happy with this purchase. The razor still gives a very close, very fast and comfortable shave. It's so lightweight in my hands. Easy to navigate around my face. The batter is still holding a solid charge (uses about 10% per shave, so I can easily get 8 days worth of shaving on a single charge). And it recharges from 20% to full in less than 2 hours. I would still highly recommend this razor.with this purchase. The razor still gives a very close, very fast and comfortable shave. It's so lightweight in my hands. Easy to navigate around my face. The batter is still holding a solid charge (uses about 10% per shave, so I can easily get 8 days worth of shaving on a single charge). And it recharges from 20% to full in less than 2 hours. I would still highly recommend this razor.

  116. I've used mid range Norelcos my whole life, keeping them through at least one battery upgrade (6-8 years or so). The battery on my current Norelco (8845xl) isn't holding a charge any more and the current crop of mid range ($75 or less) Norelcos don't get very good reviews, plus I wanted something with a lithium battery instead of nicad. So instead of paying another $40 or so for a new battery and blades for the old Norelco, I tried this panasonic es 8103s. After a month I'm really liking it. Pros: Shaves closer than the Norelcos ever did. No irritation at all. Occasionally with the Norelco I would get redness on my neck area. Cleans easier than the Norelco. Can hold both under water, but on the Panasonic there are less spaces for the hairs to get stuck in. Can use wet and with cream (it does seem to shave better that way but I'm happy with the results using it dry) Lighter than the Norelco and easier to hold. Easy to use pop out trimmer same as Norelco. Replacement blades/screen are cheaper than Norelco replacements. Nice use left display and tells when to clean it. Cons: The only real complaint I have is that this doesn't suck in the cut hairs as well as the Norelco did so there will be cut hairs in the sink or on my shirt. Not much of a problem except the first time I used it to trim the hairs on the back of my neck, the cuttings got into the collar of my shirt and I spent the day with an itchy neck and redness due to that. Now that I know I won't trim my neck hairs before showering. Louder than the norelco but not annoying. The vibrations in the hand are pretty strong compared to not feeling much with the norelco. If not using it wet, it can get a little warm near the end of the shave. Can't use it while plugged in. With the nicad batteries in my norelcos I could continue to use them plugged in for a very long time (over a year) after the batteries stopped holding a charge before they would finally give out. I would expect the lithium battery in this to last years and years without having any problems like the nicads, but it is a concern as once the battery dies, it's dead as you can't use it plugged in. I'm not concerned, but the foil screen is very thin and would damage easily if you banged this without it's plastic cover. I suspect that is an issue with all foil shavers. And no it doesn't shave as close as a blade, but it's pretty close.
  117. Doesn't really work that good for the price you pay for it!
  118. This is the second Panasonic shaver purchase for my husband. It was purchased as a replacement to his similar (Arc4) shaver which failed just before the 2 year warranty expired. He needed something while waiting for the warranty, expecting the warranty to take several weeks to resolve. Normally I would not purchase a product again that has proven to be unreliable - failing during the warranty period is not a good indicator of the product design. However, he really liked the quality of the shave and wanted to stick with the Panasonic. Because he viewed the shaver as essentially &#34;disposable&#34; item, with an expected useful life of two years, the decision was made to go with the 20% less expensive Arc3.<br /><br />This Arc3 shaver lasted 25 months of 5 day / week use. Not covered under warranty anymore. Bummer.<br /><br />Comparing the shave to Arc4... Arc3 is noticeably rougher. It tugs a bit more at the skin. Definitely a difference. And in my husband's opinion, not really worth the savings compared to Arc4. So, minus 1 star for the lower quality shave,<br /><br />Minus 1 more star because of overall product reliability. The product is obviously engineered to last +/- 24 months. Based on my experience, and the reviews of others, you can count on the product lasting 2 years. But you may get lucky and have it covered under warranty if it fails before that.<br /><br />Happy to report Panasonic was very easy to deal with on the Arc4 warranty. We shipped the shaver to Panasonic with the proper paperwork enclosed. About 10 days later a brand new replacement shaver showed up on the doorstep. This happened quite a bit faster than expected.<br /><br />So, he is going to break the (now two year old) replacement Arc4 out of the box. It has been sitting in the cabinet for 2 years as a standby. He guesses it will last about two more years.

  122. I'll do this in bullet points to make it easy.<br /><br />- The shave I get from this shaver is great. One of the best I've gotten with an electric.<br />- I have sensitive skin, and with previous electrics, I couldn't shave within 24 hours of a previous shave due to razor burn/sensitivity. For some reason, with this shaver, that's not an issue at all. Worth the money right there!<br />- Battery monitor is great! Always good knowing if your shaver is about to die.<br />- The wet/dry convenience is a plus. I don't shave in the shower at all, but it makes it easy to clean.<br />- Ergonomically pleasing.<br />- Swivel head is a benefit for some, but I prefer it in the locked position.<br />- The battery isn't that great. I get about 5 to 6 shaves out of it before needing a charge. Their numbers are based off a 2-3 minute shave, but I don't know any guy who can get a good shave with an electric in 2 minutes.<br />- With that said, the shaves with this shaver are shorter than my previous. Definitely less passes to get it close.<br />- Hair pulls do happen, mainly due to the design of the 3rd center blade. Nothing regular, but once in a while you'll get one.<br />- The razor does get hot, which does not feel nice in more sensitive spots (upper lip, under ear).<br />- The plug is quite large, so not exactly travel friendly.<br />- The razor is loud, with a high pitched squeal.<br /><br />Overall, I am quite please with the purchase. One of the better foil shavers out there!

  125. I feel it necessary to write a review of the Panasonic ES8103S shaver because I heavily based my purchase on such reviews. I have had the shaver now for about one month with about twelve shaves completed. Never having owned an electric razor before, I heeded the advice of many others plus the manufacturer to give my skin at least three weeks to adjust due to the different type of shaving. The shaver does great on my face and jaw line but the neck is a completely different story. My neck was left extremely irritated around the collar line (where my beard ends) each time I have used the shaver. I have tried every method that I have read about to include: using 'Lectric Shave, Shave Secret, wet shave in shower (with and without shaving cream), dry shave, before shower, after shower, in the evening, in the morning, and even during the middle of the day and each time produced the same result; a very close shave on face and jaw line but an extremely irritated neck line. As far as the shaver itself, it's a very good shaver, good quality, although the trimmer on the back of the unit is worthless. Overall, I was pleased with its performance although it does take at least twice as long to shave with an electric versus a blade and it didn't perform well on the neck. If you don't have sensitive skin, you may not have a problem but if you do, beware. I'll be switching back to a manual.

  132. This is a solid shaver that provides a close shave. Likes: size, feel, flexible head, charge indicator, and close shave. Less than optimal: sound, charger cord, and travel case. I gave this a 5 star rating despite the fact that there are some things that could be improved. Thus, I would happily buy it again; however, in a perfect world I would change the following:<br />- Sound - the sound is like a cross between an amplified mosquito (80%) and an electric grass shear (20%). It's also a little louder than my other electric razors. Nevertheless, it didn't bother me that much initially, and I got used to it within a couple of weeks to the point where it doesn't bother me anymore. Ideally, I would make the sound quieter.<br />- Charger cord - I prefer the old style cords that are curled, can stretch, and simply plug in to the wall without a converter. I don't travel abroad that much, and when I do, I bring a converter, so being able to plug into a wall outlet directly in essentially any country isn't that valuable of a feature to me. I would prefer a smaller plug in cord when traveling. This is particularly true because a fully charged battery lasts me about 2+ weeks with everyday use that likely exceeds my time for any/most travels abroad. That said, this is probably the best of bunch in terms of shavers that can plug into any electrical supply. The charger/converter section measures about 2 cm wide x 6 cm long x 6.5 cm deep, which seems smaller than most. Even with the converter as is, I would prefer a curled cord versus the straight cord.<br />- Travel case - this seems much smaller and flimsy compared to travel cases of the past. It's is made of cloth. Currently, I am using a flexible (yet stronger / more durable) travel case from a previous razor to hold this razor, and this razor's travel case to hold the power cord. This travel case isn't designed to hold both.<br />One other design features that I would change is that the charger indicator goesdown fairly evenly until 10%. At 10%, the indicator seems to last twice, possibly more, as long as at any other level. This seems typical of most consumer gauges these days including car gas gauges; however, I would prefer one that meauures consistently at all levels.<br />All things considered, I am very happy with this razor.
  133. I found this gem on[...]. On my face I use an Murker double edge razor. But because of the sensitivity on my head I had to choose another option. I've tried other electric razors, all of which fall short of my expectations. Then after much research I found the Panasonic ES8103S. Delivery was quick, and was everything I hoped for in a shaver for my head. The hair on my head is coarse, so one concern was battery life.   134. this $81 shaver was my 3rd panasonic. the $30, $50, and $80 versions shave the same to me, just differing in options. this $81 version's power indicator broke on me after almost 3 years. i just bought the $50 version again, since it has a more reliable old school lcd display instead. the $30 version doesn't have a power indicator, different foil design, perhaps weaker motor, longer charging time and no travel pouch. the replacement foil and blades cost around $35.
  135. Like many men I HATE shaving. I have been on a quest for a better shaver for many years. Cannot use a blade due to irritation and ingrown hairs. I have tried several Brauns (dry shaving) and have always been disappointed at the short blade life and high cost. Panasonic wet shavers have been better, but with this current model ES 8103 I am absolutely amazed at how comfortable a wet shave (with lather) is. Many of you may think, \\"Why should I go to the trouble of using lather when I bought an electric shaver?\\". I can give two good reasons: 1) Your shave will be so smooth that you may be able to get by shaving every other day as I have, and 2) The blades last much longer because of the lubrication the lather provides. I am at 4 months now and cannot even notice any dulling, whereas most dry Braun shavers dropped off after one month and were useless in 6. Replacement blades are very expensive, typically half the cost of the shaver. The only thing that does not hold up to Panasonic's claims is the battery life on a charge - it is 3 to 4 shaves for me compared to the 12 or more promised, but I do not really care about this - it is quick and easy to recharge. A great product that has improved my quality of life!

  140. The first shaver I've ever had which I am allowed to get wet. At first, you feel kind of worried water will destroy it but after many 'trials,' it becomes second-nature. Panasonic does not try to force you into a lot of expensive cleaning cartridges, filled with rubbing alcohol as far as my nose can tell, like the Braun people do. The Braun cartridges, stretched out, will last about 2 months but still they cost me about $15 or so per cartridge. Those days are OVER! Panasonic instructs you to simply drop some liquid soap (I use handsoap) onto the foil, then run the razor to lather it up. Next, pull off the foil-cover housing and rinse it all out. It comes out clean and you can just let everything air-dry. One complaint, which prevents my rating this at 5-stars, is the side-trimmer. The trimmer in the Braun did work much better. I used it for everything, neck-grooming, beard maintenance, moustache fixing, you name it. The Panasonic does not seem to have a sharp enough blade on their trimmer. So for those things I switch back to the Braun. I guess you have to go with whatever works best for you. I have had this one a few weeks now and I have done two recharges on it; hoping the battery will last even longer once it can 'stretch its legs' a bit. Good, clean shave. 11/2013 update: for what it's worth, this continues to be a solid product. Very pleased with it. 4/2016 update: after years of virtually daily use, I think this needs a new foil block. Other than that, it works like new. Great product.
  141. I have been a Braun user for nearly 16 years and I must say that Braun makes a great shaver and it travels well and is sturdy. However, I have always had a problem with fine facial hair and getting a close shave with the Braun. When my most recent Braun died I looked around and this Panasonic kept coming up with high reviews. While I like a corded/cordless model I decided that this cordless would work out well (I do a lot of world travel and preferred to have a cord when power was undependable). I have NO REGRETS in purchasing this model. The shave is smooth, quick and close (even with fine chin hair). Besides the high pitched sound of the nano tech motor (it sounds like a mosquito on steroids) the razor out performs anything I have ever owned (I have been a Norelco, Remington, and Braun owner). This razor works quickly, is nicely shaped, fits my hand very well, gives a good readout on the battery level, and recharges fast, even for a quick shave. The ability to lock or float the head is an added nice feature for different parts of the chin and face and is very easy to clean. Highest recommendations to Panasonic for great new shaver!

  144. I have had several different shavers over the years from rotary to foil. I was never able to find one that can adequately shave my neck. I swore off electric for years until I bought this one on a whim. This razor shaves great. It shaves my neck better than any other razor and shaves just as close as my Mach 3. The battery life on it is really good so I don't have to constantly charge it and it cleans easy under the faucet. All in all very happy with it and the wife likes it because I'm willing to shave more often.
  145. This one is the same as the Norelco rotor that I had before this one. The Norelco had issues with the neck and didn't do a good job in that area. This one is the same. I thought going from rotor to foil would help but it is the same. I will still use thise one for a while as I like the fact that it is a wet shaver that I can use with a shaving cream. But, after 2 years, I'm going back to the traditional approach of no electrical shavers. So, in short, it really depends on the structure of face and neck region. Nothing wrong with the shaver.
  146. Did not shave good AT ALL!!!!
  147. Great shaver, this is the second one I have owned of this model. The first one I bought six years ago. I only bought this new one because of the sale price, and I figure the batteries in the original may be getting close to the end. The shave is great wet or dry. The thing to remember is that after about three years you should replace the blades. Will make it shave like new again.
  148. Yep, the Panasonic Nano shaver is the best I've ever used, and by a fairly wide margin. I'm 58, have a medium beard, and average face. I've used most everything over the years, including a number of Remingtons, 2 Brauns, Gillette razors (blades), and, most recently, 3 different Norelcos. They all had their pluses and minuses, but only the Panasonic has it all. Quick, comfortable, and for me, close as a blade. [I know, staunch blade users will dispute that last comment; however, my wife of 37 years agrees - take it up with her.] I've used it dry, wet, and with shaving cream - in my case, I much prefer using cream to shave. I've read where people ask why bother using cream? Well, for the same reasons you use cream with a blade: comfort and closeness. [If you wonder what it's like to use a Panasonic wet/dry shaver with cream, a gent posted a YouTube video, and the guy nails it.] My only regret is that I waited this long to try it. I always thought it must be a gimmick, but for me, it works great - highly recommended. Bob G.
  149. I bought this razor for my husband for Christmas. I did a lot of research because I didn't want to buy anything that was junk and not work on his beard. He works in construction and outside and he only has time to shave about every 3 days so he needed a razor that would cut through a thick beard and this one does it! It has a mustache side burn trimmer that pops out and you can use it wet or dry which he prefers dry. I bought this when it was on sale for under $100 and I could not have bought a better razor for him.
  150. I finally talked my husband into trying an electric. He has very sensitive skin and is very particular about the closeness of his shave. I have to say, he loves this razor! Shaving in the shower, he's able to shave almost as close as a razor, but his skin has NO irritation. It take a bit longer as he has to shave the same area multiple times, but what a difference! He'll never go back to regular razors again. This thing rocks!
  151. I have tried just about every shaving method that you can name(straight blade, double edge safety razor , fusion 5 ....) and I would have to say that this shaver really dose hit the mark. I would not compare it to a straight blade (the king of all shaves , but takes a good amount of skill, time, and upkeep), but I would say with 100% confidence that it beat my fusion blade by a small margin. If I would have to rank it out of all the types of shaves I listed, it would be #3, with straight blade coming in at #1 and safety razor at #2. I think that is insanely amazing for an electric razor , Panasonic has done a great job with this little wonder. My face still feels fairly smooth after a good 8 hours. I would say I fall in line with medium facial hair and I am not sure how it would perform if you were the beast man? It even did a good job around the neck (2-3 passes). The only con I see is the battery life; which does a good 9 shaves and will probably go down to about 6 after a year of usage. That is not such a big deal to me though since it has a quick 5 min charge for a single shave and takes only an hour to get a full charge. I honestly can recommend this shaver and Panasonic has won me over as they kept their word with what was advertised. Happy shaving!!
  152. + close shave + less irritation + easy cleaning + wet/dry operation - surprisingly loud - takes several passes for best result - requires some skin pushing/pulling for best angles - in the end, still takes same amount of shaving time

  154. I bought it at 'today's deal' and like it. It's slim and powerful! And reasonable price.
  155. I recently bought Panasonic ES8103S and very pleased with the closeness and comfort. Wet shave is much nicer than the dry shaving I have been using for years. My first electric shaver was a Philips 3 head rotary model, switched to Braun 3525, Braun 3-2-1, Braun 7525, and Braun 8575. Panasonic ES8103S is not the top of of the line shaver, but it performs better than anything I have tried so far. I am sure I'll move on to a newer Panasonic model in the near future.

  158. I used to shave with a straight razor, but after I had a few strokes my hand was not so steady. After charging the Panasonic up I had my first shave and let me say to any one thinking about purchasing an electric shaver. The Panasonic ES8103S Arc3 has given me the closest shave since I shaved with the straight razor. I strong recommend this razor to any one thinking about purchasing an electric razor. I had 2 other kinds of electric razor's & they did not shave my beard well. Also I searched for the best price and found it on Amozon. The Panasonic comes with a 2 year warranty so save the $7.50 on the extra protection & do not get it. That's my view on it.
  159. I have always used the Braun series shavers, the last one was their top-of-the-line self cleaning system. After about 5 or 6 years that broke and I have tried several other types. I just bought this brand and I am very pleased with it. It shaves closer than the Braun, I use less time in shaving, and it's easy to clean. I've always had a few stragglers that get missed and grow long, this shaver doesn't do that - it never misses a hair. It claims a 'one-pass' shave, which is a small exaggeration, but not by much.
  160. I've had it for a few weeks, and so far, so good. Most importantly, the blades are very sharp, and as a result I haven't yet had an incidence of ingrown hair, something that my old razor was doing a lot. It functions well wet or dry. Sometimes I have to go over an area many times, but only once or twice if I stretch the skin (hard to do without a mirror in the shower). The charge lasts more than a week; I didn't bother to bring the charger on my 1 week business trip to Europe. The charge indicator is nice. Update Jan 2012: It is still my favorite razor. It still charges quickly and lasts for many shaves. It's the only one I've had that lasted this long with regular use in the shower. The only thing is that the display is dim and difficult to read. Moisture gets in and some of the segments fail intermittently (so far they've always come back eventually).
  161. Very good shaver for the money. It may not have the most blades or other bells and whistles, but I can get a very close shave with it. My previous shaver was the ES8109 model, which I have had for 5 or 6 years and continues to work well. (The ES8109 is exactly the same shaver as the ES8103, but includes the automatic cleaner, which stopped functioning several years ago). Rather than buy another set of replacement blades and a screen for over $30, I decided to buy a new shaver altogether for about $65.
  162. I waited a long time to buy an electric razor again while continuing to use a blade razor. I finally purchased the Panasonic and am very pleased. I really like the wet or dry feature. I have very sensitive skin and often cut myself with the blade razor. With the Panasonic I have no problems. I can lather up or use a pre-electric lotion without concern of cutting myself. In addition the razor charges in very short time.

  165. I have tried Norelco, Braun and Panasonic. I had an old Panasonic that I upgraded to a Braun 8595. From day one I found that the Braun didn't give as close a shave as the Panasonic. However, the battery charge lasted forever and I liked the self cleaning station. Over time, the 8595 broke down a couple of times and I had to go back to the old Panasonic. I was amazed at how close a shave I got in comparison. Recently, the foil broke on the Braun 8595 and I decided to purchase this Panasonic ES8103S. From the first shave, I was instantly WOWed. I love this shaver and will never use another brand again. It shaves almost as close as a Mach 3 razor in much less time and without the irritation. It charges fast, is easy to clean and very lightweight, making it an exellent choice for home or traveling. I would be shocked if someone doesn't like this shaver....

  168. I have shaved with gillette blades for over 15 years now, and suffered most of it. After two days of shaving, used to leave my skin burning. With this panasonic razor, shaving is no pain at all. Even when shaving every day of the week. I shave wet with Panasonic ES8103S, with a thin layer of shave gel and lots of water. It gives a very close shave, more when shaving against the grain. The only place where I still use blades for touch up is bottom edge of my neck. For some reasons this razor is unable to catch all hair on the neck, no matter which direction I rock this.
