  171. Recently purchased The Panasonic ES8103S Shaver from Amazon. I received it two days ahead of the projected delivery date. Great service! This shaver is fantastic. Some 12-15 years ago I used a single head foil induction charging Panasonic which I loved but the charging mechanism failed so I replaced it with a double head corded Remington ($15 at Target). This was sort of an interim replacement until I could make up my mind whether or not I would go back to blades. What a clunker ! Later I replaced it with a Braun single head foil shaver ($35 at Walmart). This shaver was not all that bad - but not all that good, either. It was not easy on the face like the Panasonic. Instead of gliding over the face, you could feel the roughness as it shaved the whiskers. By late in the day, a touch up shave would be required if you were going out. Not the case with the ES8103S. Shave close in the morning - no pulling, no burn and no touch up necessary later on in the day. At $79, this shaver I am convinced is the best buy out there. The pop-up trimmer works very well on sideburns and does not nick the skin like the Braun. Cleaning this shaver is quite easy. Remove the head, blow out the whiskers and you're through. The digital screen in addition to indicating remaining battery life (6-7 confortable shaves per charge) also tells you when to wash the unit with handsoap and water which is quite easy. In summary, I am very happy with my purchase and highly recommend this shaver.
  172. I've got a tough beard and sensitive skin so this is perfect for me. Had this since before Christmas, no issues so far.
  173. I am 63 and my skin is a lot more tender and subject to cuts than when I was younger. I have been using electric razors off and on for about forty years - Primarily Norelco but also Remington, Braun and Toshiba. During those forty years I did not notice any significant change in the quality of the shave or the pulling, picking and burning that came from shaving certain facial sections over and over again. Panasonic takes electric shavers to a level that is comparable to a blade (which still gives the closest shave) without the mess and pain. I was not sure it was working until I felt the smoothness of the shave. Shaving is much quicker because there are few do overs and it does not irritate sensitive skin. A remarkable and greatly needed advance in electric shavers.<br /><br />Update November 15, 2011<br />I replaced the blades and foil after 2 years. There was some improvement in performance but overall, a disappointment. Now it's just an average shaver. I don't know how long an electric razor is supposed to last at peak performance but 2 years was my experience. No regrets.
  174. This is for the ES8103S model [[ASIN:B001DNE3KQ Panasonic ES8103S Pro-Curve Wet/Dry Rechargeable Linear Pivot Action Shaving System, Silver]] I've used Norelco and Braun products for over the past 15 years and this is the best shaver ever. Not as close as my Mach-3 or Fusion blades but faster. PROs: - Fast, took less than 3min to shave my whole face - No pain on my neck, unlike all other razors I've owned - Dry/Wet shaver. I haven't tried it wet yet but I like the option. CONs: - A little hard to shave at my upper-lip to nose area but nothing worse that other electrics - Won't run off the charger cord - No charger stand like my last Braun and Norelco had but I'm glad to give it up for a better shave Notes: - These comments are from my initial shave, I'll try to remember to update later when I've had more experience. The documentation, like every other razor, says it may cause irritation for the first few weeks or so but not for me.
  175. I purchased this model to replace my old Panasonic Linear which had finally come to the end of it's life, to which I thought I would be getting one equal to what I was used to. I wanted a shaver that was wet/dry capable and would provide a comfortable and close as shave as possible to a hand razor. Little did I know that this new Panasonic was far superior in how it cuts for a truly razor close shave with total comfort. The digital readout on the handle is a plus as well in telling you how much battery life is available in addition to indicating when it should be cleaned. Clean up is so simple and easy by just putting a drop of liquid soap on the shaver head, turn on, let it foam, shut off and rinse. Thats it and it looks and smells fresh as new. I could not be happier with this product and highly recommend it :).
  176. I have shaved with an electric razor for decades using Norelco shavers. This ES8103S gives me the best shave I have ever gotten with a electric. It give a fast and close shave every time. I have used it wet and dry and get a good shave either way. While running, it makes a funny buzzing noise with different tone when it is cutting. Therefore you can tell when it has finished with an area. That is usually only one or two passes. A charge lasts for ten or more shaves and it recharges quickly. The charge indicator is great for knowing when a charge will be needed. My only complaint is the position of the trimmer. It is on the back of the razor. If it were closer to the end of the razor it would be easier to trim areas such as the hairs in the ears and nose.
  177. I saw this shaver on a steep discount and I decided to try electric for a first time in my life (35yrs old). My beard is strong, and it would scratch my skin when shaving with razor, so I had to take 3-4 days breaks between shaves. With Panasonic that doesn't happen. PROS: - I shave every day with very little irritation, if any. - No ingrown hair. - Easy and inexpensive to clean (had to do it once in 7+ days) - Fairly silent (but loud compared to razor :)). SEMI-CONS: - Takes more time to shave vs. razor (couple minutes more, no big deal) - Neck area is tough to get right/smooth - One charge is enough for 4-5 shaves (far from 10-13 they advertise), but it's not a big deal, since battery charges in under 1h (I don't know if the fast charge is going to kill battery faster). A definite buy, but not for $140+
  178. I purchased this particular shaver after researching the best shavers for African American men. It was becoming expensive to replace the blades for my &#34;Gillette Turbo II&#34; razor. Especially at $17 a pop for just 4 blades per pack! Even at Walmart! The price for the Panasonic was not bad for the quality at all. Shipping as always was lightning fast from Amazon! It shaves close and is excellent when using shaving gel. Doesn't always get as close as the Gillette so I did not give it a 5th star. But, I am NOT complaining. It more than meets my needs and recharges pretty quickly as well. I notice I shave more often because this is one very nice shaver!
  179. I had this now 1 month. I was going to replace \\"shaver head set\\" of my Norellco shaver. It was almost $40 and battery would be still the old one. So I changed my mind to bet on this Panasonic. It shaves better than Norellco and most of all I can clean the shaver with regular liqid soap and water(no need expensive cleaning solution).   180. I bought this to replace my Panasonic ES8067, which lasted at least 9 years. Loved the old razor, and had been able to buy replacement cutting heads to keep it fresh, but this year the battery finally stopped holding a charge. My only complaints about the old razor were the noise, and that I did have to make multiple passes around the neck / Adams' apple to get a close shave. The new shaver's PROS are that it is lighter and quieter. However, the CONS are that it is lighter because it is all plastic, even the head surrounding the cutting blocks. This gives it a much cheaper, flimsier feel than the old razor. My old one survived a couple of knocks off the counter over the years -- -- unlikely the new razor will fare as well. Second, while quieter, it seems to be because the motor is a lot less powerful. The cutting blocks don't seem to oscillate as quickly, and the motor actually slows down as I get to the denser section of my chin. I'm just shaving the day's stubble off - not a full beard or anything, but the new razor struggles and I can feel the hairs pulling before they get cut off. Quite unpleasant. Plus, I'm now having to make multiple passes on all planes of my face just to get a reasonably close shave. Finally, though the manual says you'll get \\"about 14 shaves\\" to a full charge, I was already down to 60% after the first 3 shaves. Again, that is probably because of having to make multiple passes. All in all, disappointing, and am seriously contemplating a return of this one.
  181. This is my second Panasonic shaver. The first still charges and runs after a few years of use but the blades are dull and it didn't have the trimmer so I replaced it with a cheap razor but it wouldn't hold a charge. This one's going strong after nearly a year and I only have to charge it every few weeks with light use. Got it on sale but I'd probably replace it at full price if I had to.
  182. Bought this for my husband for Christmas this year. He's a soldier, so he has to shave EVERY single day, and he was always saying he wanted an electric razor. It's not the top of the line, and it's not an el cheapo. Considering he is using it every single day, it's holding up just great! He said the razor might be getting a little dull, cause it takes a little longer to shave than it did when he first started using it, but he still loves it. I know he's planning on taking it with him on his next deployment to make his life a little easier. It charges SUPER fast, and is very very very easy to clean. It's a GREAT gift for your husbands, ladies. Definitely worth the price :)
  183. I've shaved electric since 1962. Shick, Sunbeam, 3 Norelcos, 3 Remingtons, 2 previous Panasonics. The Panasonics were the best for speed, comfort, closeness. So when my last Panasonic wore out (needed head parts, cost more than it was worth) I spent 3 hours reading reviews on their current line before buying ES8103S. I also looked at 'value' lines like Remington, but reviews sounded like what I would have said about my old ones. I never found the Norelcos really satisfactory; slow, irritating, not close, but they're quiet. ES8103S is quiet. It just buzzes slightly. The linear motor is fast and efficient and there are virtually no mechanicals to wear out. The battery is lithium-ion so it won't have the premature aging of the previous nickel-cadmiums. The design is little different from my previous Panasonics, same head dimensions. The motor is slightly faster. An LCD display shows how much charge is left. An average shave takes 10% of capacity, so ES8103S can shave for aprx a week between charges. There is not a cleaner/charger stand for ES8103S. That's what brings it down into value pricing, especially with Amazon discounts. Charge time is ~1 hour. Panasonics can be used wet or dry, but I have not used them wet so can't comment on that. Other than it's not advisable to leave them in a wet environment after use. The speed, comfort, closeness used dry are the best of all the shavers I've used. ES8103S is the best shaver I've owned, WITHOUT being the most expensive. If you'd like a little more bell/whistle factor, get ES8243A, essentially the same thing gussied up, but costs roughly twice and according to one review the renewal parts (screens and cutters) cost much more than the ~$25 for ES8103S.
  184. This is by far the best electric razor I have ever used. I have very sensitive skin that gets razor burn and cuts very easily when using normal fusion razors. I also shave my head every few days and the first time I tried this shaver I was blown away at how close it gets with only a few passes. No nicks, no razor burn, just super smooth. I don't think I will ever go back to normal razors. Only drawback I see is its a bit loud but who cares it works great.
  185. I love this shaver, everything as the ad said. Easy to use, easy to charge, quite and good shave.
  186. This was a bad investment. I was originally going for a Norelco Rotary, but most reviews warned that the foil could fall off from the blades and you could get cut or that the razor itself was made of cheap material. Anyway based on the panasonic reviews I decided to try this razor. I have sensitive skin and this had the best reviews from those who said they didn't get any bumps and they have sensitive skin. The first day I did a dry shave. It is not a 1 pass razor, I was left with a couple patches of hair. The manual requires you give at least 30 days for your face to get accustomed to the razor. As the days went by, the razor performed progressively worse. I changed the blades to make sure I did not get an old blade with the razor. Now it is well past 30 days. I bought this last december. Whether wet or dry the razor does not shave my beard on the first pass, the second pass, third pass, I really have to dig the razor into my face to get the hair off, I have tried shaving cream, shaving gel, shaving oil and nothing helps. After, I am left with severe razor bumps. I have since gone back to my mach 3 razor. 1 pass and I am finished. The panasonic is now gathering dust in a corner.
  187. I have been a Braun user for more than a decade, when it was recommended to me as exceptionally good for sensitive skin. And it was. The latest Braun I have been using is the 7570, and I have been using it for at least seven years. But it is aging. The battery lasts for about 1/3 of what it used to, and the shave does not feel as close or as smooth as it did originally. I have changed the blades and screen on avg. about every 1.5 years. So I have been looking to replace it. I don't want to buy one that comes with the stand and cleaning built into the stand. Braun is quite expensive; none of what I see of Braun today seems to suggest that it will be similar to what I have. Also the reviews for the current Brauns are not that good. So when I saw the Panasonic ES8103S Pro for close to $50 I got interested. I read the reviews and it seemed like the shave was good and smooth, and what was most important for me is how good it seemed to be with sensitive skin. I purchased the Panasonic ES8103S and I have been using it for 2 weeks. Here are my thoughts: The shave is smoother and less irritating than any electric shaver I have used, including the Braun. It is also much lighter than the Braun. However, everything else about this shaver is not so good. I will enumerate: The trimmer is narrow and does not perform as well as the shaver. The battery is very poor. After four shaves I had 40% left. The shaver is loud. Does not have a safety switch to prevent the on/off from going on, so that when it is in your suitcase or carry on you can expect it to off, alerting TSA, worrying passengers, and draining your battery. The LCD that shows the amount of charge available only shows when the shaver is turned on. I would endure all these annoyances for a better, smoother shave. But the worst part is that this shave is built like such crap, if this falls there is no need to pick it up. It's some cheapo plastic. What a contrast to the Braun. I had seen others mention this in their reviews but I didn't realize to what extent. Now I have a dilemma. I like the shave but not the quality of the machine. I would pay more for the same shaver that was built better. But the next in line of the Panasonic (ES8243A and ES-LA63-S) use 4 blades which I would prefer to stay away from, plus I don't know why to expect that they are built any better. The shaver box says that there is a 30 days money back; I think I will try that. If anyone has a suggestion please leave comment.

  199. I've been using electric shavers for over 25years. I've tried every brand and type. I don't expect a \\"blade shave\\" when I use one but it's quicker. And the shaver itself is a quality piece of equipment. I'm impressed. I can recommend it without reservation.
  200. I've been using the Panasonic for about 3 weeks. This is the first foil shaver I've tried, having used nothing but rotary types before. I was pleasantly surprised at how close the shave was and how little pressure is required. I really like the waterproof design--makes clean-up a snap. Battery life could be improved, but at least it lets you know when you're getting low on battery thru the battery indicator. I wholeheartedly recommend this shaver.
  201. Pros: - easy to clean - battery lasts 2 weeks - nice battery status indicator - the shave is as good as other razors I've used - pretty good price Cons: - the power supply is a little noisy while charging -- it's such a minor issue but it's the only thing I could think of that's wrong with this razor
  202. This is the third Panasonic shaver in 15 years. They are just excellent. But over time, like me, they get a little slower, a little nosier, and have to be replaced. Superior product with replacement blades and head when needed.
  203. This item was purchased for a nineties-something man who knows shaving. He uses the shaver everyday and just loves it. We haven't heard any complaints from his wife either!
  204. When I first got this razor, I thought it was decent quality. This was the first electric razor I've ever had and it did an decently smooth shave. However, I had to go over the same spot numerous times in order for it to be smooth and it was hard to get the hairs on the neck. Up until this point I was content with my purchase, however, that all changed. The shaver stopped working after less than a dozen shaves! All I did was use it in the shower and now there's water inside the display. The reason I say I don't think I'll ever buy a Panasonic again is because this is the third Panasonic product I've had issues with. Back when I was in HS I bought a Panasonic Deck for my car, after about 6 mo's the digital display stopped working. About 2 years ago I bought a Home entertainment surround sound system and after a couple months the dvd player started acting up. So far I'm unimpressed with the quality of Panasonic products.
  205. It is very quite compared to the traditional electric and you get a close shave. It is also very sharp and I feel that this can mow down any beard. I would have you consider stepping up to the next step for a few bucks to get one extra shaving foil. I took one star off due to it not coming with any travel case, instead it comes with a useless thin cloth pouch.
  206. I purchased this shaver specifically for head shaving in the shower and I'm very pleased with it for that application. For those times when I want to head shave without using a Mach 3 blade, I really like this razor. The wet shaving with regular shaving creme is easy on the skin and close enough. Battery life is quite good although it does self-discharge at about 10%/week although this might improve as the battery is used more. The wet/dry feature is fabulous and I wouldn't buy a shaver that couldn't be used in the shower, it's just too convenient. I did try a wet face shave but found this shaver, like all other electrics I have tried, just can't compare to a blade. But for head shaving the skin is tighter and the curves are less so the shave is outstanding if hair is no more than 3 days long to begin. If the shave proves reliable I'll be very happy with it.
  207. I can't say it's the best you can buy, but of all the electric shavers I've ever owned and used (Braun, Norelco, Remington), this is the one to get. I have VERY sensitive skin and unfortunately cannot shave with a blade without breaking out into horrible, bloody, bumpy razor rash. I tried avery type of foam, gel and soap on the market. Boars hair brushes. Traditional safety razors, hi-tech multi blade guillotines. The results were always the same, and no matter how many days I allowed for my skin to become accustomed. Even on my wedding day, a professional barber left rash, and that man was a master. I tried a Norelco rotary-style shaver first, which left a lot of stubble and pulled the whiskers. I ended up using it for a while anyway because I just didn't know any better. After a few years I traded up for a Braun, which was my first foil shaver. It did a much better job on my tough facial hair, but left razor burn on my neck, to the point I could only shave every other day at most. I tried several kinds of pre-shave balms, oils and creams to help. Limited success there. Finally, I stepped up to the Panasonic. It's a wet/dry shaver, so I started off using it in the shower with a shaving foam. Perfect. I eventually found that I could shave totally dry with little to no irritation and get almost as close a shave. Slap on some moisturizer and you're good to go. I've had this particular one for about three years now, after dropping my original in the shower and breaking it. It's actually pretty tough, aside from that one incident. The screen has held up perfectly (the Braun screen would lose bits here and there, causing the shaver block to grab and chop little bits of skin). So has the battery. I still only need to charge it once a week. The digital battery-life meter has been a lifesaver, too. It's easy to clean (I don't have the cleaning base) with just a little hand soap. The ONLY gripes I have... you can't use it while it's plugged in and charging. That said,this thing charges up extremely quickly. I can easily get a usable charge, from totally dead, in the amount of time it takes me to shower. The trimmer is also pretty useless. It requires an esoteric level of technique for anything more arduous than a couple of stray hairs. Instead I just bought a cheapo trimmer that comes with several attachments for different jobs. Highly recommended. I can only pray Panasonic continues making shavers of this quality! Customer for life.
  208. I received this razor today and just had my first shave. The high ratings led me to purchase this, more expensive razor over, say, the $30 ones I normally buy. Because of this price difference and rave reviews, I expected something special -- or at least something better than a $30 electric razor. I am extremely disappointed with this product. My first shave was terrible. Not only did it not get anywhere near all my facial hair (which was short, hadn't shaved in 2 days prior), but it cut me up more than any razor I've ever used. I'm absolutely baffled. All the reviews promised a painless, smooth shave that is about as close as it gets for an electric razor. I found that today, I am glad I didn't throw out my $30 one, because in the end, it was the one that didn't act like a dysfunctional lawnmower. I plan on returning the product if possible. $80 is far too much to pay for this product.
  209. I had to upgrade from a 4 year old Norelco since the replacement blades cost more than the razor was worth. So I researched for a few weeks and decided on this Panasonic. I've had it for a few months now and it has done a great job on my thick stubble. It charges very fast and is easy to clean. The only drawback is if I let my beard grow for over 3 or 4 days it is very hard to trim it down with the beard trimmer to cut with the regular foil blades. So I do need to shave more often but it gets a much closer shave than my previous electric. Works great wet or dry.
  210. bought this on 12/21/2009 and replaced the blades/foil just once. I shave 5 times a week, at least. This system still works as new.
  211. I had a remington rotary and a norelco rotary before that. The norelco had battery failure and the remington had a cleaning system that also charged the unit. I liked the cleaning system but a short time after buying the razor the stores stopped selling the cleaning solution. I mixed my own cleaning solution for some time until I saw this razor that you clean by throwing some liquid soap on it and rinsing it off. Sold. Not only is the maintenance effortless it gives a fantastic shave with no drag. The rotary razors did not do good in the areas under the nose. This one gets in close and fits nice in the hand. The rotary felt more like a power tool in your hand. All in all I would say that I am pleased with this product and if the longevity is good I will buy another when the time comes.

  214. [[ASIN:B001DNE3KQ Panasonic ES8103S Pro-Curve Wet/Dry Rechargeable Linear Pivot Action Shaving System, Silver]] Best shaver I have ever used. I have had many different brands of shavers over the years and none can compare with this shaver. After a shave my face feels like I used a blade razer. I would recomment this shaver to anyone.
  215. I have been using electric shavers for over 30 years now and have tried many of them. Never tried this type of head before but after some good reviews and the discounted price I thought I would give it a try. Now I can see why its discounted. It takes MUCH longer to get the same shave as with a rotary head. The manual says to use with an up and down motion and to pull the skin tight. With a rotary this is not required as you can move the razor in any direction to achieve quicker results. The razor is a bit noisy and cumbersome to hold compared to the shape of most rotary razor bodies. Norelco razors are much easier and timely to clean by just holding the open head under running water. To clean this razor the manual shows several steps you should take to clean including the use of a hand soap and running the razor with the sonic speed. Also you CANNOT use this razor while charging or plugged in. They do not tell you that in the description! Think twice before replacing your old rotary type for this one.
  216. The shaver is great, light and charges quickly. It would have been nice if it came with a cleaning brush.
  217. After using disposable razors for the past fifteen years, I decided to return to an electric. I'd had enough of the scraped-raw feeling and the little droplets of blood. The reviews pointed to the Panasonic ES8103S as a good bet, so I gave it a try -- and I'm glad I did. It provides a very smooth, very comfortable shave. I can barely feel it gliding over my skin. I've charged it only once, and after using it a half dozen times, the charge indicator shows 90%. I should mention, however, that I have a very light beard, both in color and in density, and therefore don't need a particularly close shave. I don't know how well this shaver would perform when challenged with a heavier beard. But if your beard is light, as is mine, this model seems perfect.

  221. I checked reviews a lot before buying this. That's why I'm writing one, too. I've had all major brands in the past. My Norelco was so-so, my Braun was better, my Remington was a joke. I think rotary types will never be as good as straight heads, as a technical matter. I was sold on the linear motor for this - I knew speed of the blade matters. I can say that even more surely now. It is a critical reason why this is the best. Yes, the blades are very sharp, and well designed. Love the battery power sensor, and wash/charge reminders. By the way, for a 4 minute shave, you'll get around 10-11 good shaves. I'm amazed at how long this runs for such a high speed motor. It also doesn't slow down progressively as the battery runs lower. I've used this for 6 months, and if I lost this one, I'd buy another just like it. I got mine for about $65. Not sure what could improve this. Get it.
  222. The shaver is great. It just want work with the cord plugged up.
  223. I have had this razor for about a month, and I use it dry. So far, I've been very impressed with the close shave that it provides.   224. After using various Phillips/Norelco rotary shavers for most of my adult life, I finally got tired of replacing a perfectly good shaver because the battery died. It really annoyed me that the battery is not user-replaceable. In fact, they make it such a hassle to send \\"back to the factory\\" for a 5 minute, $50 replacement fee, that takes two weeks even if I drop it off at the service center itself (obviously they think their customers are stupid, and will buy a replacement instead of going two weeks without a shave). I have purchased replacement batteries on Amazon and replaced them myself, but these cheap China replacement batteries don't last very long and are easily dislodged with regular use. So, on a leap-of-faith and excellent Amazon Reviews, I purchased a Panasonic ES8103S from Amazon and couldn't be happier. It provides a close, clean shave, at least for my normal beard. I use it in dry mode, but you can use it wet if you prefer. I particularly like the easy cleaning process - a few drops of liquid soap on the screen and blades , running at a higher-than-normal, cleaning vibration mode, cleans the screen and blades within a couple minutes - much easier and more effective than manually cleaning Norelco shavers. In short. I love this shaver, and will NOT go back to Phillips/Norelco.....ever!
  225. I guess I should start by describing the kind of facial hair that I have. I tend to grow facial hair slowly and it's the wiry, stiff, Asian kind of facial hair. I bought this Panasonic shaver because it's difficult for me to shave until the hair grows to a certain length. The reviews were saying that it gives a pretty close shave and I was hoping that an electric razor would be a lot faster and easier with fewer nicks. After using this shaver for several weeks, I'm finding that it doesn't work well for me at all. In order to get a close shave, I have to press pretty hard, and in doing so, I've managed to make myself bleed on several occasions! Instead of nicks though, they're more like tiny scrapes. Pressing harder also leaves me with pretty bad razor burn. The Panasonic also has the incredible ability to miss single hairs and leave very uneven, patchy shaves that I can't really fix because the hairs are too short. I've had to go back with my Mach 3 several times to get patches that this razor can't seem to cover.<br /><br />Basically, this razor doesn't work well for me. If you have a similar type of facial hair, you might have problems with it too.

I have one area that no shaver has been able to cut close and this is no different. That's the one difference between the electric and a manual blade. I clean it when it says it's time to clean and I charge it when it says it needs a charge. Simple as that. Love my Panasonic.

  230. As rechargable electric razors go, this is the best one I have used in the past 5 years. I bought an inexpensive Remington MS2 390 several years ago. It is only adequate and very loud. Two years ago I bought a Braun for around $80 but it does not shave very close and the charge does not last very long. So I decided to give this Panasonic ES 810S a try and it does shave closer and lasts for 5-7 shaves. It is comfortable to use and is advertised to use with water and shaving cream. I did that once and it was a close shave. However, I prefer to use it dry with a pre-shave lotion. I did not want to buy the liquid cleaning base which would need a constant refilling expense since I could just rinse this one off. It appears to be the same razor as the next one up which has the liquid base unit.   234. I purchased the Panasonic ES8103S one month ago and I like it. I have only used it in the \\"dry\\" mode. The oscillation frequency of the linear drive is significantly faster than that of the Remington MS3 3700 I used previously. This allows the razor to make more cuts per unit time for better coverage. In my estimation the tilt head may be an asset, but I'm not certain it's a necessity. If desired, the head can be locked to omit the tilt function. The Panasonic advertisement indicates it's a \\"one pass\\" shave. That may be true for some beards, but mine requires more than one pass. If I redesigned the razor, I would consider having three, full width blades and screens for greater coverage and fewer required passes. The charge indicator and alerts for cleaning and recharging are nice features. All in all, it's a very good and well constructed razor. I would buy it again.
  235. I purchased this razor about a month ago. It had gotten good reviews and was on sale so I thought I would give it a try. I have a pretty thick beard especially around the chin area. Although it takes multiple passes this razor cuts pretty good. I'm happy with the product except that the display appears to have gotten some moisture in it and stopped working (no longer shows charge percentage). I just sent it back to panasonic for an exchange. Hopefully this isn't a recurring problem with this model.
  236. This shaver gives a great shave, no question. Its why I gave it 3 stars. I've been using it for about a year now. I have owned several Panasonic wet/dry shavers and I would not buy another brand. The issues I have with this model are: 1. Its not much better than my previous model which does not have \\"nano\\" technology. 2. The little itty bitty trimmer sucks. 4. After less than a year the battery goes dead at about 30% capacity. 5. Took it with me to the Virgin Islands.   237. The Panasonic ES8103S is a fantastic electric shaver. I bought this to replace an older Panasonic shaver, which mysteriously died on a trip to Europe. This model shaves even better than the last, and I am very satisfied with it. I have only used it dry, however I suspect that a wet shave will be just as good, maybe better. Since I previously used a foil shaver, there was no \\"adjustment period\\"; it did not irritate my skin and it gives a great shave every time. No pulling, no nicking, no bleeding. The sonic cleaning mode seems to do a good job of keeping the blades clean, is easy to use, and does not take up space like some of those self cleaning models. When using it, I can tell that the blades are giving off some heat, as it is warm on my face. The only weakness in this shaver is it's performance on the neck, probably due to the shaver's inability to pivot front to back (it only pivots side to side, and up/down if you apply pressure). However, with a few passes and a little extra pressure, it still gets the job done. Overall, this is the best electric shaver I have ever used.
  238. Purchased to replace a Braun. I like this Panasonic much better. Shaves close and recharges quickly. Also, it is quieter than the Braun. I recommend it as a very good shaver.
  239. The Panasonic ES8103S Wet/Dry RechargeableElectric Shaver is a pretty good electric shaver. It does not shave as closely as a blade shaver, but it does not put slices on your face either. I find that it takes a little more time to shave in the shower than the Fusion blade number, but it is much safer. It is easy to clean, charges quickly and lets you know when to recharge it by the lighted percentage numbers on the handle. It seems well made. It does not come with a charging stand. I do not need the cleaning bath that some of these models come with. All in all, it is a good compromise betwween a blade and an electric shaver. It came promptly after the first attempt to deliver it came to naught because some nit-wit would not deliver it to the apartment house where I live in Anchorage, Alaska. I never did figure that one out. RMT

I started shopping for a replacement and decided on the Panasonic ES8103S after reading many reviews and have been relatively happy with it. While it has a pivot system for myself I have found that it works better if I lock it in place. My beard is mixed between very light and very heavy and the Panasonic does fairly well in all areas.   246. I was in the market for a rotary shaver, but read some very marginal reviews of them, including Norelco's latest product. So I decided to give this a try, mainly because of the wet-dry feature. It has not disappointed me at all. First, the electronics are outstanding on two counts: 1) it fully charges in less than an hour, and 2) it continues to run at full speed even as the battery discharges--the motor has the same output at 10% battery reserve that it does at 90% battery reserve. This is in stark contrast to my old Remington, which slowed down as the battery discharged, making shaving more and more uncomfortable each day. Second, the shave is exceptionally comfortable. I don't know if it's the design of the foil and blades, or if it's simply that the motor continues to run at full speed, but it's comfortable enough that I end up with a very close shave because I don't mind going over an area until it's cut. And third, I love the cleaning feature. Shaving in the shower doesn't necessarily give me a closer shave, but it sure does keep the shaver clean, so I can shave after I'm dressed and I don't have to worry about getting \\"beard dust\\" all over my shirt. This is a great product--a very good shave at a very reasonable price. You can't go wrong with this one.
  247. My husband loves this razor! Great buy
  248. I have been through a number of electric shavers, and read these reviews carefully before pulling the trigger. After a couple of weeks of using the Panasonic ES8103S, I figured I should chime in here.<br /><br />I realized this shaver was different when I first turned it ON. It generates a noticeably higher pitched sound than any electric shaver I've used. This is likely due to the high-speed, 13,000 RPM motor. True to many of the other reviews here, the quality of the shave is excellent, and really does rival the closeness of a blade. Something else worth mentioning: I find I it takes much less time to complete my shave these days - again, this is likely due to the high-speed motor. The rapidity of the shave is especially noticeable after a couple days of growth. My old shaver would take three or four passes to \\"gitterdone.\\"<br /><br />As for the \\"cheap\\" construction mentioned by a few reviewers, this shaver is indeed light-weight. I guess time will tell whether it holds up. However, I will say that my last shaver - an 9 month-old Braun that cost me $30 more than this Panasonic model - felt more solid, but literally fell apart in my hands after very little, light-duty use. So much for the \\"solid feel.\\"<br /><br />So, since this shaver is brand new, I can only base my opinion about construction quality on previous experience with Panasonic models. The first one I purchased (probably five years ago) lasted for nearly two years and only broke because I dropped it. I SHOULD have purchased another Panasonic, but I needed a replacement quickly and could not find anything locally. My local grocery store carries a ton of Braun models. Against my better judgment I purchased several, each time going up in price after the previous one stopped working. None of them lasted much more than a year. One of these was a travel shaver purchased for my trips to the athletic club. The foil tore after a few months. I tried to purchase a replacement foil, only to discover Braun had discontinued the shaver and all related spare parts. Nice. It is now safe to say that I have purchased my LAST Braun shaver.<br /><br />Speaking of travel shavers, I also own a Panasonic ES3833 wet/dry, battery-operated travel shaver. It was only $18, and included a nice, hard-shell carrying case. One big bonus: spare parts are available! I have been using it at the gym for about 6 months and have been VERY impressed. My positive experience with this shaver was the driving force behind my decision to purchase another Panasonic model.<br /><br />My only disappointment with this purchase is that the shaver comes with a soft cloth travel bag, rather than a hard case. So, if you are traveling, make sure you pack the shaver away safely.<br /><br />In summary, I think the ES8103S is a great buy. So far, I am pleased with the performance of this shaver and, based upon my experience with other Panasonic models, I am not concerned at all about the light-weight construction.ll related spare parts. Nice. It is now safe to say that I have purchased my LAST Braun shaver. Speaking of travel shavers, I also own a Panasonic ES3833 wet/dry, battery-operated travel shaver. It was only $18, and included a nice, hard-shell carrying case. One big bonus: spare parts are available! I have been using it at the gym for about 6 months and have been VERY impressed. My positive experience with this shaver was the driving force behind my decision to purchase another Panasonic model. My only disappointment with this purchase is that the shaver comes with a soft cloth travel bag, rather than a hard case. So, if you are traveling, make sure you pack the shaver away safely. In summary, I think the ES8103S is a great buy. So far, I am pleased with the performance of this shaver and, based upon my experience with other Panasonic models, I am not concerned at all about the light-weight construction.
  249. UPDATE 1/9/2017<br />I've had the razor for nearly 6 years now and the battery is kaput. I can get one, maybe two shaves and then it needs to be charged. It looks like replacement batteries are available for less than $20 but you'll need to be handy with a soldering iron. I'm not sure it's worth the trouble considering that it's a really noisy shaver and it makes quite a mess, dumping whiskers all over the counter and my shirt. I also don't like that it can't be used while it's plugged into the wall.<br />------------------------<br />I purchased the Panasonic ES8103S and the Norelco 1150x at the same time and this review is a comparison of these 2 shavers side-by-side. I used both shavers for 3 weeks, shaving one side of my face with the Panasonic and the other side of my face with the Norelco. I didn't switch sides during the test to allow time to adapt to each shaver. Both of these shavers rated nearly the same amongst other Amazon reviewers and were the top-2 rated shavers under $100. I evaluated both shavers on a number of criteria:<br /><br />-- Shaving Performance: I found that both shavers did a relatively good job overall. However, the Panasonic performed slightly better on the flat cheek areas whereas the Norelco did slightly better on the curved areas around the jaw bone and neck. I found that the shavers required different shaving techniques. The Panasonic, being a foil shaver, required an up-and-down or side-to-side motion whereas the Norelco, being a rotary shaver, required a circular motion. No matter how I shaved with the Norelco I could not get quite as close as the Panasonic. After some time I did find a technique with the Panasonic that allowed me to shave my neck and jaw bone area as close as the Norelco. I tried shaving both wet & dry and found no difference. I almost always shave dry and I found the Norelco didn't move as smoothly across the skin as the Panasonic. Overall, I give the edge to Panasonic for a better overall shave.<br /><br />-- Return Guarantee: The Panasonic has a 30-day return policy, the Norelco is 45 days. I actually purchased the shavers from Target and they offer a 90-day return policy.<br /><br />-- Warranty: The Panasonic has a 1 yr warranty, Norelco is 2 years.<br /><br />-- Cutter Replacement: both shavers recommend replacing the cutters at specific intervals. Panasonic recommends replacing the foil every year ($24) and the blade every 2 years ($17). Norelco has only one replaceable part which they recommend you replace every year ($39). If you look at the cost over 3 years, the Panasonic would cost $65 whereas the Norelco would cost $117 which exceeds the original cost of the shaver ($100).<br /><br />-- Charging: The Panasonic has an A/C adapter that can be plugged directly into the shaver and the shaver can be used with the cord attached. The Norelco can only be charged in the included charging cradle. If the battery in the Norelco goes dead you'll need to recharge it before you can use it. Also, the Panasonic has a digital LCD battery gauge whereas the Norelco simply uses LEDs.<br /><br />-- Cleaning: Both shavers can be rinsed under water for simple cleaning. I found the Norelco shaving head somewhat difficult to remove whereas the Panasonic foil was very easy to remove/replace.<br /><br />-- Price: Both shavers sell for under $100. Best price I found on the Panasonic was $80 @ Target. I saw the Norelco for $90 @ WalMart.<br /><br />-- Other: The Panasonic has a built-in trimmer, the Norelco requires that you remove the shaving head and pop on the trimmer head. The Panasonic includes a carrying case, the Norelco does not.<br /><br />In summary, the Panasonic rated higher than the Norelco in all areas with the exception of the warranty. My only real complaint with the Panasonic would be the noise. It is much louder than the Norelco but not so much so that I would return it. Based on my experience, I will be returning the Norelco and keepingthe Panasonic.<br /><br />2/21/13: Follow-Up<br />------------------<br />Hard to believe I've been using this shaver for over 2 years already. I've found some issues with the shaver that I wanted to append to my original review:<br /> -- The battery life indicator is difficult to see unless you're in a dark room and there is no audible alarm that indicates that the battery is getting low. The battery will go dead without warning and, since the shaver can't be used when the cord is attached, you're stuck waiting for the charge to complete until you can continue shaving.<br /> -- I commented on the noise in my original review. Maybe this is an issue with all foil shavers but I have found the Panasonic annoyingly loud.<br /> -- Again, maybe an issue with all foil shavers, but I have found that instead of catching the shaved off whiskers they are ending up all over the counter and my shirt. I don't recall this being as much of an issue when the shaver was new. I haven't yet replaced the foil or the blade so perhaps that's the problem.<br /> -- The battery seems to be losing some steam. I'm only able to get about 3 full shaves out of the unit before it needs to be recharged.<br /><br />3/12/13: Follow-Up<br />------------------<br />I just replaced both the foil and the blades and it really made a difference. I'm getting a closer shave and I didn't see a bunch of shavings on my shirt when I was done.the Panasonic.<br /><br />2/21/13: Follow-Up<br />------------------<br />Hard to believe I've been using this shaver for over 2 years already. I've found some issues with the shaver that I wanted to append to my original review:<br /> -- The battery life indicator is difficult to see unless you're in a dark room and there is no audible alarm that indicates that the battery is getting low. The battery will go dead without warning and, since the shaver can't be used when the cord is attached, you're stuck waiting for the charge to complete until you can continue shaving.<br /> -- I commented on the noise in my original review. Maybe this is an issue with all foil shavers but I have found the Panasonic annoyingly loud.<br /> -- Again, maybe an issue with all foil shavers, but I have found that instead of catching the shaved off whiskers they are ending up all over the counter and my shirt. I don't recall this being as much of an issue when the shaver was new. I haven't yet replaced the foil or the blade so perhaps that's the problem.<br /> -- The battery seems to be losing some steam. I'm only able to get about 3 full shaves out of the unit before it needs to be recharged.<br /><br />3/12/13: Follow-Up<br />------------------<br />I just replaced both the foil and the blades and it really made a difference. I'm getting a closer shave and I didn't see a bunch of shavings on my shirt when I was done.
  250. Simply put, this razor is the best I have owned. Most of the reviews will say the same thing, and there's nothing more I can say that hasn't been said. I will say that even consumer reports lists this razor as one of the best and for the price, it simply can't be beat. I have tried it, like the others, and I am sold. I only shave about 2-3 times a week and so after growth of a few days it cut my hair above satisfaction. There's still a few places on my face where I have to make a few passes but those are for the more thick whiskers. All in all, it will take less time and clean up is a breeze.
  251. I've been used this for 3 weeks and very happy with the product. If it can have less noise, that will be even better. Shave clean, easy to clean. 2 hours to fully charged and can be used for 10 days (for me). For this price, nothing I'd complain about it.
  252. I have a Braun 6520 that needed new batteries so as an interim shaver I purchased the Panasonic ES8103S from Amazon. When both shavers were operable I wanted to know which provided a closer shave. To do this I first shaved with one of the shavers then immediately followed this with a second shave with the other one. If the first shaver gave a better shave then I would not hear hair being cut with the second shaver. The next day I reversed the order of the shavers. In easy-to-shave areas there was no clipping sound during the second shave in both orders; so neither shaver had a closer cut in these areas. However, in both orders I heard hairs being cut but in different difficult-to-shave places on my face. The Braun did better in tight concave areas and the Panasonic better in tight convex areas. From this I conclude that both shavers shave better in certain situations and this was due to the shape of the cutting head as applied to a certain shape on my face. The amount of hair clipping during the second shave was the same in both orders; so there is no discernible advantage of one over the other. Both provided an equally smooth shave with the same level of tugging and skin irritation which was very little. The higher vibration rate of the Panasonic did not seem to make any difference relative to the Braun 6520 vibration rate. All of these tests were on a dry face not wet. I did try testing the Panasonic wet and the Braun dry. I reran the tests but the results were the same as my previous all-dry tests. There was no advantage shaving wet with the Panasonic. In my opinion both provide equivalent shaves. I rated this product 4 stars rather than 5 since I am still seeking a perfect shave with no difficult to cut area issues and no skin irritation; nether shaver provides this.
  253. I have coarse, wiry facial hair. This razor does not get everything, even with multiple passes from different directions. Often times, just after shaving, I will notice hairs that have not been trimmed.<br /><br />The lack of a close shave was also a disappointment. With this razor, I have to shave morning and evening to avoid having an unshaved appearance at the end of the day. With a safety razor, I could go a full day plus.

If not for that it would be a 5 star shaver for me. If mine days today, I will order the same one immediately. . . well worth the money!
  263. Having used electrical shavers my whole life I have to say this is the best one I've owned. I was previously using the Panasonic ES7037 and found it to be a slow but workable razor. The ES7037 is a different breed altogether. The motor is much faster. It is so fast I can hear the whiskers being clipped. It shaves much closer, although it still takes multiple passes to make a perfect shave.   265. Let me start by saying that I have used electric shavers for over 25 years. I did a lot of research before ordering this shaver. I really like the close shave I get with this shaver. It gave me the closest shave I have had. As close to a blade as you can get. And it is fast. But after just 2 and 1/2 months of use, the foil has a hole in it. I called Panasonic and they do not cover the foil and blade at all. They are consumer consumable items and so are not covered. That is all, no recourse. I take care of my shavers but this is the shortest that the foil lasted. My foils and blades last well into 2 years and more. This shavers blades are so thin, they don't last as long. Expensive shaver and expensive blades. I would expect the foil to last at least 6 months to 1 year. Very poor quality. And you guessed it. The krap is made in China, not Japan. It says it right on the box. Would not recommend buying this shaver unless you expect to pay $30 for a foil or $50 for foil and blades every few months.
  266. I have had several other electric razors none of which I found very satisfactory. I was surprised and very pleased with the performance of this one. I've cleaned it once but did not wait until the little indicator said to do so. It did a pretty good job, probably a bit of a learning curve on my part. Overall I have been very pleased and recommended it to my son-in-law.
  267. I used to cut myself a lot with razers when shaving, this is really nice!! Great shave!! And no cuts! I wouldn't want to go back to the old way for anything, except maybe permanent hair removal!!
  268. Bought this for my husband based on all the positive reviews. . . so far so good. He thinks it works better than Norelco which was the shaver he had previous to this before it broke on him. My husband indicated that there is no pulling of the skin which helps for a more comfortable shave.
  269. I bought this shaver after my Braun 54xx failed to hold a charge, and the power switch almost didn't work anymore. Having read several reviews and finding it at Amazon for the best price, I must say this is the best shaver I've ever used. It shaves fast, clean, and holds a charge much longer than my old Braun, plus it only takes about an hour to fully charge. Its ergonomics are excellent and it fits in hand quite nicely. The slide switch on the side of the razor allows you to let the head pivot for flexing around your face, or it locks the head in a fixed position. I find the unlocked position gives me the best shaves, and the wide head gives you a lot of beard real estate to mow down with one pass. Using my old Braun was like holding a small brick and was very uncomfortable to use, even though it gave a good shave. Noise levels are on par with my old shaver and should be fine for all but the most sensitive ears. It can also be used in the shower, though I prefer shaving after, so I can't comment on its wet performance. The trimmer is excellent as well, and is easy to use. Replacement blades are a very inexpensive $17 considering they only have to be changed every two years. The foil is more expensive at $22, which Panasonic suggests you change every 12 months. But you can save some money and get the combo pack for $28 which includes one set of blades and one foil. After six months of use, my Panasonic is still shaving like I just took it out of the box, so I would definitely rate this a strong 5 stars. There are a couple of things to be aware of however. First, don't believe the number of uses the shaver literature suggests unless all you grow is peach fuzz for a beard. I get a full seven shaves though, and there is no noticeable change in the rpms, even down to 20% charge. And be aware that Panasonic does not make replacement cords, so if you lose yours packing for a trip you will have to buy a new shaver.
  270. I received a new Braun shaver this past Christmas and was very disappointed with it. I have enjoyed Braun shavers for a very long time and thought this one would be no different. I was very wrong. My son received this Panasonic shaver at the same time so I decided to try it and was very impressed. It provides everything that the Braun shaver didn't. A fast close shave, easy to clean, and stays charged long enough to get about 7 or 8 shaves before recharging.

  275. I just received this in the mail a day after I ordered from Amazon. I have used Braun, Remington, and Norelco electrics. I switched to an old fashioned safety razor last year after my very expensive Braun ($140) died after one year of use (it would no longer charge or turn on). I was sick and tired of spending so much money on shaving and the stupid cleaning solution really breaks you after a while, it's cost prohibitive. Lately, I've been experiencing very raw skin after shaves with my safety razor and was tired of the 10 minutes I had to spend setting up and shaving every morning so I decided to give an electric a try again. Well, I'm glad I did and I'm really glad I chose this one. The shave is fantastic. My first shave with it after a year with a safety razor is just as close after going over my skin a few times. It took no where near as long as a safety razor shave. No soap, no cleaning, no lather/re-lather/re-lather to get all of the angels covered, no mess, and no raw skin. In comparison to my previous electrics, this one is the best I've had. It shaves a little closer, feels better in my hand, and moves easier over my face. I really like it and I think it's a bonus that it's so easy to clean without the stupid self-cleaning station. I will never buy one of those again. It hurts when you're dropping $40 a pop for two stupid plastic containers of water and alcohol. Never again. This one cleans fine without that stuff. I highly recommend this razor. I may just stick with panasonic from now on if this thing lasts over a year. We'll see.
  276. It seems hard now days to find a good electric shaver that gives a reasonably close shave and doesn't cost a small fortune or have a shaver head and blades that go dull after a month or two of use. I have used Braun shavers for 25+ years, but their less expensive shavers are now crap and even the expensive ones don't usually get good reviews. So, a year ago I tried a Panasonic model ES7103 (which had received largely favorable reviews). At first, I was mildly pleased by the shave, but the blades faded quickly over the following months and it became a grinding chore to do my morning shave. After more research and the reading of umpteen reviews on several different shaver brands, I decided to give Panasonic another chance and ordered the model ES8103. You wouldn't think one higher digit would make that much difference, but it this case it makes all the difference in the world! The ES8103 is a joy to shave with and is easily the best electric shaver I have ever owned. It slices through my stubble with ease and gives a smooth, comfortable shave every time. This is one example where paying more gets you your money's worth! Highly recommended!

  290. This razor is awesome. It does a great job wet or dry and it tells you when it needs to be charged and/or cleaned. To clean it, just place it under running water for 30 seconds. Then remove the cover and the foil and let it dry. The battery is a lithium ion type which is not affected by the cold, a problem the cheaper razors that I've used have. Panasonic recommends that the razor be recharged at a comfortable room temperature but my bathroom is freezing in the morning. I recharge it in a warmer room of the house but it has been consistantly following through in my freezing bathroom. My shave is complete in 3-4 minutes and it's got a stray hair cutter in-between the two stubble foils to get those long ones your other razor leaves under the base of your jawbone. It's closer to a blade than a rotary razor but without the burning/irritation of a blade with no ingrown hairs. I've never been happier.

My whiskers come in a bit faster and stiffer than average, but nothing drastic, and it takes multiple passes to do the job.   301. Returned didn't work very well, my husband was disappointed..
  302. First of all, I can only compare the Panasonic ES8103S to the crappy Walmart Remingtons I kept buying out of pure laziness. My first Remington was a gift from my grandfather when I had peach-fuzz, but lasted about 20 years all total. So that's how I got started on Remington, who somewhere along the line decided to start making money by making their razors fail much more often.<br /><br /> The Panasonic choice was made over the last year from reading reviews, but more so probably because of their heavy presence on Amazon. [Also, Walmart stopped selling Remingtons.] I didn't know how to pick a brand, so after seeing one in a 'Today's Deals' offer last year just started reading reviews about them as my latest Remington began to fail [batteries] this last six months. It had finally gotten to where my Remi battery caused me to shave once before I shower, then put it back on charge and finish after breakfast...but even that was cutting it close [no pun intended].<br /><br /> Obviously, probably not a real challenge, but the Panasonic I definitely like better than the Remingtons I've been using. The cheap Remis were hurting my face, but the Panasonic is real smooth and makes a soothing 'angry mosquito' sound. Like any electric shaver I'v owned, it still takes a few passes...but I definitely think the Panasonic is giving me a closer shave much quicker and definitely MUCH more comfortably. Looks like my daily shaving uses about 10% each day of the battery, so I assume about a week+ per charge. I've only had mine about a month, so can't comment on longevity. I don't plan to use it in the shower [wet] and likely won't do any more than 'brush' it out to clean it.<br /><br /> Glad I finally pulled the trigger.<br /><br />*********<br />Edit 3/14/2012 - Still love my shaver. Remington sucks. I actually grow SO many fewer beards now, because I don't dread shaving.<br />*********<br />10/27/2012 - Still working well. I hardly ever clean it, just shave. Still cuts welland holds a charge for many days. It has not made me better looking or more successful.
  303. I don't have mountain-man beard thickness, I'd consider my stubble average. This shaver works with short stubble, but if I wait a day or 2 (over the weekend, for example), the shaver doesn't shave very well, and it tends to snag on beard hairs around my neck (which aint pleasant). The wet/dry feature is really great, and it's easy to charge and clean. The features are nice, but the shaver itself could be a bit better. It's not a top-of-the-line $300 shaver, so I understand if it's got some flaws, but I was expecting a little more.
  304. The Panasonic ES8103S is a great balance of useful features vs price. This shaver gets the job done efficiently for me every day. The % charge display is convenient for understanding when charging is needed (better than just a warning light). Battery life is 4-5 shaves (depending on how much time you spend getting the last little bit) with little fade in battery life over time. I recommend the shavers where the cutter head vibrates at high frequency because it makes for quicker shaving. I bought this as a replacement for the exact same model that was stolen out of my luggage, so I have used it for about 2 years now. Previously I owned a good Braun and a cheap Remington. I recommend you spend the extra money to get a good shaver, but no need to get a ton of fancy features. Daily head washers are just more stuff to fiddle with and supplies to buy. If you need a shaver, the this Panasonic ES8103S is a good one.
  305. I bought this razor after years of being disappointed with various high priced norelco models. I had finally settled on a Remington electric razor that I have been using for nearly 10 years. My Remington did an admirable job but just can't compare to today's technology so I decided to get something new. After reading the reviews, I went for this model. This Panasonic is amazing and although it's a foil razor, it performs just fine on my neck where the foils of yesteryear failed. I love that you can see how much charge is left. I also love that it can be used wet/dry and cleaned with water. Best of all, the shave is very smooth. The closest shave I've ever had with an electric razor and I've tried many over the last 25 years. My skin is very sensitive so I can't use blades. I have used this razor several times and because it shaves so well I am only going over each area once and not experiencing any irritation. Hoping to get 10 years out of this razor like the one I had before. I highly recommend this razor.
  306. Purchased for my son. He loves it!

  309. Last November, I had a brain cramp. I purchased a Braun series 330 for my failed Panasonic ES8077. That mistake cost me almost 60.00. I finally decided to bite the bullet and purchase a new razor. I knew I had to go back to the Panasonic razor that had lasted me for so many years of service. I fell for a sale at the local Macy's but would not be fooled again. I purchased this razor from Amazon and am finally again pleased with the shaves I am getting. Even bone dry this thing is amazing. Use it right after or in the shower you will be amazed. If between showers you use an Electric Pre-Shave like Williams Electra shave, you will notice a shave as absolutely as close to a blade. My face feels as smooth as a baby's behind. Thanks Panasonic!

  311. I was expecting this model ES8103s to be better than my old ES8066 model which was rugged, good quality, and long lasting (10 years). But, I'm disappointed by it's wimpy and delicate body. I'm afraid it will shatter into pieces if I ever dropped it on the floor. My old model ES8066 was made in Japan. This one is made in China. And, I can see and feel the difference in quality of material and workmanship. As for the shaving, there is no difference. They all shave good in the beginning. We'll see how it shaves after 5 years. Is it worth the money? Too early to tell. After 5 months: It was quiet in the beginning. But after 5 months of usage it has become louder.

  315. I've tried 3 or 4 electric shavers over the years, but I would toss them after a couple of months because they just couldn't compare to a blade. Until now. Hands down this is the best electric razor I have ever used. I've had it now for just a week, but I can't see anything wrong with it. Sure, there are features that some people might like to have modified this way or that, but that is no reason to give less stars. The bottom line is, does it shave well without causing damage to your skin, and does it do everything else it's advertised to do? Two thumbs up and 5 stars from this new convert.

  317. I HAVED SHAVED WITH AN electric for 30 plus years. I have gone through several razors with varying results as one might imagine. Each new razor was a Norelco, some spendy and some not. The results seemed nearly the same no matter how much I paid for each one. I was in need of changing heads and my brother recommended this razor and I am glad that he did and that I took his advice. This little jewel has given me the most comfortable and closest shave that I have had in decades. I am using the Taylor of Bond Street Sandalwood shave cream and a badger brush to apply. All I can say is WOW! BBS! The entire system is worthy of praise! I have also recommended this system to a friend who also is loving the results. I am impressed and wondering how I did not know about this razor sooner.<br />I have also used this electric dry and I am very pleased with those results as well. MY other razor has been retired permanently.

  323. This is perhaps the fourth Panasonic shaver I've owned and they keep getting better. This is the best shaver I've owned. Because of the speed of the blades, the moveable head, and the option of wet /dry shaving, it does an amazing job. My only complaint is that it is a little noisy. I've owned four Panasonic shavers because it has made more sense a number of times to buy a new shaver instead of buying replacement parts - one of my only complaints about Panasonic - the price of replacement foils and blades.

  325. Gift for my dad who loves this.
  326. This shaver is much better than the Norelco it replaced. I am getting a closer shave with less irritation in the lower neck area. In fact, I'm getting a closer shave than I was able to get with a razor. The shaver head design is similar to the Braun I was looking at, but at half the price. This model doesn't have the automatic cleaning system, but that was a plus to me, because I didn't want to keep paying for cleaning solution and have to go through the whole cleaning ritual. With this shaver, I just take the top off and shake out the hairs, and now and then I run it under the faucet. I find that shaving dry rather than wet gives the closest shave and requires less cleaning of the head. Overall, this is exactly the type of shaving experience I was looking for.
  327. I've been using a Braun foil shaver for years and have replaced the foil and blade about 4 times. Unfortunately, the battery on the old razor wasn't holding much of a charge so I thought it was time for a new razor. This one is Awesome!! Not only is it way lighter (Li-Ion battery), but it is so much easier to clean since you just rinse in water when it tells you to. Very big improvement in razor technology and I haven't even tried it as a wet shave yet! There are cheaper models by Panasonic, but their blade motor is slower rpm than this model. The $69 spent on this one was well worth it.

  332. I bought this razor looking for a replacement for my old Braun. The Braun is ok but I'm looking for something better. This razor had great reviews and I don't understand how. This razor is horrible. It doesn't shave your face, so much as it plucks it. My face started bleeding at one point. From an electric. When it wasn't getting stuck, and painfully tearing out my facial hair, it wasn't doing much else. They advertise single pass. Don't tell my mustache that. Over and over and over and over. No less than 10 passes to get a smooth mustache area. The trimmer isn't any better. It felt like my hairs were just destroying the blades. My old Braun has a similar style trimmer, and when new, it was far superior to this razor's. And my braun, which is in desperate need of a new primary blade, still does a far better job than this razor. I had to use my Braun to finish the job because this horrible razor was just destroying my face. I suspect this is what it feels like to shave with \\"a rusty butter knife\\". I don't know how this thing has gotten so many great reviews. But I would never try another one of these. I hope amazon will let me return it used, because there's no way it's touching my face again, and otherwise I'll just be out the $65.
  333. I love Panasonic Wet/Dry Shavers and have been using them for many many years. My second one, a model ES8043 died after 5 years of faithful use. I am a bit peeved how Panasonic shavers do not last as long as, for example, Braun shavers but I love the Panasonic shave quality and the versatility of their Wet/Dry shavers. So I bought the Panasonic ES8103 on sale. The shave is awesome. The technology is much more advanced than the previous model. I gave a rave review when I bought the ES8043 but this one is so much better. It provides an amazing, close shave, with hardly a need to go over the same area twice. We/Dry performance is excellent. My nine year old son says my face is as smooth as his. And that is no small feat. However, the shaver itself seems cheaper from a material perspective. There is much more cheap plastic and it is much lighter. So my guess this one will give me great shaves over and over again - but last about 5 years as well...
  334. Absolutely the best shave ever gotten from an electric razor. Stroking down on the face after a shave was as close a shave as a blade would give. Stroking up and a little stubble was felt, but all in all I was amazed.
  335. Panasonic makes the best wet/dry razors in the business; the ES8103S is the best of the best.
  336. Having owned several electric razors in the past I was very skeptical of this product, however it has exceeded my expectations. I get a close shave every time and the battery maintains a consistent charge.   339. I have always used Remington brand electric shavers and loved them - close good, but dry shaves. When my last old Remington finally died, on the recommendation of my son-in-law plus the idea of a wet shave, I bought this unit. At 77 years old, I do not have a difficlut beard but no matter how I lathered, or how many passes I made, I could not get anyway near the close shave of my good-'ole Remingtons plus the ES8103 irritated my face. So, I bought the Twin Screen Remington F4 that stated the blades could be washed in water and I use it for wet, lathered shaves - aah! great, smooth, irritation-free shaves again and best of all the Remington was one-quarter the price of the Panasonic. You can now find my ES8103 on eBay at a VERY reasonable price.
  340. but Norelco and save money. it works better & I am sorry I went and got this Panasonic (it sucks)

  342. Works good and the battery actually last a good long time.
  343. needed to replace my old Braun shaver which was totally worn out.<br /><br />I was given a new series 3 Braun as a gift which I probably would have bought myself, since I was satisfied with my old Braun. After several weeks of use I found that the razor head consistently gave a \\"razor burn feeling\\", did not cut flat laying wiskers well, seemed to lack power, and did not shave as well as my well worn out old braun. Consumer reports rated the series 7 with their highest rating but had no refference to the series 3. I decided that I needed a better razor that works.<br /><br />After some research, I decided to buy the panasonic ES8103S and try it out. The quality difference between the products was absolutely incredable. The Panasonic has more power, charges faster, shaves closer & cleaner, a more comfortable head, cuts flat laying wiskers, and has a % digital battery charge indicator. I also did not get the \\"razor burn feeling\\" with this razor.<br /><br />Although this shaver will wet cut, I have not tried this feature, though it sounds interesting enough to try soon, so I cannot comment in this feature.<br /><br />The Panasonic is so superior in quality, features, and performance to the Braun series 3, that the braun should not even be considdered for purchase.
  344. Pros: I have had this shaver for a few weeks. From the first day it gave a close shave. I like the littel icon reminding to clean it, the wet feature so I can clean under running water, the swivel head and the compact charger. I get about 20 shaves per charge. The price was good. I saw no reason to purchase a shaver for more than a hundred dollars. I previously had a Panasonic that lasted many years. The battery was starting to not hold a charge as long and so I replaced it. I expect to get at least 5 years from this new shaver's battery. I replace screens every year and cutters every other year. Cons: The trimmer is a little narrow. I would have preferred a full size trimmer. It doesn't get some of the long and fine hairs on my neck, but the trimmer does get them without burn.
  345. I used Norelco shavers for years, but took the leap to Panasonic this past Christmas.   346. I was very pleased with this purchase. The shaver gives a very good, close shave. It is comfortable to hold, and the head pivots to contour your face. It charges very quickly, and has a small digital window on the front telling you how much charge is left. being waterproof it also cleans easily and well.

  348. My hubby just LOVES this shaver! It works well and cuts as close as a straight razor. Plus it's really easy to take apart to clean. Very happy with this purchase.
  349. Don't bother. Go buy some blades.
  350. My husband has used the three blade rotary style razor for 20 years and was not getting the smooth results with the typical brands, and it took a lot of time to shave.
