  351. I was not expecting such a great shave from an electric razor. I will never go back to anything else now.
  352. I have used a succession of Remington electric shavers for years. The last couple however, have not wanted to hold a charge after a few months. I then went looking for different one. Consumer reports, rating sites, Amazon, etc. I finally decided on this one, partially because it was on sale. It works great, and I really like that it clearly displays the amount of charge remaining. I do think it requires a more frequent charge, as it seems to use about 10% of its power when I use it. Of course, being retired, I don't shave every day. Therefore when I do use it, it gets a real workout. My wife likes it because it is a lot less noisy that my old ones. Just a pleasant hum.
  353. My husband loves this! AND no rash! Thank you.
  354. Update #5 05/06/2017 - Guess what folks, this shaver is still going strong after 6 years. I don't think there is another shaver on the planet that has worked so well for me. It holds a charge like new, shaves like new and I'll update you guys in another couple of years. You cannot go wrong with this product.<br /><br />Update #4 11/10/2014<br /><br />This shaver is still going strong after 2 1/2 years of use.<br /><br />Update #3 3/18/13<br /><br />My buddy used my razor in secret after staying over. I was asleep at the time and he took my razor into the bathroom while he was getting ready for work. He stays over frequently and I told him he could try it out, but I didn't know he did until he told me later in the day. He loves this razor so much that I bought him one as a gift. He loves it. I wouldn't give my razor to my best friend, but I did buy him one.<br /><br />Update #2 3/1/13<br /><br />After 8 months I am married to this shaver. We got engaged a couple months ago after a 6 month relationship. We've traveled all around and it goes to work with me and waits in the car till I get off. I've introduced it to my co-workers when it needed a charge but it's home with me now charging and is going to meet a friend of mine this weekend. I told a buddy about it and he wants to meet my shaver too, since he hates using a blade. I told my buddy he could use my razor, but that if he liked it, he'd have to date his own. I don't usually share, but my buddy is a good friend. At 20% charge, it takes less than an hour to get full speed. The comfort is great and I wouldn't cheat on this razor, because it is faithful to me. I know my buddy will like it and he doesn't know it now, but once he shaves with it and feels like I do, I'm going to buy him one just like it as a gift.<br /><br />Typical razors; you know the blade things, are like a nagging wife or a boyfriend that cost you a fortune. My razor isn't like that; we get along great. My buddy will love me for letting me share, not that I won't expect at least something in return... Maybe I'll have him shave me with my own razor. That would be hot.........<br /><br />Update: Now using this shaver for 6 months, I feel qualified to tell you guys that I still love this shaver. I can tell ya, if it fails for any reason, I'll be looking for the exact same model. For some reason, it seems to hold a charge better then when I first bought it. Feels great in the hand and still does a great job. I've been blowing it with compressed air once in a while, still have not gotten it wet and I depend on it. You can just blow the whiskers out without compressed air and it has been a trooper. By far, the best shaver I have ever owned.<br /><br />----------------<br /><br />I love this shaver! I have used electric or battery razors/shavers now for 20 years. Started with Braun, then Norelco, Remington and now this Panasonic. Of them all, I like this one the best. It's got a great feel to it since it is rubberized on the back and sides and feels very comfortable. It's light, but heavy enough to feel like a quality shaver.<br /><br />So let's get to it. It does a great job and I don't think I'd get a better shave from a blade. I have fairly firm facial hair, but relatively smooth skin. This baby shaves me completely to where I can't feel any hair on my face at all. Now I've read that the blades get the mesh warm due to friction and I did notice that the first time, but I'm not that sensitive and haven't noticed it since. I shave in the car so I'm preoccupied with traffic anyway (and no, it does not distract me to shave because I don't need a mirror and don't take my eyes off the road).<br /><br />I've also read that it is loud. Well, that's a relative term and how could a shaver work without causing friction and making a noise? It sounds similar to an insect as the hum you hear is a couple notes above what my 3-head Remington sounded like. It's nothing to complain about. It is a little bit louder, but so what? Now, since you don't know what my Remington sounded like, making that comparison is rather silly. It is the highest pitch shaver I have ever used, but I get a great shave so I really don't care.<br /><br />The LED display is kinda neat, but as you've read it only measures in increments of 10. That doesn't bother me in the least, since none of my old shavers had numbers on them, only bars. So looking at it that way, it's like having 10 bars. Much more than my previous shavers had. It charges fairly fast, but when you plug it in at night, who cares? Use time is probably average. On Mondays, it takes me about 6 minutes to shave. That uses 20% of the charge. I easily make it through the week after that without a charge. Someone said it would last for two weeks, but I highly doubt that. I'd say 3-4 minutes will take 10% out of it. I might shave longer than some dudes, but I want a very smooth shave. When it stops grinding, I know I'm clean and good to go.<br /><br />I like the head design because it swivels sideways and the individual shave heads are springy. So it follows the contour of your face, jaw and Adam's apple. It's quite comfortable. I had considered the 4-head design costing a bit more, but I thought that was overkill and too bulky for my taste. I stopped shaving with a traditional razor decades ago and those with 5 blades now days are in my opinion ridiculous, not to mention cost a fortune (oh wait, I did just mention it). This puppy would pay for itself in no time compared to blades. Anyhow, I thought 4 heads sounded fairly unnecessary. While I wouldn't know how those perform, I can't imagine them being any better than this one. I also didn't want some bulky cleaning tray getting in my way that comes with some units. I only used the trimmer side once for this review and it seems to work fine. I don't have a public job and I'm more of a board shorts and tee shirt type guy so I don't get that detailed and the shaver does a good job on its own.<br /><br />I've only used it dry and it is unlikely I will ever get it wet, even to clean it. I don't want water spots on it and my gut tells me that it wouldn't last as long simply being made of some metal parts. It's just not necessary for me to shave in the shower and I don't want to take the extra time to do so. I shave in the car in the interest of time. To clean it, I just pop the top off and give it a good blow on either side. Stop making fun of me now. I have a small brush that I think came with it, or might have been from my last shaver, I don't really remember. A toothbrush would work too, but might dull the razors over time. Like I said, blowing it does a great job, works for me anyhow.<br /><br />I found this to be much more affordable than my last 3-head rotary Remington. It sells at a well known box store for about $110, but I paid exactly half of that online (plus shipping). I did a notable amount of research on both price and reviews before I selected it and from where I bought it. If there's a deal on something, I'm going to sniff it out. I have absolutely nothing negative to say about his shaver and believe me if there was something, I'd tell you. I like everything about it.h shaver I have ever used, but I get a great shave so I really don't care. The LED display is kinda neat, but as you've read it only measures in increments of 10. That doesn't bother me in the least, since none of my old shavers had numbers on them, only bars. So looking at it that way, it's like having 10 bars. Much more than my previous shavers had. It charges fairly fast, but when you plug it in at night, who cares? Use time is probably average. On Mondays, it takes me about 6 minutes to shave. That uses 20% of the charge. I easily make it through the week after that without a charge. Someone said it would last for two weeks, but I highly doubt that. I'd say 3-4 minutes will take 10% out of it. I might shave longer than some dudes, but I want a very smooth shave. When it stops grinding, I know I'm clean and good to go. I like the head design because it swivels sideways and the individual shave heads are springy. So it follows the contour of your face, jaw and Adam's apple. It's quite comfortable. I had considered the 4-head design costing a bit more, but I thought that was overkill and too bulky for my taste. I stopped shaving with a traditional razor decades ago and those with 5 blades now days are in my opinion ridiculous, not to mention cost a fortune (oh wait, I did just mention it). This puppy would pay for itself in no time compared to blades. Anyhow, I thought 4 heads sounded fairly unnecessary. While I wouldn't know how those perform, I can't imagine them being any better than this one. I also didn't want some bulky cleaning tray getting in my way that comes with some units. I only used the trimmer side once for this review and it seems to work fine. I don't have a public job and I'm more of a board shorts and tee shirt type guy so I don't get that detailed and the shaver does a good job on its own. I've only used it dry and it is unlikely I will ever get it wet, even to clean it. I don't want water spots on it and my gut tells me that it wouldn't lastas long simply being made of some metal parts. It's just not necessary for me to shave in the shower and I don't want to take the extra time to do so. I shave in the car in the interest of time. To clean it, I just pop the top off and give it a good blow on either side. Stop making fun of me now. I have a small brush that I think came with it, or might have been from my last shaver, I don't really remember. A toothbrush would work too, but might dull the razors over time. Like I said, blowing it does a great job, works for me anyhow. I found this to be much more affordable than my last 3-head rotary Remington. It sells at a well known box store for about $110, but I paid exactly half of that online (plus shipping). I did a notable amount of research on both price and reviews before I selected it and from where I bought it. If there's a deal on something, I'm going to sniff it out. I have absolutely nothing negative to say about his shaver and believe me if there was something, I'd tell you. I like everything about it.
  355. This rechargeable razor works very well. It not only does a great job shaving but the rechrageable battery holds a charge for a rather long time. Seems like I get at least a dozen shaves from a single charge. The pop out side burns feature is an added plus.
  356. I needed an electric razor that would leave my face smooth and not irritate my skin. This one fits the bill. My only regret is that i did not spring for the 4 or 5 blade version. The motor is very fast and the foils get very close to the skin, leaving me with a smooth shave in a relatively short amount of time. (I usually spend about 5 minutes in the morning for a shave.)I primarily use this razor for dry shaving (although it works well with shaving foam or gel), and it has been great so far. The battery has performed exactly as advertised- and the razor runs strong at full speed until it dies; there is no \\"petering-out\\" period wherein the motor slows to a pinching crawl before stopping. The trimmer is well placed to handle sideburns and works nicely for shaping beards if that's what you want. The cord on the charger is long enough to be convenient, but not be all over the counter. All in all, I am pleased with this razor and would recommend it to anyone looking for a next-step or two-up from an entry level electric razor. I am considering purchasing the 4 or 5 blade model for daily use and using this one for a luxurious travel/backup razor.
  357. I have used electric razors for almost 20 years, and believe me I have tried a lot of different razors. I received the Panasonic ES81035 wet/dry shaver. I charged it to 100 and received the closest shave that I have seen in years. It works great and is so easy to clean. This should have a 10 rating.
  358. I bought this after doing hours of research on what the best mid level electric razor was. I did not want to spend over $100 and I did not need that fancy self cleaning crap that just costs more money every time to refill. I usually wake up late and I also hate to shave with a razor everyday so I bought this one.<br /><br />I get 10-12 shaves on a charge and it takes less than 30 minutes to fully recharge. It gives me the closest shave I have ever had with an electric razor!!! It gives me a completely smooth shave the same as my Fusion 5 blade razor but without the irritation! I do sometimes have some stray hairs on my neck that it doesn't get but I hit those with a dry razor real quick and I'm good. This is a great product and cleans easily, is compact for travel, can be used wet or dry, and a cheap alternative to the $100+ electric razors.
  359. Works great in shower
  360. This was the best electric shaver I have ever had. It cuts very close even on my thick hair. I some times shower before I shave and this cuts thru the damp hair really well. It has a nice battery, When it is charged to %100 it can go weeks without a charge.
  361. Bought for my boyfriend for xmas and he can't really use it because it cuts his face, especially under the chin. He is using a razor again and I am out 80 bucks.
  362. I have been using electric shavers for over 40 years and this one is the best. I have only used it shaving dry. I don't think I am going to use it wet because of the additional steps of applying shaving cream and the messy clean up defeats the purpose of electric shavers. It's a nice feature to have and let's you clean the shaver under running water without fear of damaging the shaver. The motor is very fast, quiet and produces minimal vibration. The first week of shaves have been close. To achieve the closest shave requires that each area must be gone over several times in different directions. This has been true with other electric shavers I have used. It takes two to three weeks of use to become accustomed to the new shaver which may reduce the number of passes required to get a really close shave. The battery charge indicator is accurate and it even has an icon to tell when to clean the shaver. Unfortunately, it comes on sporadically. Cleaning is very easy using a little liquid hand soap and a rinse under the faucet. The shaver charges the batteries up fully in about an hour and can be charged for one shave in five minutes. The shaver can't be used while connected to the AC house current to prevent electric shock while shaving wet or in the shower. I would hope no one would be that careless. Overall this shaver works great and appears to be well made.
  363. It produces so much noise when I use it. Bothering me!!!
  364. i have had this model for over a year now and would say that this razor does a good job and the battery holds up reasonably well. to get a reasonably close shave, shaving can take longer than desired, but it will get the job done.
  365. I have been using electric razors for 10+ years now and this is the closest shave I've had with an electric. After using this razor, my face hasn't felt so smooth in years (seriously). Granted, this is also the first electric ive ever spent more than $60 on too.<br />The reviews here are pretty accurate overall in terms of the quality of the shave you get. you will definitely need to go over the same spot a few times if you want a super close shave (true with all electrics), but the irritation is minimal to non-existent, even with very sensitive skin like I have. However, this razor seems to have a hard time on the neck area, which is probably attributed to its linear blade design. In contrast, my rotary razor does the neck area much faster, but its not as clean in comparison to this razor - so its a bit of a toss up here in that regard. I may still use my rotary just for the neck if i need a quick-and-dirty shave. I tried both a wet(with shaving gel) and dry shave and I noticed very little difference, if anything, but the dry was slightly better for me.<br />Overall, I doubt that electric razors will ever get better than this in terms of closeness of shave. The quality of the product is questionable, but only time will tell. In the end, I just wanted a close, good electric shaver that doesn't irritate my skin, and that's what I got at a reasonable price. I was prepared to spend $150+ on the more fancy electrics, but this one had the best overall reviews, and for once, they were right.

Only think i wish they included was a charging stand but i understand then i wouldn't be as cheap of a price. Can't really go wrong here guys, pop up trimmer, wet/dry feature to use in shower, battery life indicator. Of course they don't build them like they use to, but then again it's also MUCH cheaper than the older panasonic ES model i had before the battery finally gave out. i say buy buy buy.

  373. I've owned several brands and types of electric shavers. This is the best one I've owned to date. It's not too expensive up front, considering the future expense of screens and cutting heads. I've been wet shaving with a razor for several years, but like having an electric around. I've been using it for several weeks, in the shower, and prefer it over a razor. I still use a shaving lotion, otherwise it drags on my skin. The results are about as good and close as with a razor. Granted I don't have thick facial hair. My only real complaints are the pop up trimmer is a bit awkward for trimming side burns and the charger has a really long straight cord. I would like a pop out trimmer that isn't partially obscured by the shaver's head. I'm also used to a coiled cord, which takes up less space in a bag and doesn't require a twist tie to keep it tidy.

I love that you can simply pop off the top and run some water over it to clean it, or if you want to get a better clean, just drop some soap in it too.   387. I absolutely agree with most of the positive reviews, but want to make a few remarks. 1. I have used it only dry as any other electric shaver. 2. I had used Norelco Phillips for a long time, but this one delivered a very close, smooth shave from the very first time. 3. The quality of the shaving is very close to a blade and maybe even higher considering no nicks, cuts, irritation, etc. I shave once in three days. 4. It's absolutely great for shaving the head and equal to a blade even without shaving cream. 5. Cleaning is very convenient; much easier than Norelco. After shaving a clean dry face there is no need to even activate the cleaning mode. Removing the foil holder and rinsing it and the inner blades separately under the running water is usually sufficient. 6. The high pinch noise is noticeable, especially comparing with Norelco. Not a problem for the one who shaves, but doing it at night time might be problematic. It only takes a few minutes though. 7. The battery should last for about 40 min according to the passport. And this is true for the new one, but the battery loses charge while being idle at the rate 10-20% per week. My five year old Norelco doesn't lose any charge for at least a month. 8. It does get quite warm after 2-3 min, which may be uncomfortable for sensitive skin, especially if one is pressing hard, which is, actually, not helpful. 9. It gives better results when it is moved several times over the same spot if required applying very light pressure, which agrees with the passport recommendations. 10. Stretching the skin helps, and the handle should be kept perpendicular to the skin surface. 11. I keep it in a plastic glass along with my toothbrush, which is actually more convenient than a stand. 12. Carrying case would be useful. Overall it's a very good product, very comfortable and easy to use.
  388. Hands down the best shaver I've used. As long as you do not push too hard, you get zero irritation.<br />I found a bit of Argon oil as an aftershave leaves your face smooth as silk.

  397. I was used to shave manually and somehow got curious (again) about electric shaving. After reading (too) many reviews I ordered the Panasonic ES8103S. What a fabulous razor, a dream! Almost as close as my 50-blade-or-more Gillette and so much easier. I use the lemon pre-shave oil from \\"The Art of Shaving\\" and cannot be more positive. This razor is so easy to use, recharges in no time and I certainly don't find it noisy. A remarkable razor.
  398. I've used this every day since I got it a month ago, so whatever it's going to do, I'm fully aware of. The rest of the stuff I bought is still wrapped up in the shipping box.<br /><br />I have a Braun 340, and the blade/foil assembly is working on 6 or 7 years now, so I was kind of stupid for using it for that length of time. I came here to order a new assembly, then saw that I could buy a completely new shaver for the cost of 1.5 new foil assemblies! At least for that Braun. Plus, the trimmer broke on my Braun, and I use that thing quite often. Blah blah blah- I know. Anyway, I have a heavy beard. I shave, then three hours later it looks like I've been all day without one. We all know the pores of a shaving foil are different diameters, and the thickness of the foil itself varies. Wahl made a shaver that came with three or four foils of varying thickness that would accommodate different skin types and beard types - I may still have that thing too, somewhere. hang on- let me go look.<br /><br />Rats. That thing's gone. But I did find a Remington MS 5100. Trimmer broke on that one, too. The Remington, Panasonic and Braun all have different foils, different feels, different performance. I realize now that the only review you can really trust on shavers is from a dude who has the same beard as you, and the same skin sensitivity. If I get out of the rack and go shave with this Panasonic, it just won't do the job. My beard actually slows the blades down. So what I've been doing is using the jacked-up Braun to take care of the lion's share, then using the Panasonic to finish. And the Panasonic has a fantastic trimmer. Here's hoping it keeps working.<br /><br />Things I've learned since 2005: if shaving with a razor tears your face up, go electric. If you go electric and find that your face still gets beat on, shave in shorter sessions. See, heat is what kills my face. So I don't press the thing against my face so hard. The razor doesn't exactly need to be mooshed up against you hard anyway, and that pressure generates heat. Shaving long enough also generates heat. So I was not only shaving for longer than Joe Blow does, but I was also pressing too hard. That caused breakouts, and I'm 45! I'm way too old for breakouts.<br /><br />Well if I can't shave fast enough to ensure that I'm doing it with a cold foil, then I shave until I feel the thing getting warm, then put it down and brush my teeth or get my clothes out, whatever. When I come back, the foil's cooled off and I continue. Heat problem solved. The battery life on this thing is displayed in 10% increments. You won't see 87%. You get 10, 20, 30, etc, which is fine. It's just too easy to plug in and recharge to fret about something like that.<br /><br />Waterproofing means it's easy to clean. I still wince when I intentionally put water on an electric shaver, but you remove the foil, put some liquid soap on the blades, put the foil back on with a little water and run it. Foam spooges up through the foil, then you rinse it off. I use canned air to dry the thing completely- we have too many minerals in our water for me to trust that it will dry without leaving deposits on my blade.<br /><br />Upshot: any shaver purchase will be hit or miss. You can trust performance and reliability in reviews, but how it works on your face, your skin, your beard varies.
  399. The shaver is awesome. It has a comfortable \\"floating head\\" that will adjust to the pressure you use to apply it against your skin and it will also tilt to the contour of your face.<br /><br />I really like the idea that you can wash this item under running water with soap. I don't like the gimmicks of the cleaning systems and the expensive cartridge refill systems that shaving manufactures try to sell you.<br /><br />The only (slight) negative I would say is the trimmer on the back shorter than your tradition \\"flat-head\\" shavers. The motor on this is also rather loud and you'll notice it if you're trimming near/around your ears.<br /><br />Overall, this is a great product that works very well.
  400. I am satisfied with its good quality.<br />I would like to recommend it.
  401. I have to be honest. I've been a Braun user for years and this is the first non-Braun razor I buy. The shaving head is impressively comfortable, not aggressive on the skin, very useful for shaving difficult parts like under the chin or below the jaw. So.. very good SHAVING.<br />The TRIMMING however does not perform as well.. I don't shave on a daily basis, maybe once every 4 days. So I have that 1/4 inch hair growing. The trimmer has some issues cutting off the thick hair so it needs quite come passes before getting the job done. The other issue is that sometime it pulls the hair (like when I cut the goatee).<br />Therefore, very good choice of electric razor if you use it often. If you shave once in a while.. better check something else! ;)
  402. To start with, I don't like electric shavers. I have tried them several times in the past - from a Remington foil type my dad got me when I was 16 to a Norelco rotary in my 30's and a Braun Series 3 several years ago.<br /><br />I've never liked any of them.<br /><br />They didn't give me a close shave and they irritated my skin. If I am going to spend the time shaving, then I want it to be a close shave and I don't want to have to keep cortisone cream handy for shaving irritation.<br /><br />While searching for a related project, I stumbled upon a link to the Panasonic ES-8103 and decided it was maybe time to try again. I ordered it from Amazon and got it last week. Now this is based on shaving with it 5 times with it, but I have really enjoyed it and do recommend it.<br /><br />It is a wet/dry shaver, which contributes to the comfort. I have shaved with it using Williams 'Lectric Shave, Gillete Gel-Foam, and Godja Shave Soap. With the Gel-Foam and Shave Soap, I get a blade-close (I am not exaggerating) shave with little or no irritation (a little around the neck). The jury is still out on the Williams 'Lectric Shave. It can be used in the shower.<br /><br />An example of the comfort: After shaving with my 5 blade Gillette, I will splash on some Paroso after-shave. It stings. After shaving with the Panasonic, I splash on the Paroso and it doesn't sting. Yet, to my fingertips at least, it's a close and smooth shave.<br /><br />It's got a 13,000 RPM motor, so it really hums along. When I use the Shave Soap, the motor and blades create enough aggitation that it will actually foam the soap, making the shave even more comfortable.<br /><br />It is not expensive - about $70, or half-off list (at least on Amazon). Considering the cost of the Gillette 5 Blade cartridges, the Panasonic looks like an even better value.
  403. Audible (I'm told) in the far reaches of the house. Sounds like a giant metallic & very angry wasp trying to land on your chin. And it nicks. And the battery life is about 3 shaves. Other than that I've no complaints.

  413. I have been shaving my head now for about a year. Razors always remove a layer of skin so using them a lot leaves your skin feeling raw and worse yet if you have been in the sun. For the most part you just won't do it everyday because of that. This shaver works well on my head with a really close shave without that feeling on your scalp. In fact it is so gentle that mid day or evening if we are going out I can do a touch up on my scalp. This gets so close as to feel baby skin soft with NO shadow at all when I am done. Even though you can use this in the shower I do not because the hot water runs low by the time I shower and shave plus dry shaving my scalp seems to be easier. I would have rated it five stars but the stubble on my face takes considerably more effort. Stubble on your scalp is smaller and more even. Because this has never took a bite out of me I feel that the foil is really fine and stubble on your face is larger than that on your head. I am coming up on 5 months with mine and needed a replacement blade set for it which I feel is resonable considering that I shave about 5 times the area as a normal shave of your face might have. This is nothing like the electric I had a few years back and I would buy it again in a heartbeat! If you shave your head, you will love it. If you shave just your face, you might not have as much enthusiasm.

  420. Very nicely designed electric razor at an attractive price (when I bought). Gives a very comfortable shave, though not nearly as close as a Braun shaver of older but similar design. Also be aware that this model will NOT allow shaving while it Charges. If you stop off at home for a shave and quick change before an appointment or occasion and the battery is drained, you will need a backup razor or have to show up unshaven... a bummer! This unit also seems to lose charge on batteries much faster (without use) than other brands and models, so be prepared to go out unshaven more often with this razor than with many others.
  421. When my old Panasonic needed new blades and foil, I decided to shop for a new shaver. The motor after so many years of cutting my \\"wire beard\\" sounded like it was laboring. I thought I was tired of wet shaving and bought a top of the line Braun - it's for baby beards! Also, the Braun will not move over your skin if it is oily or micro-moist from a warm bathroom, even with shaving powder. It was returned. This ES8103S [[ASIN:B001DNE3KQ Panasonic ES8103S Pro-Curve Wet/Dry Rechargeable Linear Pivot Action Shaving System, Silver] shaver cuts my tough beard like it was fuzz, saving much time and my face! I don't have to push it hard against my face to get a close shave and it gets all the hard to shave face and neck areas.
  422. I had never used a foil shaver before, so I decided to give this a try. If I didn't like it, I could just send it back within the allowed time. Luckily, I haven't had to worry about that! This shaver is pretty awesome.<br /><br />There are a lot of things that I love about the shaver. First, if you shave with it regularly (every other day at least), shaving is extremely fast, clean, and painless. I've used other shavers before that just tug at the chin/neck hair and irritate badly. This does none of that. The foils are very slim and sharp, so there's no irritation, but at the same time you could blindly hit and drag this thing across your face and never cut yourself. Like I said, quick and easy. The head of the shaver can pivot and turn to follow the contours of your face (or whatever), but you can also lock it in place, which is great.<br /><br />Battery life is pretty impressive. I typically use about 10% battery per shave, so it will definitely last a week before needing a charge. Speaking of battery life, the display showing battery percentage (with light) is fantastic. No more shaver dying mid shave before work and showing up looking like a bum (unless you are a bum by profession, in which case you would like that).<br /><br />Also, this deserves a small section of its own, this shaver is really great for guys that get a lot of ingrown hairs. I used to get a lot on my neck when using a three blade razor (or something like it) and even other electric shavers. I ended up settling for a shaver with a guard on it, so I could never get a close shave. With this shaver, I can have a close shave, and no ingrown hairs, so it's really the gold standard for me in terms of shavers.<br /><br />Other pros I've noticed: The shaver is pretty quiet and not quite as jarring/heavily vibrating as some of the others I've used. Although I always dry shave, it's nice that you can use it in the shower and clean it easily without worrying about water damage/rust. The trimmer on the back is convenient to have for detailing or just getting those stray long hairs. It's overall a really high quality product that I plan on keeping and using for years to come.<br /><br />The two minor cons: You can't use the shaver while it's charging, and it is shipped with an empty battery, so you have to wait a bit for first use. That means that you have to plan ahead and charge it before you need to shave (which makes the battery percent display all the more convenient). The other thing is that the battery level is only displayed in tens of percents (ie 100%, 90%, 80%, etc). That doesn't really matter, it's just a little weird that it's not very accurate. Again, these cons are super minor, and really don't impact my overall feelings about the product.<br /><br />10/10 would recommend to a friend. Would shave a baby if necessary.
  423. replacement for aging Panasonic shaver--such a good shaver got another one. Great shave, nice feel. Charge running a full week--easy to clean--very high revolution motor. Good price and so far very happy with results.
  424. I've been using Panasonic Wet/Dry razors since 1992. My biggest complaint about any and all Panasonic razors is they work fine for about a year, then they quit working or start really having lots of problems. I replaced my last one with the ES8103S (my previous one was the same model). After a few months, the LCD screen went out. Then one day it just quit working/charging. That just seems to be the case with all Panasonic razors.
  425. I did a lot of research. This razor was said to be the best for shaving your head. It does do a better job than my last but I think its just above average. Wet shaving is not good the wiskers gum up the blades. But all in all it does a good job not great.
  426. A much smoother shaver compared to my old shaver.<br />Very ergonomic<br />Holds the charge for almost a month (manual says 2 weeks)<br />Only minor downside is the cover comes off a little too easily.
  427. I regret getting this. It is no better than the 20 dollar shaver I had before. The blade is very dull and it does not shave smoothly on my face.<br /><br />Not worth the money. In my opinion, either buy a higher level model or just a low end model which works as good as this one.
  428. I am truly amazed. It works like a charm. Before purchasing this I used the Braun series 7. I never really got a good shave and needed to manually clean up my neck with a handheld razor. But with the Panasonic it is drastically different. I get a clean shave all over my face. I use it as a wet shave with Zirh shaving gel and rinse the electric razor with hot water every now and then so it glides more freely. Clean up is very simple just soap and water. I like not being dependent on additional products to keep the razor clean. Very satisfied with this item.
  429. I have been using a Norelco rotary shaver for years. It gave me an \\"OK\\" shave. When the battery finally went south, I started looking on Amazon for a new one. After reading the reviews, I settled for this one. After the very first shave my wife immediately noticed how smooth I felt. I kept rubbing my face all day long in dis-belief. My face was baby-bottom smooth! This thing produces the closest shave I have ever felt. Mind you, I am not a blade man nor do I have irritation problems, but this thing is wonderful. It shaves the around the neck area perfectly and clean-up is a breeze. If you want the closest shave possible from an electric shaver... GET THIS! Your wife / girlfriend won't be able to stop rubbing your face!
  430. I have a horribly rough beard. I go through shields, so my strategy is to buy the lower end panasonics more frequently, as opposed to buying the top end and then spending money on replacement shields. So I purchased about 6 of these over the last 5-8 years (can't remember how long). Three still in service. One in the car, one older one for initial cut, one new one for final pass. Seems crazy I know...but have been unsuccessful finding electric razor that cuts close any better than this.
  431. I had an old Braun foil shaver that finally wore out, and the replacement parts were half the cost of a new 3-head rotary shaver from another brand. The rotary was OK, comfortable, but not as close and so slow. That was a couple of years ago. I was going to replace the rotary with another Braun of some type, but they are kind of expensive, and this Panasonic had good reviews. After a month or so, I can say it's faster and closer than the rotary (which I now keep at work, just in case), and almost as comfortable. Like my old Braun. I guess that's the trade off. Battery life is good, a couple weeks. The battery 'countdown' on the display is nice, not just a warning that you've run out. Also it tells you when you should clean it. Cleaning is easier, too. I haven't tried the wet option yet. Maybe in the summmer. The case is just a cloth bag. I worry about packing it and having something press against the button and put it in turbo mode. That should attract the attention of the TSA! If it holds up, then I will be very satisfied with this shaver, especially for the price.
  432. I am very happy with this shaver and am impressed with how nice the shave is. I have owned many different electric shavers over the years and this is the best one! The closeness of the shave is nice and the unit feels solid. I did not get the cleaning system, that part seems kind of gimmicky to me. The unit charges up fast and is considerably lighter and quieter than my 3 year old Panasonic shaver. I think the blades and motor speed make the biggest difference in a shaver, not so much the pivot action even though this model has an intricate pivot mechanism. Overall seems like a great unit.
  433. I just picked this up a couple of weeks ago to replace a Norelco shaver with the three round blade configuration. I have to say that I prefer the three round blade style better than this flat blade style. It just seems like with the flat blade it is easier to get your whole face quickly. I may just need to get used to this style of shaver. My one other comment is that this unit is very loud. It is at least twice as loud as the Norelco it replaced.
  434. I had an old Braun that finally just died and was in need of a new electric razor. The Braun never gave me a satisfying shave but it was good enough for when I needed to look semi-presentable in a hurry.<br /><br />After using the Panasonic for the first time this morning I am very impressed. It's fast, extremely comfortable, and plowed through my very tough beard painlessly (both figuratively and literally).<br /><br />Cleaning is easy (you can use water on it) and you won't end up with stubble pouring out of the unit while you're using it.<br /><br />Superb product.
  435. The best electric shaver I have ever used. I have only used it dry shaving but it is great. I have tried the new braun and norelco and the Panasonic is by far the best.
  436. It was finally time to replace my 10-year old Norelco razor with rotating heads, and I decided to try a foil razor for the first time since I've had my \\"grown-man\\" beard (my first electric was a foil, but I merely had peach fuzz). I tried the Braun series razor that my friend has, and it worked great, but I just couldn't see spending $200.<br /><br />While this razor worked great on my face, it did nothing for my neck. I've got thick, course Italian hair, and it grows in different directions on my neck. I went over my neck several times, trying all different angles, pressure and directions, but just wouldn't take care of the neck hair. I decided to try it for about 5 days, just to see if it just took getting used to, but it still did nothing.<br /><br />I will say that the razor was light, but sturdy, and ran quietly. Everything else about it was great, it just couldn't clean my neck.<br /><br />I wish I could separately review the return process, because I would have given that 5 stars. I didn't like it, I followed the online instructions for return, and within about a week or so, I had my money back. You can't ask for better service.
  437. Really liking this shaver. I had a Braun I loved for years and this shaves closer, I was pleasantly surprised. Great product and a great price.
  438. The Panasonic Wet/Dry shaver does very well. It's a good design and removes most of my facial hair comfortably. When accompanied by a blade makes my shave especially close. It was my experience that regardless if the shaver is Panasonic or Braun it doesn't really matter that much. There are obvious design differences but both shavers perform almost equally given comparable model types. A blade is almost always needed to remove the facial hair that the shaver couldn't quite get. Using a combination of an electric shaver and a blade gets my shave much closer and definitely more comfortable than just using a blade alone regardless if the blade is a top of the line Gillette, which probably the best blade design available.
  439. I cannot see how anyone with any skin type could ever be disapointed with this shaver! Unlike most electric shavers that ask you to shave with theirs for a few weeks to get use to the shave(most likely so that you will forget how much better your old shaver was than theirs);from the very first shave this shaver had me sold. I shaved with it dry for a few days without any skin products and thought I couldn't be happier. And then I shaved with it in the shower, just using bar soap. My wife said that my face was as smooth as a baby's behind (except that the crack was going the wrong way.) Spend some time shopping around on the internet for your best deal on the shaver. I bought mine on Amazon for almost half off.
  440. 12/13/2015 Six 1/2 year update: After more than six years of daily use, this razor still works and looks almost like new with the original foil and blades. It took a little time to get used to this new lighter model. I have learned that each razor has its own characteristics. Once I learned how to shave with this model, I started getting some very close comfortable shaves. I am now quite pleased with it. For this reason, I have deleted my old review and replacing it with this new review. I am changing my rating from 3 stars to 5. One cannot go wrong buying this shaver. Especially, since I see that the price has dropped considerably.<br /><br />Pros:<br />* Light weight and quiet.<br />* Ergonomic design is very comfortable to hold.<br />* Nice close shave (especially for an electric shaver.)<br />* Built-in ultrasonic self-cleaning feature (this an EXCELLENT feature). I love it! No fancy cleaning gadgets or solutions are ever required.<br />* Digital battery life remaining display (many shavers don't even have this feature anymore). So, enjoy this feature while it is still available.<br />* Cuts the long hairs as very well.<br /><br />Cons (only for me):<br />* No charging stand (but cord is better for a traveler).<br /><br />I am 69 years old. I have never had to replace the blades or foil on any of my electric razors. TIP:<br /><br />1. Keep your shaver blades and foil clean. Don't ever let your razor get filled with days/weeks worth of whiskers, foam, lotions, etc. With this Panasonic shaver, cleaning is very fast and efficient. The built-in ultrasonic cleaning is truly fantastic. This shaver will actually remind you to clean it before each recharge.<br /><br />2. Let the shaver glide over your face. Pressing down too hard taxes the motor and will wear out the foil faster.<br /><br />2. The blades will stay very sharp if (after a cleaning) you remove the blades and soak them in rubbing alcohol overnight (90%+ alcohol). I soak the blades once each month. My grandfather gave me this tip a long time ago. I don't know why it works, but I have never had to replace my electric shaver blades and still got shaves as if the blades were new.<br /><br />I have sensitive skin but do not have a heavy beard. So, I cannot speak to how this shaver would work for someone with coarse thick whiskers.<br /><br />UPDATE: As of December 13, 2015, this shaver is still working perfectly for me with the original blades and screen (see above). I still get 8-9 shaves out of a single charge. It's still a pretty amazing razor. If this razor ever broke down, I would immediately buy another.ace my electric shaver blades and still got shaves as if the blades were new. I have sensitive skin but do not have a heavy beard. So, I cannot speak to how this shaver would work for someone with coarse thick whiskers. UPDATE: As of December 13, 2015, this shaver is still working perfectly for me with the original blades and screen (see above). I still get 8-9 shaves out of a single charge. It's still a pretty amazing razor. If this razor ever broke down, I would immediately buy another.

  447. Bought this model because it was ranked as the third best Pansonic shaver you could buy. I've had some bad and good experiences with other Panasonic shavers. First off this shaver is very friendly to the face. You won't get razor burn if you shave properly. It's not overwhelming like the Panasonic four head blade shaver, essentially this is a trimmed down version of the best shaver Panasonic sells. No electric will provide the closeness of a blade, so in that sense be realistic when you buy one of these. This razor will give you around a 98% blade closeness. A braun will give you around a 96% closeness, a norelco you're looking at around 93%. Your face will be smooth after using this razor. The best part is that it won't beat up your neck and give a very smooth and close shave. It lacks a little around the cheeks, but other than that it is well worth the value. The only downside is that the power cord is a bit hard to take out from the shaver.

  461. I was hesitant to buy this shaver because of the negative reviews...particularly the recurring problems of water seepage and battery issues, and the seemingly difficult dealings with Panasonic customer service. Nonetheless, I had to purchase a panasonic because I have an allergic reaction to Nickel, and they are the only manufacturer's of nickel-free foil type shavers.<br /><br />Thus far, the shaver works fairly well. It shaves my moustache and my chin fairly cleanly and on the first pass. The neck area around the adam's apple required a few passes, but all around was pretty close and clean. It is odd, however, that the shaver head moves from left to right instead of front to back (like my old Braun) which requires some getting used to. I like the LCD that allows me to see battery remaining, however, it is only so useful in the sense that it displays in 20% increments. Haven't tried it in the shower yet, so no insights there. The trimmer works fairly well.<br /><br />A few downsides. The shaver seems to get quite hot after a prolonged usage, which can be uncomfortable for some. Also, the shaver is incredibly LOUD. I was shaving in the bathroom and it could be heard all the way in the living room of my house. Some reviews had mentioned this, but even I did not believe it could be so loud. The loudness is so irritating that I decided to take one star away. Otherwise this is an almost perfect shaver for me. I will say that if Braun manufactured a nickel-free shaver, I would have stayed with Braun. But as a replacement to Braun this has worked well so far...
  462. I've got very sensitive skin, and wanted to get away from using normal bladed razors because of what it was doing to my skin. This razor has a fantastic cut. When wet shaving, it's close enough to a blade shave that I can't tell the difference. Dry shaving is still good, but not as close. My hair is very fine, so I I can't comment on how it compares for thick hair. Although it's a great product, my skin is just too sensitive. After using it for a 2 months or so now, shaving daily, I needed to find something else. I've gone to using an epilator now, which seems to effect my skin less. It's by far the best razor I've ever used though, and I highly suggest it.

Completely dry it gives a decent shave which is very uniform over the entire face, but it takes several passes to get a reasonably close shave. I use it on weekends when I do not need the clean shave of a razor and am happy with it.
  493. I originally bought the ES-LT41-K Arc3 and the display started to malfunction so within the year's warranty I mailed it back to Panasonic and got an &#34;upgrade&#34; to this ES8103S Arc3. Unfortunately within the year of using it the display malfunctioned again, and worse, the shaver just decided to stop working. If I ever get another Panasonic wet/dry shaver, I'm pretty sure I won't use it near water again. It's only about 1.5 years since I've been using it, and while it worked, it worked ok. Disappointed and probably won't buy another Panasonic shaver again.
  494. This electric shaver is exactly what I was looking for: 1) economical, 2)efficient, 3) easy to clean & maintain, 4) easy storage (there is no holder for the shaver).
  495. My boyfriend loves this shaver! It works better on shorter hair, not so well on 3+ day hair.
  496. This electric shaver works great. The charge is quick @ ~1hr for a full charge. I am giving 4 stars instead of 5 because after reading the reviews I had expected the shaver to do a better job with short facial hair; but it takes a bit of effort to do so. Still its better than the Braun and Norelco shavers I had previously.
  497. I bought this shaver after some years of using a Remington Titanium shaver and decided to give it a shot to Panasonic. The cleaning process is simpler and faster than on others however I feel that the battery doesn't last as on the Remington. I have read other reviews and my conclusion is that the quality of the shave depends on your beard thickness. My beard is regular and I'm pleased with this shaver.

Impressions 5 days in, daily: works great, beyond expectations.<br />My background:<br />- Male, 40 y.o.<br />- Sensitive skin and thick, strong beard.<br />- Due to irritations, for the last year and a half or so I have been using only trimmer, no close shave. Permanent designer stubble.<br />- Before that, I have used Gilette Mach 3 blades and my neck would end up red for at least 4-5 hours and irritated even longer.<br />- I have used Braun electric shavers in my 20's, also with some irritation and in-grown hairs on the neck pretty much all the time.<br /><br />So, I started using this shaver on dry skin, no prep whatsoever, before showering. And the result is:<br />- Nice, close shave.<br />- Zero irritation!<br />- Zero in-grown hair (so far, only 5 days, daily shave).<br />- After the shower, I only apply my regular moisturiser, no aftershave needed.<br /><br />If the situation changes with time, I will update this review, but so far, works really great.

I'm really happy with this one.

  510. After my Norelco quit I began researching for a new shaver. I narrowed my search down between the Braun and Panasonic brands. After choosing one from each in a specific price range I read as many reviews that I could find. The Panasonic model had several more positive reviews than the Braun in the same price range. I have now owned this shaver for one month and am delighted with it. It shaves very close and like so many guys my neck area gets irritated easily. This razor does not give me that irritation. The ergonomic design is very comfortable to hold and the foil head follows the contours of my face every bit as good as the triple floating head design I previously used. Cleaning of the foil head and cutters is a breeze as this wet/dry design makes that possible. Charging only takes one hour if the battery is completely down and I get 10 shaves before I have to recharge. The only thing I would like to see with this model would be a recharging stand. In conclusion this shaver: cuts close without irritation...excellent egronomic design.....easy to clean....charges quickly. I am very satisified with the Panasaonic ES8103S.

And guess what, it now (within way less than a year's time) it holds charges way and way shorter. Oh, and in case you're wondering; I do treat stuff gently and with respect. I'm disappointed in having to buy one of these every year, if they even last that long... May 29 update: Just lowered my rating from two stars to one star. The battery on this shaver has lasted me less than a year, since I now need to charge it after every use. So my bottom line on this product is: great technology, horribly cheap materials. In my book that equals to a bad deal and not a good way to spend $80.- Would appreciate learning of better alternatives, if they still exist in an era where almost everything is plastic from China. UPDATE: Early June I ordered a replacement hoping to fare better this time. Unfortunately no such luck, it is late July and the indispensable LCD display has already given up. Such a disappointment. Now considering my options because having to guess when the shaver needs recharging is not a lasting solution. Anyone out there know of any wet/dry shavers that will actually last...? FURTHER UPDATE (3/15): I have been extremely pleased for several months now with the Braun wet/dry 5040s. When I get around to it I will post a review on it elsewhere. Anyone else who is tired of cheap plastic &#34;make believe&#34; products from China (no disrespect for this great country or its people), I highly recommend the Braun series 5.   531. I decided to purchase this Panasonic product for a couple of reasons. First, I wanted to see how it would fair against my old electric shavers from different manufacturers (Braun & Remington). My second reason for purchasing this product was on the strength of the feedback that I had read on Amazon. This is a good electric shaver, with a great battery life. When it comes to shaving though, its not nearly as good as the Remington that I used to have. Which is both good and bad. Bad in the sense that as I have thick hair I sometimes have to go over a patch of skin several times before I get a clean shaven look and feel. Good in the sense that as the blades aren't super sharp its very kind on my skin (which is a bonus considering I have sensitive skin). The manufacturer claims that you can have a wet shave with this razor - and indeed you can. You can also wash the head of the razor and get the accumulated stubble out of there. However, what they don't tell you is that, if you do end up washing the razor or having a wet shave - and you let it air dry (that is to say that you don't towel or paper tissue dry it immediately) you will be left with a musty smelling razor. This doesn't inhibit the performance of the razor one bit but its more than a little annoying to have a brand new musty smelling razor - it doesn't exactly make me look forward to shaving my face in the morning! So all in all - if you choose to purchase this product - you can expect to buy a good performing razor that is easy on your skin but has a tendancy to smell musty if you don't dry it properly.
  532. Previous Brauns and Remington's just don't compare to this shaver. Its high speed motor cuts without any pulling or razor burn. I usually get about six shaves before recharging which is less than projected but acceptable. Cleaning is a breeze - the digital screen reminds you when to simply hold it under the faucet with some hand soap as well as showing the remaining charge. For the money this shaver is hard to beat ! The price was good and delivery was ahead of schedule. I recommend it highly as well as Amazon's prompt service.

  540. I've shaved w/an electric razor for about 15 years. Up until the Panasonic, I'd only used Braun. My first Braun lasted about 6 years. Wow, quality stuff, right? Well, not really because my next 2 Brauns (5735) only lasted about 2 yrs each. With the Braun prices going up and the quality of the Braun razors apparently going south, I decided to switch brands.<br /><br />I read a lot of reviews and settled on the ES8103S because of the percentage of 4-5 star reviews and the relatively low price. I've had 2 of these razors over the past 2 yrs.<br /><br />The Good:<br /><br />- Really fast charging. The on-screen LCD showed 100% charge in about an hour...pretty darn fast. A single charge is good for ~7 or 8 shaves.<br /><br />- The Panasonic shaves my face closer than Braun with less effort. The Panasonic really seems to glide over my face and neck with virtually no pull. It almost feels like it's rolling over my face while the Braun always felt like I was dragging it.<br /><br />- The trimmer works far better than my Braun.<br /><br />- Because several reviewers said this razor was noisy, I was a bit worried...needlessly. The Panasonic gives off a high-pitched hum - kinda like an electric mosquito - but is still more quiet than my Brauns.<br /><br />- Cleaning took less than a minute. Just 2 drops of dish detergent and run it under the faucet. I laugh when I think of the over-engineered cleaning/charging station used by the Braun...expensive, took up needless counterspace, and time consuming. Panasonic has done it right.<br /><br />The Bad:<br /><br />The LCD display is poorly engineered. I had to send my first one back as defective since the display went out after 2 charges. On my replacement razor, the display lasted about 4 mths. My display has been 'black' now for over a year. The razor still works fine, but it is a pain to have to guess when to charge it.<br /><br />Bottom line: Even tho it's a far better razor and less than half the price of the Braun, I can't recommend a razor with defective electronics. Too bad because it's a really good shaver...just faulty.the Braun, I can't recommend a razor with defective electronics. Too bad because it's a really good shaver...just faulty.

  544. This shaver replaced another Panasonic electric shaver (ES8018) which I have used for about four years. Interestingly the difference in the quality of the actual shave is more incremental then one would imagine when comparing the two shavers. The neck area is still a challenge for both shavers, although the this shaver does give a somewhat closer shave. I still find myself quickly going over my neck area with my Fusion razor when I want to get a close clean shave on my neck. I do find that this shaver does do a much better job on my chin area. In total I still find using an electric shaver a trade off which is acceptable for every day use, but for special occassions or just when I want to get a really close shave a blade is far superior. Also, I find that for touching up areas around the mustach or sideburns a blade is required to get a clean looking close shave. The Fusion or Proglide shave is much superior but at the exhorbonant price per blade using a good quality razor such as this Panasonic (especially at the discounted price paid) is both an acceptable tradeoff and a is an acceptable shave for everyday use. Shaving is a personal experience and I realize that many individuals may get a great shave with an electric shaver and as such my specific issues are based upon a person with sensitive skin and a fairly heavy beard. The shaver itself does not cause any irritation to my skin while giving a good shave and I would recommend this shaver as long as a perspective user does not think he will be getting the ultimate shave. The battery charge lasts for 8 to 9 shaves and the recharge is quite fast.
  545. Wow...had an older electric razor that was top rated some years ago. Had some problems with my chin breaking out using old electric razor as well as bladed razor. This Panasonic is TERREFIC..and the price was at least 20% better than local retailers. Should have purchased this years ago!!!!!

  547. I bought this razor after much searching and I must say I'm very impressed. it has its flaws but they are nothing that would make me not recommend it to my friends. here's my pros/cons list: Pros: Incredibly close shave, closer then a manual razor for me Battery lasts a long time (1 month for me @3 times per week) Easy to clean Able to use in the water Ability to lock the head Cons: Can miss small stubble and be hard to get it Metallic smell even after a month of use and cleaning every time Cleanup makes a mess, it sprays water everywhere So on my pros list the shave is the closest I've ever gotten. I came from a Gillette fusion something or other and its not even a close second. I am Caucasian with Hispanic roots so I have some thicker stubble after this thing mows through it and leaves my face super soft. (the wife is impressed) The ability to lock the head is great for the chin and sides of the face. makes it work so much better. I wouldn't call this a con but it is a issue I had in the beginning. I am 22 and still have acne breakouts and it can knick real badly if careless. the first shave was pretty bloody, but once I got used to it, no more issues. just something in my situation might want to consider, a norelco might be more forgiving. The only other issue I've got could be a common issue but since this is my first electric razor ill mention it. my face smells like a wet nickel after shaving with water. It hasn't improved much even after use. all in all it's a great razor and a great buy. :-)

  551. A little irritation at first then my face got used to the shave much faster than with my other razors.
  552. Great electric razor. I did a lot of searching for what would work for me (first time electric razor user) and with my thinner, lighter colored hair I needed the foil razor. This one works great, I still haven't replaced the blades and its been a year now. I shave about 2-3 times max a week. Also the battery is good for about 8-10 shaves for me.
  553. I have never had good luck from an electric razor. I bought this one specifically to shave my head after reading some reviews on the Panasonic razors. WOW, I am so impressed. I first tried it dry like any other electric razor I have used. I had better results than all the others, but not quite as good as a standard razor; however, no razor burn which I normally have problems with regardless of the razor. I then tried it with shaving cream to find the only difference between the results of this razor and a standard razor was the lack of razor burn. I am SOLD! I'm sure there might be some microscopic difference between the closeness of the shave, but I couldn't tell. Works well for shaving the head too. Completely smooth. (No, I'm not naturally balding. This means it would be a task for any razor, but with just a little bit of time it has great results.) Well worth the investment.
  554. This is my husband's third or fourth shaver, and by far his favorite. It gives a nice close shave without any irritation (he has sensitive skin). The trimmer blade opens out at a 90-degree angle, which is more practical for shaving necks and sideburns than other shavers he has owned, where the blade simply rose above the foils. The LED battery level display is a nice practical touch the prevents surprise dead batteries.
  555. I can't believe the difference this new razor makes. I've had a great panasonic 3 blade razor for over 7 years now, and it's been great. However, rather than get new blades for it (which is all it really needed), I got a new razor. Very impressed. My old Panasonic wet/dry lasted forever, and the battery still easily holds a charge for over a week. But this new one cuts very close and comfortably and is better in every way. It even cuts close dry. Unbelievable. I love it.
  556. Ergonomic design and a really close shave. I've tried all kinds of different razors and this is the best by far.
  557. This works pretty well. Even when I go a few days without shaving and the forest starts it will get through it. I have sensitive skin and this has been doing very well for me. I get a bump every now and then but could be I am doing something wrong. I haven't used a razor in 20 years because I would always get bumps on my neck that looked horrible. I tried this and it really works well. The battery life is excellent and the charge time is very short. I use this for a few minutes every morning and end up charging it every couple of weeks. There is a digital display that will tell you the amount of battery life that is left. I am around 4 months with this now and the blades still cut well after using it almost daily. The trimmer on the back works surprisingly well for an edge up or rouge hairs. This also has a cleaning mode to help keep the blades sharp longer. For the price I think this is an awesome shaver.
  558. I've always been a fan of wet/dry electric shavers. This one works pretty well. I like the LCD battery indicator. Battery seems to last reasonably long. No complaints here.
  559. Bought this for my husband and he really likes it. Great price too.
  560. Taken 2-3 shaves with this item. The first was with the most facial hair and it did quite poorly. It took a long time to shave and some patches and locations just would never shave away. The second and third shave I had only one days growth and it worked a bit better. But in all cases I have to go over my entire face with a disposable after using this unit. Because things improved, I assume that things will continue to improve. But if I always need to finish the job manually, I cannot justify keeping this shaver. Note that this has always been the story with me when I buy electrics over the years. I was very hopeful that this would be the answer to my shaving needs, but I hardly think it is going to.
  561.   562. My husband loves this razor. He shaves his whole head and face with it. Very smooth, as if he used a blade.
  563. All these years, I believed in the marketing hype and used the rotary shavers from Norelco(including arcitec 1050) and lived with the conclusion that if I wanted a smooth silky shave, I will have to use a razor blade. What was I thinking? I have always been a fan of Panasonic electronic items right from the days of the old tape recorders, VHS players, and it's HDTV and cordless phone sets. I should have put the trust in Panasonic and got their non-rotary shavers long time ago. Oh well, live and learn. This razor is the best razor ever. It has the finesse of a Gillete Mach3 minus the cuts and bruises. If you use it with the Nivea Gel, the skin is so soft and smooth, that my wife keeps gliding her hands over my cheeks over and over again. Technically speaking, it has two sets of linear blades, and a set of trimmer between the two blades. This is such a beautiful system that I can now even shave my private parts without fearing any cuts and my wife loves it now!! Thank you Panasonic.Thank you Nivea!!!!
  564. This is a really great shaver. I like using it in the shower with shaving cream and it leaves my face smooth as a babys bottom. I've normally used basic razors and $40 electric shavers, but this is definitely worth the money.
  565. I've tortured myself with rotary razors (Philips, Norelco, and Remington) for over twenty five years. I've even tried a Braun foil shaver once- the screen failed after 8 months of use giving me a nice cut on the chin. I ordered the Panasonic because of the very favorable reviews and because I was tired of shaving for 20-25 minutes with my Philips rotary which was just over a year old. The new blades would have cost me nearly $40.00 to replace, so I figured what the heck? GLAD I DID! In anticipation of the new razor arriving, I skipped shaving for three days to give it a proper test against my old razor. It literally took me a minute and a half to shave! I could hardly believe it! Not only was it quick, the shave was much closer than I have ever experienced with ANY of my previous razors. Smooth as a baby's bottom. The razor does require more than one pass, and as in other reviews, it is louder than a rotary. The sound is not bad though and is frankly not an issue at all. It needs to be charged in order to shave, but it charges very quickly. Based on my use so far, a charge should give me 7-10 shaves per charge. I would highly recommend this product to anyone wanting a good electric razor. I will never go back.

  582. I have recently owned a Phillips (Norelco) Arcitec. Before that another Norelco, Braun, and years ago a Remington. None of these come close to the level of matching a blade for a close shave as the Panasonic ES8103S. If you take the time to do it right, you will get a shave virtually as close as a blade in the dry mode. I haven't even tried it yet in wet mode because the results have been so good. I have a medium heavy beard and it is great. No problem with curved areas like the chin or neck contours. Pop up trimmer is also very good. decent battery life, easy to clean. The only surprise was the high-pitched whine of the motor, but you get used to that. However, at first, your sleeping partner may think that the alarm clock has gone off. 100% recommendation for this product, especially given the rather modest price.
  583. This review is for women who currently use or are considering using an electric shaver. I have sensitive skin and have been using an electric shaver on my legs for many years. I always shave in the shower using shaving cream. Until now, I have used assorted women's wet/dry models from Remington, Conair, and Panasonic. None of them produced as close a shave as a razor but for me it was acceptable that I was trading the close shave for less damage to my skin. It was time to buy a new one again and I read in a consumer article that there's no reason that a woman couldn't use a men's model foil shaver. After doing some research, I purchased the ES8103 from Panasonic. I have been using it now for about 6 weeks. In one word &#34;Wow!&#34;. Here's why: 1. Most importantly is the quality of the shave. The shave feels as close as a razor without damaging my skin. Vastly superior to all of the women's models that I have tried. I am amazed at how smooth the skin is after a shave. For women who are first transitioning to an electric shaver, remember that it will take a few weeks for your skin to adjust before you start getting close shaves. 2. There is a display (100%, 90%, 80%...) of how much charge is remaining. None of the women's models have this. To make sure that I wouldn't run out of power mid-shave, I was constantly charging the women's models. When they weren't holding their charge as well, there were times that the unit would stop mid-shave. I don't see that happening with the ES8103. 3. The ES8103 charges to full capacity in 1 hour. I'd leave my other models plugged in overnight or longer. Also, all of the women's models had a charging base (cradle) which is not very practical to pack when you travel. The ES8103 has a simple plug and cord (like for your cell phone). 4. While the ES8103 weighs a little more than the women's models, it is actually much better balanced and therefore, I find it much easier to use. Even though I have small hands, there is enough tapering in the middle that it is very comfortable to hold. I am delighted with this shaver. Used in the shower with shaving cream, it gives my legs the best shave ever. I will not go back to any of the women's models. Update 03/22/2017: I can't believe it's 5 yrs later and I'm still using the same shaver! None of the women's models lasted anywhere near that (if I recall maybe 12-18 months). Yes, I periodically replace blades and foil; that's to be expected. Battery still holds its charge well and I still get a good shave on my legs. Now that's good value :)
  584. I gave up on electric shavers years ago when I couldn't find one that did not irritate my neck regardless of how long I tried to let my skin \\"adjust\\". I recently found myself in a situation where I needed to shave at least twice a day. Safety razors were a real pain and I decided to try electrics again. After reading the reviews, I selected the Panasonic ES8103S. It does not irritate my neck. It didn't irritate on the first day and it still hasn't. It doesn't shave as well as a blade either. There are places that it leaves stubbly regardless of what I try. So, I pull out a safety razor and finish the job. Luckily, I don't need shaving cream for such minor touch up work. In effect, this electric shaver has mostly replaced shaving cream, making the shaving task quicker. Still, on those occasions that I need a close shave (date nights, schmoozing, ...) I use a razor and shaving cream.
  585. It took me three tries to find a decent replacement for my old Braun 2000 series shaver after it finally died. Started off with a Remington and was not happy, it would take forever to produce only a halfway decent shave. Next I tried a newer Braun. It was better than the Remington, but similar problem in that it took a long time to shave and did not shave as close as my old Braun 2000. Third time was the charm with the Panasonic. Produces fast close shave and at reasonable noise levels. I prefer using it dry, but it did ok the one time I used it in the shower. The trimmer could be a little better but overall I am very happy with the product.
  586. Released product very good. I just add the sizes of blades to suit the height of the cut, because the cuts are very close to the skin. Not the sideboard, but Razor! It is excellent!
  587. Well where do I begin? I bought this electric razor when it was priced around $78. I saw the price recently dropped to $69.99 and I can see why. This razor is an overpriced piece of plastic and I would not pay $20 for this thing. Pros: -Looks nice... that's about it -Impressively close shave for an electric razor BUT only if you're willing to shave all your skin off with the hair Cons: -Loud to the point the noise hurts your ears when you shave any part of your face or neck near your ears -Constantly misses hairs no matter how many times you try to shave them so you need a tweezer to pull the hairs out -Inconsistent and uneven shave -Terrible design (If you have a tight or average jawline the head of the razor will be too big and make it nearly impossible to shave hairs along the jawline even though the head flexes side to side) -Deceiving charging meter fails to show individual percents (such as 1%,2%,3% and so on) so you only have levels of 100%,90%...20%,10% meaning once you get to 10% you have no idea when the shaver is going to die on you I have struggled with sensitive skin with shaving ever since I began shaving. I easily get razor bumps and acne when I shave too close or get any cuts from shaving. In fact, the only acne I ever get comes from shaving because if I don't shave it goes away. I read online that the best thing for people with sensitive skin and acne is to shave with an electric razor so I decided to try this one after all the positive reviews. The first time I used this shaver I was impressed. I got a close shave and I didn't see any cuts yet for some reason the center of my neck was extremely red. I soon realized my neck was red because that entire region had been rubbed raw and my skin felt like a first degree burn the entire day. So the next time I decided to not press so hard and go slower. This time I found the shave completely uneven and my neck was still slightlyraw even using shaving cream. Some spots would be smooth, others would have stubble, and others would just have hairs that looked uncut. Keep in mind I didn't change my shaving method at all while shaving, the razor just shaved some hairs so they were cut shorter than others as the razor passed. Since they were not all cut the same length I had to go back over each region to get an even shave otherwise my face would look ridiculous. As I tried to even out the shave I found that it took several passes (like 5 or 6)to finally make all the hairs even length and by then I had multiple cuts all over my face and neck. One thing to note is that I do not have a thick beard at all and I usually can get by shaving once every two days or so and even though I tried this razor every day for a few weeks dry, with soap, and with shaving cream and no matter what I continually had the same problem and the hairs never \\"adjusted\\" to the razor as everyone claims they do. As I continued to use this razor I found that the electric razor irritated my skin more than my 3 blade razors ever had and my acne only got worse rather than better. Overall the problem with the razor is there are only two shaves: An extremely close shave that will leave you skin raw and cause more skin irritation than any regular razor or a uneven shave that looks like you just decided to randomly press the razor against several spots on your skin and then just stopped there. In the end I simply returned this product and chose to go with the single bladed disposable razors and so far those have been the best for my sensitive skin and have eliminated nearly all my previous problems with razor bumps and acne.
  588. This review is for the Panasonic ES8103S Pro-Curve Wet/Dry Rechargeable Linear Pivot Action Shaving System,Silver. Very close shave, but slow. I must go over the same areas multiple times.   604. I tried getting by with cheap shavers for a long time but they kept yanking out hairs and not giving me a close shave.   605. I purchased this razor based on Consumer Reports recommendations and Amazon user reviews. I would say those sources are generally accurate, and I'll add the following comments. This razor does not shave as close as a blade, but neither does any other electric razor I've used. Getting a reasonably close shave takes time and multiple passes over the same areas, unlike a blade where two passes (one \\"with the grain\\" and one \\"against the grain\\") produces a truly close shave. So in my opinion, there's nothing special about the ES8103, but it's basically a good razor and I like the battery level display which allows you to judge whether or not there's a complete shave left in the battery.
  606. I've only had the shaver for three weeks and so far so good. Have used only as a dry shaver so far, but that's my routine. This razor also has a fast re-charge time, it's done in an hour. Lastly, the noise level of this razor is normal, it's no louder than a Braun, Remington or Norelco..... I would definitely recommend this product if your looking for a new electric razor.

  609. I have tried electric shavers in the past but have always gone back to a traditional razor, even after using the very expensive electrics.
