  610. I just bought this shaver 4 weeks ago based on lots of reviews on this site and some new technology. But to my utmost surprise, no one has ever said anything about back and forth motion. Every razor in this world works both ways - back and forth motions. It is so much hyped about one pass shaving. But that is just not true. One pass leaves a lot of hair not cut. I am using Remington classic to cut the rest of the hair with backside motion. I used to own Panasonic ES8066 and still own it. It still works so great and works both ways. ES8103 does not come even close to ES8066. I called Panasonic technical support for shavers and the lady picks up the phone who had no clue what I meant by back and forth motion. It is just so weird. I would not recommend this to anyone. Nano technology is worse than the old technology. If I have to use two shavers to get a one day shave, it should go to the drawing board again and worked on it and tested extensively before releasing into the common market. Panasonic should make a big note of it. I would even like to hear the comments from Panasonic on this. Rocky
  611. I've always had remingtons because they were cheaper. I wasn't dissapointed with them and they do the job but now that I've had this one for over a month I can tell you that its much better.   612. So far I love this shaver. I'm a former Braun user, and when their product went substandard, I went with this Panasonic shaver. It is pretty much a 'one pass' shaver. It uses a lithium battery, so it's display always shows how much of a charge you have in percentage. Plus, it will let you know when it's time to clean it. Cleaning it is really easy and just requires a little liquid soap squirt onto the top of the shaver, a little water and then the push of a button. 20 seconds later you rinse it clean with another 20 second cycle. 40 seconds to clean a shaver is pretty darn good. I and my family have used Braun electric shavers for the past 9 years. Up until now I felt that their shavers were one of the best. I replaced an old Braun shaver with this one (Braun Series 3 340 Men's Shaver) in May of 2011 and paid a premium price for it. The first thing I noticed is that it didn't have the same cutting power as the older one. Plus the design wasn't as solid. After six months of use, a part inside shook loose and now it buzzes loudly and the whole unit shakes in my hand. So having called Braun about the warranty their 'outsourced' customer service asked a lot of questions to see if the product had been misused in any way and then said I must ship it to their local repair affiliate at my expense. From this they will determine whether or not to repair or replace it. BTW - hang on to your receipts or you will not have a warranty. We sent it in and are waiting for their response. In the meantime, since I have no idea when I'll have a working razor again (as they offered no turn-around time), I purchased a highly rated 'Panasonic ES 8103 S' which so far has been excellent. So much better quality and engineering than the Braun. Clean and mostly one pass shaving, easy to clean and maintain. A lot of thought when into the design of the Panasonic shaver.
  613. This is my second purchase of this model razor. The first was stolen and I've missed it everyday until the new one arrived. It works really well for my light whisker type both wet and dry. I also like the ergonomic handle.
  614. This shaver provides a good clean shave. I already ordered a back-up screen and cutter to have on hand when the time comes I need it. The shaver is a little lightweight and parts are made of plastic - that's why I gave it a 4 instead of a 5.
  615. does a decent job with the shave, over time the display gives out and it is hard to see what charge remains on the razor
  616. I bought this shaver with the hopes that it would prevent ingrown hairs that I usually get when I shave. After fully charging it, I gave it a try and was relatively satisfied with the results. Now granted this was my first experience with an electric shaver (I use the old school straight razor), but I thought it took a long time to get a clean shave. After about 15 to 20 minutes of working on my face (which had just a few days of growth), I was almost clean shaven. Almost because there were small patches of hair that refused to be cut down. So it may have been my overly high expectations or the limitations of the product, but I didn't think it provided me with an adequate \\"clean shave.\\"<br /><br />So the next day after the shave, I had a severe case of ingrown hairs and it took a couple of days for the subsequent rash to dissipate. I ended up returning the product. Overall, I would recommend buying this product if you don't have problems with ingrown hairs and don't mind spending some time shaving (which is ironic because I thought the point of an electric shaver was to shave more quickly).<br /><br />Again, just to be fair, the product seemed well built and solid. I think its useful for some people, but definitely not for everyone. If you want to save your money, I recommend growing a beard, as I'm currently doing (keeps you warm in the winter, saves on shaving supplies, and makes you look wiser).
  617. I've waited several months before writing this review, for my beard to fully acclimate to the shave provided by the Panasonic ES8103s Wet/Dry Electric Shaver. I'm a mid 60s-year-old man who has used a blade razor for more than 40 years. The reason I needed to switch to an electric shaver is because of a neurologic condition which has made using a blade razor a dangerous adventure resulting in a lot of nicks and cuts to the face. After reading many reviews (thanks everyone!) I chose the Panasonic ES 8103s wet/dry shaver directly from Amazon for $79. It arrived in a few days and was promptly put to use. Even though it can be used either wet or dry, I find myself using it dry almost every morning. It fits well in my hand and isn't too heavy for the approximately 10 minutes it takes to shave, yet its solidly built and comes apart easily to clean. As close as the Panasonic ES8103s shaves, neither it nor any other electric shaver will shave as close as a blade - especially some of the new, multi-blade razors. After the beard adjusts - the shave with the Panasonic will be acceptable. You may have to \\"touch up\\" if you're heading out in the evening after originally shaving in the morning. I've tried many different pre-shave lotions and found good old Williams Lectric Shave does best. After shaving, the Panasonic comes apart easily for clean up in soapy water. It may not equal the shave of a blade razor for closeness - but the Panasonic ERS8103s comes pretty close.
  618. I bought this for my dad after his old one (9 years old) quit working. He is just thrilled with the results. It gives him the shave that he wants and it charges in a hurry. He is very happy with this razor.
  619. Have only used this for a week but it replaced a 8 year old Braun 5601 and man o man, what a performance difference! This thing is night a day difference in speed and close-ness. My old Braun had new razors and screen but was a dog in comparison how quick and close this shaves. I hope I feel this way for next 1-3-5 years with this shaver (of course with new razors from time to time).
  620. I really like my razor. It is quiet, does a great job cutting my beard. I am very satisfied with this product.
  621. Finally a razor that works! I had tried Norelco and Braun and it would take a long time to get a clean shave. This Panasonic has a nice wide trimmer for longer hair, and the shaver makes for a smooth easy shave. I used to have trouble getting the hair on my neck, this razor makes short work of it. Happy with this purchase. May try another type/brand later, but not until this one stops working.
  622. The charger on this model buzzes when it's plugged in. If you're over 50 you might not hear it, but this is a deal breaker for me. It wasn't a fluke either. Amazon replaced the first unit (with free return shipping), and the second one had the same problem. It's too bad too, the shaver gives a nice close shave without any razorburn.
  623. I've been using electrics for over 40 years. This shaver is the best one I've ever used by a long shot. It shaves close and fast. It is the only one I've owned that does a good job on neck hairs. It can shave wet or dry. I shave dry. I just shaved 2 days growth in less than 3 minutes. Before It would take at least twice that long. Plus I'd have to clean anything it would miss with a disposable that I would just wet and use without any shaving cream. I used to have to shave the same area over and over and over and... I've had Norelco, Braun and Remington shavers. This one replaces a Panasonic which was the best one up until now and lasted about 8 years. Nano technology is supposed to be a super tough coating that allows the foil to be thinner and resist wearing out. Time will tell. The only minor drawback is the charger. The old one had a stand that you dropped the shaver into. Very convenient. The new one has a plug which is on the tight side. I get about 8 - 10 shaves per charge. It also has an ultra hi speed for cleaning the head. Just hold the start button down longer and it goes into cleaning mode. Put a little liquid soap on the surface and it cleans and lubricates. You then take off the head, rinse and let it dry.
  624. Takes a few shaves for your skin to get used to it, then it cuts great.
  625. This is a great shaver, especially for the price. Very powerful compared to my old Panasonic. Cleans easily and shaves great. Is it as close as a blade?   642. [[ASIN:B001DNE3KQ Panasonic ES8103S Pro-Curve Wet/Dry Rechargeable Linear Pivot Action Shaving System, Silver]]. I have used Remington (a few years back) then Braun (2). I like panasonic products so thought I'd try this razor. Don't really need all the bells and whistles so this one is perfect. It gives me a smooth shave, is easy to handle (pretty light), confortable, and the battery percent left display is a great feature. All in all I really like this razor
  643. This is by far the best electric razor that I've ever had. It leaves my skin almost as a regular blade would do besides the fact that I can use it while my skin is still wet. I totally recommend it. Great product!
  644. After using a Norelco shaver for a number of years and thinking that it was the most comfortable shaver, I'm rather impressed at how well this Panasonic shaves. Looking at the price, I must admit I really didn't expect much. But after reading some of the reviews on this product, I gave it a shot. And I'm glad I did. I used to get burns on some parts of my neck from the Norelco, and I thought it was just my sensitive skin. But no matter how hard I try, I can't get the Panasonic to leave any burns! I absolutely love this shaver. It shaves close but is never uncomfortable on my face. This one is a keeper! I've thrown the Norelco into the trash can (minus the battery of course). Just a couple of notes: some reviewers mentioned the noise, and that was my concern at first, but it's only as loud as a Norelco. Since the motor runs faster on this, the noise is a little more high pitched than other shavers and some may consider that annoying or loud. It doesn't bother me at all. The battery lasts about a week for me, as compared to 1.5 to 2 weeks for the Norelco, but I really don't care since this shaver is a class above anything I've tried so far.
  645. Best feature of this shaver is the close, pain-free, smooth shave. I would say 99% as smooth as razor, the difference is nominal - I can't tell the difference visually. I have a thick, tough beard and the Panasonic breezes through in very few passes. I get even better results on shaving the mustache than I do with my razor. The neck area is where the shaver has some difficultly. I think this may be because I shave in the shower and the shaving cream has a tendency to wash off. After a second application of cream I can get as close. No razor burn, no in-grown hairs (I do get these with razors). It takes a few extra minutes to complete the shave compared to razor (maybe 7-8 min vs. 5-6 min). All in all I am pleased with the experience and do not plan to move back to razor.<br /><br />*** UPDATE ***<br /><br />I still highly recommend this shaver for the quality of shave and positive experience with Panasonic. I have had issues with the battery and screen; however, given the benefits that I mentioned above, I am comfortable purchasing this shaver again.<br /><br />Let me take a step back. I have owned two ES8103S shavers over the past three years. My first shaver began to show problems with the screen after about six or seven months of daily use. Notably, the shaver had evidence of vapor on the inside of the screen. As I have mentioned before, I use it in the shower and it periodically falls. All things considered, the shaver has held up well despite the drops. At some point; however, water must have seeped behind the screen despite not showing any visible sign of damage. After several months, the screen went blank and the battery slowly stopped charging. It went from 5-6 shaves per charge to 4 to 3 to 2, then zero charge.<br /><br />So next I called Panasonic (after it finally died) and explained that I received this shaver as a gift and it was purchased about 11 months ago. Since it had a one year warrantee, the Panasonic rep explained that if I could get a copy of the receipt I would be able to send it in for repair or replacement. I was able to send a copy of the Amazon email receipt (from the person that gave me the gift) and Panasonic sent me a pre-paid label to attach to any box to send the shaver in. I had to send the shaver and charger together. After about three weeks I received a brand new ES8103S in the mail. No other calls, email, or follow-up was necessary on my part. Despite the three weeks without a shaver, I thought this was fantastic customer service. Actually, having switched to razor for three weeks, I realized how much I loved the ES8103S and had started taking it for granted.<br /><br />So I have had the replacement razor for about two years now. I have been much more careful about not letting it drop and the screen has held up well - until a few weeks ago. The battery is still fine and the shave is as good as ever. But, I have no idea how much battery power is left. The screen lights up but does not display a legible value. There is no water or vapor behind the screen this time. It seems that the screen and/or battery have a couple of year lifespan. I find this lifespan acceptable as I am still saving compared to the cost of replacement razors. I have found that the ES8103S replacement cost is about the same as the cost of razors with a one year lifespan. My two ES8103S shavers have averaged about a year and a half lifespan (although my current razor is still usable). Therefore the ES8103S still enjoys a cost benefit to shaving with razors.<br /><br />*** Update 2 ***<br /><br />Another year goes by and the (2nd) razor is still going strong. The screen started to turn partially legible during the year (I'm not sure when) and I can read some of the numbers - it's enough to know if it is close to needing a charge. I can not tell the difference between 50% and 60%, but I know when it gets to 20% (And this is usually time to recharge). The battery has also suffered a bit - it gives about 3-4 shaves per charge.With the extended life, I have to change my economics from above - the razors have averaged a 2 years plus lifespan; and, the economics are far in the favor of the Panasonic vs. (the ever rising) costs of Gillette-style blades.With the extended life, I have to change my economics from above - the razors have averaged a 2 years plus lifespan; and, the economics are far in the favor of the Panasonic vs. (the ever rising) costs of Gillette-style blades.
  646. Excellent product. Works as advertised. Would and have recommended. Can use in or out of the shower. Cleans very easily..
  647. I bought this as a replacement for a rotary electric that was OK, but not great (the battery on that one finally died). Based on some of the rave reviews for this shaver, I guess I was expecting it to walk on water. It does a very good job, but I do find that need to go over my face several times to get all spots, especially on my neck and under my chin. If you push too hard, it will irritate your skin, like any other electric. Of course, using it wet or with some shaving cream makes it less irritating. It's a great razor to use when you don't want to take a chance at cutting yourself with a blade, or when you just want a quick dry shave to clean up before going out, without the hassle of shaving cream, etc. I use it about half the time I shave, and I think my skin is a little happier than it was with my rotary. My Dad borrowed it when he visited, and he really thought it was great. It's easy to hold, cleans up easily under running water, charges quickly, has good charge retention, and has a good strong cutter with a thin foil. I'd probably buy it again if given a second chance to buy an electric.
  648. I have a very tough beard and this is hands-down the best shaver I have ever used. Great price and great shave. I haven't tried it with shaving cream, only dry, but I've been very happy and have used it for at least two years now.

It won't even cut a hair I place inbetween the blades.   678.   680. I have owned Panasonic electric razors since they came out on the market and have converted many other friends to them as well. I think my usage may go back twenty years...possibly more. At first they had fixed shaving heads and since Li batteries hadn't been invented yet, NiCd batteries instead. Then they made a floating head, amped the RPM and increased charge time with Li batteries. I have very fair, sensitive skin as I am blond. I had tried other electric razors before, but they pulled and burned. They just didn't give me a close shave until I stumbled upon Panasonic electrics. I use them wet while showering. I still use blade razors on occasion, but for those tight areas around the mouth, my Panasonic is my go to razor. No cuts; no burns; no bandages. Granted, since my experience is limited to just a few electric brands, there may be other electrics that work equally well...or gasp...even better, but for me I am completely satisfied and see no need to improve upon what I consider to be a great razor. Other than occasionally buying a new foil and blades, they seem to last forever. I often upgrade not because my razor stopped working, but because it's time for a newer technology or bell/whistle.
  681. I came to the Panasonic ES8103S from the Braun 7000 Syncro series. I had the Braun for over 10 years and loved it. It saved me a ton of money on disposable razor blades and helped me get a good shave without irritating my neck, which traditional disposables roughed up to the point of embarrassment. Unfortunately, the charger cord would no longer make a consistent connection which kept me from being able to charge the shaver. So I went looking for another Braun. However similar Brauns to my 7000 Syncro are now quite expensive. I paid $100 for the Syncro 10 years ago and had in mind to spend about the same amount. I came across the Panasonic and while I'd always heard good things I'd never used one. I'm glad I decided to give this thing a try. It is superior to the Braun in almost every respect. It shaves a lot closer, cleans much easier, charges faster and is, at about $80, a great value. Moreover, it doesn't make the mess my Braun used to. It captures most of the hairs it cuts inside the shaving block. The old Braun used to spread most of those all over my sink. The one draw back to the Panasonic vs. the Braun is the Braun has a better long hair trimmer. The Panasonic's is good for light touch ups but the Braun's could really do some heavy cutting. As for the shave, I have a medium beard and a sensitive neck. The Panasonic shaves much, much closer; almost disposable razor blade close. It took my skin a couple of weeks of shaving to adjust. Panasonic gives you 30 days to try it out and they also tell you to give it 30 days for your face to adjust. Obviously, with that schedule you'd run out of time. My suggestion is to give it a good 3 weeks of regular use and if you don't like it send it back. Me? I'm keeping mine and certainly recommend the product. A couple of other things to keep in mind: the shaving block replacements for the Panasonic are approximately $25 to $30 and cheaper than many of the other shaving blocks. That's a reasonable pricesince you'll probably want to switch out every 6 to 8 months. The shaver is surprising lightweight but doesn't feel cheap. It is clearly well made. I've only used it to shave in the shower one time and have not tried it with shaving creams, though I understand it can be used with them. And while it is a wet/dry shaver from what I've found on the Internet it is not fully water proof; more like water resistant. I'm happy to use it for dry shaving or for use on a wet beard and washing the shaving block off under the sink.
  682. Not as good as other shavers I have used in the past. It will remove some hair but it takes many, many passes over the same area to do even a partial removal. These many passes leave the skin all chafed and red. It requires a lot of time to remove just the fairly small amount that it accomplishes. It may work well on other types of beards but my beard is a challenge it can't meet.
  683. This is actually the second one I bought. Almost as good and economical as DE shaving, but faster to use when you include setup and cleaning. Given how simple, yet powerful and useful it is (faster and more precise than a three-head rotary shaver for me.), I could not resist the super sale! The first one has served me well for over 4 years with one change of blades and foil and is still going strong, but I plan to stop changing em and use it only for travel. I hope the new one serves me well for years to come!
  684. In my many years I've used 'em all. Owned, wore 'em out, and thought some were better than others, but this one has topped them all for comfortable and ease of use that leaves me with a close shave that feels like I've had a clean close shaved. I don't think you'll be disappointed, especially if you have used others.
  685. I have been using the previous Panasonic model almost 10 years.<br />This model is smaller, softer and lighter than old model.<br />I like it :)
  686. Great shaver. One of the best Panasonic 3-blade shavers. This is my second ES8103S product. The first one had bad LED indicator after 1.5 years and was replaced by the manufacturer. Now I decided to by another one because it has very good battery and shaves close. I just bought another one for $59.00 instead of replacing the head set for $30.00 for the old shaver. Te battery holded a little less time after first year on my first shaver. but I keep buying this particular one because i like how it shaves. i tryied different shavers and this one is one of the best.
  687. I purchased this razor late in 2010 and have used it regularly since. I have fairly sensitive skin when shaving, using either an electric or manual blade...although I used to use a manual blade because the irritation wasn't as bad. This razor has caused very little irritation over the last year plus. What irritation it has caused is my own fault, because I'm in need of a new blade/foil. That being said I use this razor 2-3 times a week for nearly 1.5 years....and I've just recently been thinking of getting a replacement.<br /><br />My only complaint about this razor would be the underpowered trimmer. My facial hair is fairly soft and not very thick, but it doesn't take much to cause the trimmer to hang up. Personally I wasn't too concerned with the trimmer and rarely use it so I don't find it big enough of a deal to ding the razor for it.<br /><br />BTW, just for reference, when I purchased this razor it was in the $90-$100 range and I'd gladly purchase it again any day.
  688. first shave was great but then they started going downhill. it is no way as close as a blade no i would not buy another one
  689. I have bought this same shaver before for my husband. He asked for it again. So, I ordered it again from Amazon. Great price, great product!
  690. This is a fantastic shaver at a fraction of the price of a Braun with more features. Shaves better than a blade.
  691. This is my first go at an electric shaver. I switched because my current occupation requires a clean shave every day and a blade was irritating my skin. This shaves nearly as close as a blade but with none of the irritation. It takes a bit longer to achieve a comparable shave, but it's only another minute or two. It is easy to clean, not terribly loud, and comfortable.
  692. Hubby is very pleased with his gift from me which was recommended by our grandson.
  693. I got this shaver a couple of months ago hoping that I wouldn't have to use razor blades any more, because latetly I been cutinng myself while shaving. So I got this shaver on a recomendation of a good friend. Why only the four stars? Because it get to hot for my confort, I started shaving with the wet option but in order to get a close shave then you have to spend more time going back and forth to get a desirable shave. I guess the shaving cream was to thick to get close to the skin. Now the good part, I found in a coutry wide drugstore a product tha it will let you get a close wet shave in half the time and leaves your skin without irritation or bumps, the name Cremo shaving cream, is not cheap but for me is a great product, it says that one tube will last for 90 days, that I don't know. But it works good for me...

  705. It has been well over ten years since I used an electric shaver. If I had known that they had improved them this much I would have switched back years ago. Great, close shave. The older Panasonics used a base with a cableless charging connection to the shaver.   709. I have used Norelco shavers for 45 years and found them very dependable. I read the fantastic reviews of the Panasonic es8103s and gave it a try. This is a very good shaver with many good features. However, I doesn't get the hard to shave whiskers any better then my old Norelco did. In some hard to shave areas, I think the triple heads may be better. I am not down on this shaver mind you, but I feel some of the reviewers went a little overboard. The GOOD POINTS: Cleaning the Panasonic could not be any easier. Prompts on display for charging and cleaning are nice. Nice shape, fits hand well. BAD POINTS: Nothing but a cheap cloth bag to store it in, needs hard case to protect it. Gets quite warm while in use.   711. It does shave well and close, but it is not as quick as others here have stated. The trimmer is terrible (it could just be my hair).   712. I am a person who hates the chore of shaving my face. And with a back problem, cannot stand in front of a mirror for too long. I have had Remington, Norelco and my last razor for the last 5 years was a Braun. This Panasonic is a heaven sent to me. The clean, quick performance makes shaving a breeze. It is so hi-tech and quality built. The speed of the cutting heads gives me a very close shave in minutes. It charges up quickly ( 1 hour). Then tells me how much charge is left. When it is time to clean the heads, it will tell me that too with a prompt on the led display. But the most amazing thing of all is cleaning. I always hated to take the time to clean my old razors. I turn on the turbo speed blades...put it under a faucet and presto! It is cleaned. Dont hesitate to but this razor. You will love it!

  725. This is the best electric shaver I have owned! I use it dry and it gives me a very smooth shave, with no skin irritation. My face is almost 'baby' smooth. It does require multiple passes and I do stretch my skin. That said, it still is a fast shave. It can require a bit of effort on the neck, but it gets the job done. The trimmer works well. I used Brauns for many years. They were good, but the shave wasn't as close. I figured that's what you get with an electric shave. The Panasonic is a step up in technology and made a noticeable difference the first time. It is easy to clean and looks new afterwards. The digital readout is a nice touch. The one caveat is the battery doesn't hold that many charges. Because of how close it shaves, I can shave every second day. My beard is moderate, but noticeable. I have been using the shaver for three weeks now and get about six shaves per charge, which takes the readout down to about 10%. From there, it requires an hour or so to fully recharge. I would recommend this shaver. It is quite good!
  726. In purchasing a ES8103S, I am returning from a Panasonic 4-blade head to a 3-blade head.<br /><br />Why? Because the LCD screen on the $120 ES8243A broke within 12 months, and the the replacement foil/blade kit at $45 is excessively more expensive than the $28 kit for the $90 ES8103S.<br /><br />With poor design and/or build quality, I can't afford to buy a $120 razor that dies in 2 years. I only got half my use out of the expensive $45 foil/blade kit (I replace every year to assure maximum performance). Last week, My ES8243 turned itself on and off two times after what turned out to be its last shave, as if to bid me farewell, and passed away (the on/off switch became unresponsive).<br /><br />My first Panasonic was a 3-blade ES8065 that still works flawlessly. With a new head and blades, it can still rival the latest Panasonics. It has 2 LED lights, charging status and recharge (low battery) alert.<br /><br />As the ES8065 simply wouldn't die but I \\"assumed\\" that Panasonic's razor technology had moved forward after many years, I purchased a 3-blade ES8092 that turned out to be a disappointment in cutting performance. It has 6 LED lamps indicating the current battery level (100%, 80%, 60%, 40%, 20%, Recharge).<br /><br />I am extremely troubled to read so many recent ES8103S reviews stating their LCD screen died sometime within 12 months, no different than my ES8243. Perhaps moisture is getting inside, or Panasonic's LCD screens are simply CHEAP. I never had an LED indicator fail on my older Panasonic razors.<br /><br />After stubbornly continuing to dry shave for many years with my Panasonics, I have for the last 5 years enjoyed better results by wet shaving (with Aveeno shave gel).<br /><br />My new 3-blade ES8103S shaves almost as well as the 4-blade ES8243A, but without the extra weight and bulk. I'm sure more is better (a 4th cutting blade), but it isn't worth $30 more for the shaver and 17$ more for the rebuild kit.<br /><br />But with either model, I expectthe LCD screen to last 5+ years. If my ES8103S's LCD screen fails within 12 months like my ES8243A, I'm going to be a very unhappy camper.<br /><br />Panasonic also sells a model, the ES-LT41-K, with identical specs to the ES8103S (one difference, the ES-LT41-K's on/off switch has a travel lock). This is an Asian market model number and style. I prefer the ES8103S's US market styling.<br /><br />I miss the vertical charging stands that all Panasonic razors used to come with!!! Panasonic really lost points with me when they switched to the current charger and cord, a major step backwards.<br /><br />My ES8243A had a nice velvet-lined vinyl bag, while the ES8103S comes with a CHEAP cloth bag. My past ES8065 and ES8092 had nice velvet bags.<br /><br />My great ES8065, mediocre ES8092 and problem-plagued ES8243A were made in Japan. My new ES8103S is made in China. I suspect most of the parts for the Japanese-assembled ES8243A, aside from the foil, blade and motor, were imported from China. And likewise the China-assembled ES8103S has China produced parts, aside from the foil, blade and motor imported from Japan. My point being, although my ES8243A was assembled in Japan, it was problematic and short-lived.<br /><br />UPDATE: After just over 2 months of use, the LED display is failing. Two of the LEDs are dead. This is just what I was afraid of. This alleged wet/dry razor is not adequately water proof. I never had this problem dry shaving with Panasonics. But, I never got the closest shave with the Panasonics until I began wet shaving with them (Afta and Lectric Shave work, but the smell is absolutely horrible). I can't recommend that anyone invest $90 to $120 in the ES8103S or ES8243A when the displays fail within months.<br /><br />When I e-mailed Panasonic about warranty repair, I explained I was on an overseas assignment and wouldn't be back in the US for a couple of months. But instead of apologizing for their product's shoddy quality/design, they advised me that my warranty was cancelled because I'd taken the razor out of the US. Apparently, Panasonic doesn't approve of Americans working overseas, or at least doesn't want Americans to shave while they are overseas. I am NOT a satisfied Panasonic customer.
  727. I've had this a few months now. It gives as good a shave as the Remington/Braun/Norelco razors I've tried. Wish is ran while plugged in.   729. I have been an electric shaver user for years. My nine year old Braun was getting a little tired so I figured it was time to buy a new shaver. I looked over the Braun reviews and the customer satisfaction for Brauns in my price range wasn't so good so I decided to look around. I found that the customer satisfaction with the Panasonic shaver was very high and it had all the essentials without a bunch of gimmicks you don't need to get a good shave. I've had my Panasonic for about a month and I am very satisfied with it. The only reason I gave it four stars is not because of the shaver, but because the manufacturer promises more than the shaver can deliver. It is not a one-swipe shaver; you have to attack your whiskers from at least three different angles to get a close shave. You cannot shave in three minutes; it takes about the same time to shave with a Panasonic as it does with any good electric shaver ... about 10 minutes. And you cannot get 15 shaves out of a 50 minute charge at 10 minutes per shave. That being said, Panasonic is a good all-around shaver. Too bad the manufacturer isn't more honest about the product. They have nothing to be ashamed of.

  746. This has been a great shaver! I've always had good luck with Panasonic equipment, and the price/performance of this item has been no exception. The only issue that I have with the shaver is the fact that it has to be unplugged whenever it is to be used. Since this is a wet/dry service shaver, Panasonic chose to cut some cost by not including the option in &#34;dry&#34; use applications. I don't fault that decision at all as the charge on this shaver far surpasses any other brand's shavers that I've ever owned. This Panasonic is in use daily for both my face and my bald head. It cuts smooth and close...and it's fast. A great buy and a real bargain.

  748. I have used foil shavers for 40 years. I usually own modest priced shavers. I have owned a Braun 3 series. This Panasonic shaves the best of all I have ever owned and highly recommend it.   753. I have used electric shavers for a while now and I recently purchased the Panasonic ES8103S. The shaver is identical to the ES8109, which has the drying dock. I believe this shaver is far better than any other on the market due to its 30 degree blade and all other manufacturers use a 45 - 90 degree blade which requires multiple passes. (I'm an internet shopping junkie; hence I do a lot of research on details about products). It was definitely the right choice to get the ES8103S.
  754. After years of having a beard and the little hair from having a hippocratic bald head, I decided to shave it all off. An electric razor seemed to be faster and easier than my old Fusion blades. Well, on the top of the head anyway. So, I bought this Panasonic. I wanted to keep shaving in the shower using my \\"The Total Shaving Solution\\" oil. [...] Panasonic razors are recommended by them and they work great with the oil. It is smooth, fast, and no irritation at all. Of course, I didn't have any irritation with my Fusion either. It doesn't shave quite as close as the Fusion blade, but close enough. It is remarkably close for most areas. I think it works even better on the upper lip. It's not quite as good on the neck (front), but you have to rub to feel the difference because you can't see it. On the top of the head I can buzz over the bumpy scalp smoothly and easily without cutting anything. I do have to feel to find a few spots that are easy to miss. The head doesn't curve to fit the scalp, but none of them do. With the shaving oil in the shower, I get no build up of whiskers in the razor. I do rinse it out after easy shave, but have never seen anything there. It does remind me to do the soft-soap-cleaning about every 10 times, but it isn't a problem with nothing in there. I suppose my only complaint it that the battery only last for 4 shaves. OK, it is going over a lot of territory. It does charge remarkably fast though - about an hour. I highly recommend this razor for top, back, sides, and front of any head. I highly recommend using it in the shower with The Total Shaving Solution oil too. They make a great combination.
  755. I am 61 years old. I have tried various electric shavers over the years and NEVER found a one to be really as good as shaving creme and a Gillette Razor. Well, I have now ! This new Panasonic that I just purchased from Amazon.com is FANTASTIC. I don't use pre-shave either. I just take a bar of soap and lather my face slightly. All other shavers in my life made my face red and then after shave really burned. I get none of that with this razor. When razor blades from Sam's Club went up to around $40, that was the last straw. This really pleases me. Thank you.
  756. I have been a Panasonic user for nearly 10 years now and have been very impressed by the quality of the product, but more so by the quality of the shave. I am even more pleased with this latest version, as the shave is the best I have yet experienced, the noise of the shaver is virtually non-existent (compared to all earlier versions), and the feel and quality of the product remain high. However, I am a little disappointed with the battery duration. I suppose this caution is a bit unrepresentative of most users, as I shave my entire head, not just my face. To complicate my use approach, I have a full facial beard that I trim to a very fastidious level using the trimmer. My complaint is that I only get two or three of these shaves from the battery of this new product. That does not compare favorably to my previous version (5 years old), with which I got six to ten such shaves. In fact, one of the reasons I decided to get a new model was because the battery on the old one was beginning to diminish in strength and duration of usefulness. The saving grace for this slight disappointment is that the battery charges to full capacity in much less than an hour, so I can travel or do whatever at home without any serious shortage of availability to shave the way I have come to do this thing. Over all, I would recommend this shaver to anyone, even heavy users such as myself. I was just disappointed that the battery could not do better (overcome by rapid recharging). Panasonic is and will probably always be my preferred shaver. They seem to find a way to please me with each new iteration.
  757. Have had shaver for 2+ years now. Generally pleased with the shaver, especially in comparison with other electric shavers I have had over the years. Its performance in shaving was comparable with other electric shavers--OK, but not as good as manual razors. Cleans very well. In comparison with rotary electric shavers, I have found the battery to last much longer; recently, it seems that I am not getting as many shaves per charge, but in my previous experiences with rotary electric shavers, I have had battery problems much sooner. In comparison with foil electric shavers, I have found the Panasonic shaver to be much sturdier; the foil in previous foil shavers seemed to break very easily. The major issue with the Panasonic shaver was the noise level, as mentioned in other reviews I read.
  758. Hey gals for those of you looking to find a good shaver for your legs and underarms, this is it. I tried the &#34;for women&#34; shavers, they wouldn't hold a charge and barely cut butter. This shaves extremely close and stays charged for a long time. Love it. Wish I had found it sooner.

  776. I needed a new electric razor to replace an old one that had stopped working. After about two weeks of searching the internet, I settled on the Panasonic ES8103S as a good comprimise between price and performance. I purchased it from Amazon because of their return policy. When it arrived, it was very easy to set up and charge. Operation is a snap. As advertised, it works extremely well for dry or wet shaves. I have a tough beard, but this little gem gets it after just a few easy passes. I get results that are as good as or better than any streight razor I have ever used. The real beauty though is in cleaning. You just add some liquid hand soap, turn on the high speed mode, rinse it in cold water, dry it, and in no time at all, you are done. This is the best electric razor I have ever owned, and I rate it as 5 stars.
  777. I was a Braun guy for years. One day I looked in the mirror & said \\"This is not a close shave.\\" I did my research and came up with the Panasonic ES8103S. The reviews were excellent, so I bought it on Amazon for $64.00 and received it, as usual, very quickly with no shipping charges. This is BY FAR the closest shave I've EVER experienced with an electric shaver. I discovered a tube of Alba coconut lime shave cream lying in my drawer, and that made my experience even better. My wife, the true judge of a good shave, had no idea I had purchased a new shaver. She looked at me the day after I began using the Panasonic & commented on what a close shave I had. I have NO negatives. The PROS: very reasonably priced; fast, ridiculously close shave with no nicks or pulled hairs; very easy to clean with the high speed cleaning feature; charges quickly; light weight & easy to travel with. Sure the case could have been more substantial, but I improvised, using a heavy duty pouch I had lying around, which works fine in protecting the shaver while traveling. I clean the shaver with a little liquid soap after each shave rather than waiting for the prompt image to show up on the display because I'm afraid otherwise the Alba product (which I also highly recommend) might gum it up. Oh, and one more thing- when I'm at home and not traveling for business, I shave every other day, just because the day after I shave with my Panasonic, my face looks like it did immediately after shaving with the Braun!
  778. Panasonic ES8103S Pro-Curve Wet/Dry Rechargeable Linear Pivot Action Shaving System, Silver I have very sensitive skin, and to boot I not only shave my face but my head as well. I had owned a previous wet and dry shaver from Panasonic for many years until it finally gave out. I tried to replace it with several other common brands to no avail either they did not shave smooth enough or really were too abrasive for my sensitive skin,until I bought this one. First it charges in less than an hour, second, the charge lasts me three shaves or roughly a week's worth. The charger is very compact unless all the other bulky ones I was used to. It comes in a little pouch for travel that takes no space at all. Now to the shave, it is smooth as you can imagine almost as good if not the same as with a regular blade, it is fast as well, I liked it so much that afraid I may not get another one in the future if this one wears out, I went ahead and bought a second one. Highly recommend this shaver it has to be the best around and it wont take you to the poor house either, priced at under $80 it is well worth the price of more expensive shavers that do not work as well. Don't be afraid to try it you will not regret it.
  779. I've been a Panasonic wet/dry shaver user for many years now; this is my 3rd model and I needed to replace my older version as it no longer held a charge and the model itself was phased out. This new model (8103) does a very good job at the first cut (I always touch up with a straight razor anyway as my beard is way too thick for ANY electric to get close enough). A few things I like and see improvements on, compared to my older model: it charges quickly; the motor is quieter; provides a closer shave; is lighter weight. The only negative I'd point out (and it's a small one) is that the on/off switch is right in the center of the unit, and because of my hand position when I'm operating it, I've accidentally turned it off; no big deal, I'm just re-training my hand to keep the thumb off of dead center. This model is proving to be dependable and an improvement over my old one, and cost-wise, is also an excellent value.

  784. Since skin absorbs applied moisture, causing the skin to swell around facial hair, I always dry shave, preferably 20 to 30 minutes after a shower in order to get a closer, longer lasting shave. My prior shaver was a Panasonic ES4025 model, and it is this shaver that I will be comparing to my new Panasonic ES8103 model. The older model is superior to the newer one in closeness of shave, and in the power of the cutting action. Both shavers require more repeat strokes than I would prefer. The newer ES8103 shaver is more comfortable to use largely due to the pivot action, the blade action is much faster (although it doesn't reduce my shaving time appreciably), the battery lasts about twice as long per charge, doesn't slow down as it discharges, and recharges in a much shorter time. The display of battery power remaining is a nice touch, and the trimmer action is good (as it was in the older model). All in all, I am quite happy with the ES8103 model, and expect to use it for years to come.

  814. I have a moderate beard and shave my face and head regularly. I used Norelcos for decades and have also had Brauns and Remingtons among others through the years. My old ES8047 gave up the ghost after about five years and I needed a replacement. But most of the new Panasonic shavers are bigger and heavier with more heads. Many of the reviews seem to indicate poorer reliability. When I found the ES8103, I found a shaver with all the strengths of the ES8047 plus better battery life.<br />Pros:<br /> Light weight<br /> Quiet - if you think this is too noisy, you need to go back to a blade<br /> Agile - does a good job with tough spots on your face<br /> Picks up stray hairs well<br /> Easy to clear under running water<br />Cons<br /> Side trimmer cuts well, but you does tend to close unless you keep a finger on it (the 8047 had the same problem)<br /> Replacement blades are expensive (but way cheaper than a multiblade razor)<br />One tip: Make sure you change the blades when you see the performance drop off. I haven't had to do this with the 8103 yet, but I've only had it a few months. I found I needed to change the blades about once a year on my 8047. If your beard is very coarse, you may need to do it more frequently.

The head moves in and out as you our more pressure on and it pivots from left to right. It is perfect. Its kind of compact, really great to hold and comfortable to use.   824. My husband has worn out 2 of these razors and came back for another one. He gets the close shave he wants without irritation.
  825. I had always bought the little rinky dink electric razors and was never satisfied with their performance. When I started shaving my head daily, I decided to get a nice electric razor. I was afraid of spending so much money for something I might not want once I get it. This model was highly regarded and once I got it, I saw why. With a little dab of 'shave secret' lotion, this razor will give you a smooth shave with no problems. It works good with shaving cream too, but the shave secret lotion seems to 'hold' the blades to the surface with ease and get it extra close. Shaving your head with it really wears out the blades and foil a lot more than average because your actually pressing against skeletal bone rather than just a cheek or neck. I have had it over a year now and it still shaves close and performance is great. When I was cleaning it recently, I did decide to take the blades off and clean around in there a bit with a Q-tip. Well, the blades came off and on easily. When I originally read how to do it in the instructions, I dreaded to ever have to do any of that. Well, it's not too bad. I'm really impressed with this model and would highly recommend. Oh, and the charge on this model gives you a countdown and you can easily chart it from 100% charge to 10% charge. I think it tells you when to clean or and other prompts on the little display as well. There have been times it needed to be cleaned off and it lets you know. If there is a newer version of this model, you might give it a look, but I can tell you it would be tough to top this model for the price.
  826. My Norelco needed replacement after many years, and that model was discontinued. I wanted a wet/dry so I tried this model. It requires a lot of work to get a clean shave, and even that only comes at the expense of my skin. I do not recommend this at all.
  827. I've used 3 different electric shavers and every blade out there...this is by far the best shave. My skin has cleared up quite a bit since I started using it, razor bumps have gone to zero. Cleaning is rinsing with liquid soap under faucet..no big deal. I let it air dry while I shower. However, I like it so much and it works so well, I'm curious if the cleaning system is as good as the razor..so I may upgrade to that at some point. I have moderately thick, fine hair. I highly recommend \\"Lectric Shave\\" rather than soap and water or water based shave gels. For my sensitive skin, that's what's worked best. I drop a couple drops of Lectric Shave on the foils after its dry and before putting it away..does a good job lubricating. What's odd, is after 30 years of trying everything, I'm back to the same approach to shaving my dad used...electric shaver and lectric shave. Dad was right. This does not pull the hair out of your skin so that the hair is cut below skin level..which is what causes my razor bumps. This fact alone is worth the price of the razor..but I like all the features on it so far. Yes this means I sometimes touch up in evening if I'm going out...no big deal. I would rather do that than suffer all the irritation for a longer lasting shave. Highly recommend.
  828. Hands down, this shaver is the best electric shave I have ever had. Of course a blade will do one better, but as far as electrics go in this price range I don't think you can do any better. I tested rotary shavers in the same price category as this shaver, and they didn't compare. I like how this shaver tells you how much juice it has left (my old shaver just died). It also tells you when it's time to clean it, and it's waterproof so you can easily wash it or shave in the shower. My old electric shaver would not shave the neck no matter how much I asked it to. This shaver will shave the neck, but it will take a few passes. Time wise, this shaver will take about the same time as shaving with a blade- but obviously without the hassle of doing so. Some reviewers also commented on the heat and the noise. This shaver isn't quiet, but it's not too loud either. A little louder than my last electric shaver. Also, yes, the shaver does heat up a little bit on your face. The heat and noise though are only minor inconveniences.<br /><br />I've been a foil person my whole life so maybe I just work better with foil. But simply, this is the best electric shave I've ever had and I highly recommend it. If I had the option of purchasing this shaver again, I definitely would. Now there's no \\"miracle\\" shaver. It still takes time and multiple passes to look clean. But this shaver has so many high reviews for a reason. If you're in the market for an electric, give this one a try.
  829. The only thing wrong with the Panasonic ES8103S Men's 3-Blade shaver is that it has a light that flashes after its charged so you cannot keep it plugged in all the time. No electric shaver is going to shave as close as a blade and will require several passes to get the job done. I have a light beard and still it requires multiple passes over the same spot. I thought I'd like the floating pivoting head but after the novelty wore off in a few days I put it in the lock position so that it would stay steady. It is a good as my old Braun and the replacement parts (blades/foils) are less expensive so I like this shaver because of its lower parts cost versus the Braun.
  830. This morning I finall got the shaver here in the Bahamas, Charged up and had my first use. This was a very comfortable and close shave. Had Braun for years. But this Panasonic shaver is great. After a week of use, the shaver gets better and better and grows on you.

  832. I have never gotten such a close shave than I have with the ES8103S, it is also very gentle on my face, it is so easy to clean with the turbo clean mode feature, and the pop up trimmer is also very good. It also has a privet lock/unlock feature, its digital readout always lets you know when to charge it.<br />I really love this neat razor, so much that I won't go back to hand razors.
  833. pros:<br />- close shave on most parts of my face<br />- great trimmer<br />- good build quality<br />- easy to clean<br />- good display<br />- comfortable in hand / ergonomic design<br /><br />cons:<br />- struggled in thicker parts of my beard - took longer and more passes, and you could hear the thing struggling (fyi this did not happen with the 14,000 linear motor in the ES-LA63-S).<br /><br />bottom line:<br />- though gave a close shave for most areas of my face, couldn't cut it with thicker parts of my beard, so no go.

It wont even get me through the work week before recharging is needed - 3 days is typical. They clean up easily and give a smooth, close shave and they last for years. I bought this one to replace a model ES 8016 which is 9 years old and still works although it doesn't hold its charge as long, down to 7 days from 14 when it was new, and the blades really need replacing. This updated model has a floating head which is nice but it can be locked if you prefer and an LCD screen showing remaining charge. As far as I am concerned you can't go wrong with a Panasonic shaver.

On a one day old beard its fantastic, on a two day old beard you will find some straggler hairs it did not cut, and a three day old beard is worse. So my experience is keep a razor handy if you do not plan on shaving every day.   863. I've purchased three of these razors...the first one for myself, the other two for my father and step-father...we all really like it. Great performance. I love that you can use it in the shower, with shaving cream or dry.
  864. For the price, it's great. I bought it bc I developed moderate adult acne & shaving w Gillette Mach3 blades was wreaking havoc on my skin. This is much gentler, even though it still does cause very mild irritation. I have somewhat sensitive skin & this has basically accompished exactly what I was hoping for. Since I figured my skin might clear up in a few months as my medication starts to take effect, I did not want to spend a lot on a shaver. Consumer Reports rated this a Best Buy, so I debated taking the plunge. When Amazon ran a holiday special for about $65, this seemed too good to pass up. Very happy I made the switch. It took only a few shaves for me to get used to using it. My main complaint is that it doesn't give a very close shave on the delicate skin toward the bottom of my neck. Often I will go over it 7-8 times, which can cause redness. The Lock/Soft switch produces a noticeable effect on comfort & performance - useful for different areas. Battery life is decent & charges very quickly: 1 charge is probably good for 45 mins shave time, about 1/2 dozen shaves. (I DO miss the speed of a blade) I've always found shaving dry skin is faster & gives a closer shave. This 1 is no different ... though it's definitely functional & shaves comfortably w a little shave gel. Cleanup is very easy by just popping off the head & rinsing. All in all, I'm very satisfied w the product at its price. I would definitely recommend it, a good option even just to pick up if you're looking for an occasional alternative to using your blade w/o breaking the bank.
  865. LIFE CHANGING! I don't hate shaving every morning anymore. I also have a Norelco and a Braun, and this is far and away my favorite. Can't believe the low price, and it is a GREAT shave! A co-worker had a Panasonic and loved it, so I tried this one and I couldn't be happier with it. You can hear it cutting the hairs, so when you stop hearing the trimming it is done. Quicker and more thorough than either of my other electrics. Also, no problem going through my beard even after letting it grow for a few days. The others did not like to tackle a longer beard without a pre-trim, but the Panasonic motors through with no problem. I'd give it 6 stars if they were available. I just hope they never stop making replacement blades (although I've had it almost a year and still haven't replaced the blades).

The unit is not as noisy as some people complain about. It provides a decent shave but the lack of quality in the components has me believing that it will not make it much past the warranty period before it fails or breaks due so a short drop to the counter while shaving. Cheap Plastic seems to be the priority in the manufacturing of the unit. At the price I paid (about $50.00 USD) it is alright but there are many better units at the non-sale price of this shaver. Companys with a reputation for quality need to keep quality and the end user experience as their number one priority to survive in the new world of global cheap products, customers want quality; and if we know that is what we will get we will pay for it but the amount of crap being produced has many people buying cheap crap because when they buy a supposed quality brand these days they are actually buying the same quality as off brand junk. It used to be that a quality product cost more but paid for itself in the long run. This is a rare thing anymore and needs to be the norm again not the exception if quality brands want to survive. Market them as quality and STAND BEHIND them and we will buy them.

  880. I've been using this shaver now for 9 months. I recently replaced it with another Panasonic shaver, model ES-LA63. I'll get to that later. Let me just start off by saying I've used Panasonic shavers for 20 years and have always been very happy with them, until this model. I read all the reviews here and decided this was an easy choice. The first thing I noticed was that the ES8103S took longer to shave with than my 5 year old Panasonic Linear shaver ever did. No matter how many times I went back and forth over my neck area I would have stray hairs all over that I needed to get with a blade. I also noticed the shave I got was not as close as my old shaver on top of the longer shave time. Not only was the shaver sub par in the neck area, it had a lot of problems around my chin, a spot that no shaver I've owned has had a problem with.<br /><br />As I went on using it over the months, I noticed the battery life on this shaver was also a lot LESS than my 5 year old shaver! I simply chalked that up to the new shaver being lighter and just using a smaller battery. Of course now I realize it was because I was spending so much more time trying to get a close shave with it.<br /><br />My biggest complaint though was the big mess this shaver makes the entire time you use it. I shave dry and I only rinse the shaver out a couple of times a week. This was never a problem with my older Panasonic, but it's a big problem with this one. Unless you clean this out EVERY time you use it, there are whiskers all over your shirt and sink after you're done shaving. Even worse, this shaver holds water like no other. If you think you can just rinse it off and put it in a cabinet you're mistaken, as it will drip water for hours even after a good drying. Of course if you intend to use this shaver wet your experience might be far different than mine, but as I never once used this wet I can't comment on that.<br /><br />It was for all of these reasons that I picked up the 4 bladeES-LA63. Wow, what a difference! This is what a Panasonic shaver is supposed to be like. Not only does it provide me a FAR closer shave, it does it much, MUCH faster than the ES8103 ever could, and all the while does it while not dropping whiskers all over. The best part is that by 2pm my face still feels smooth, which couldn't be said of the ES8103. At the time I bought the ES8103, it was far less expensive than the ES-LA63, about half the price. Now there is only about $30 separating the two, and I can tell you from experience that the extra $30 is money WELL spent.

A single charge will likely last a week. I have occasionally use a manual razor to either give myself a fresh shave or a touch-up from that provided by my new Panasonic.<br /><br />I do like the ability to use the razor in the shower (i.e. wet) or at the sink (i.e. wet or dry) - that convenience has made the purchase worthwhile.   892. The Panasonic ES8103S Arc3 Electric Shaver was a great buy. I purchased it while it was one of Amazon's Daily Deals for a discount. The product works fairly well. The main issue I have with the product is that I have accumulated razor bumps due to using razors for a while, and this machine is unable to differentiate between the raised bumps and the hair on my face. So, by the end of my shave I have places on my neck that have some patches of hair remaining where there are razor bumps. This is a fatal flaw in the product, but I'm assuming its some sort of safety function so that I don't tear open my razor bumps. Other than that, this product works very well and I was very happy with the remainder of its performance.
  893. After using rotary shavers for the past 14 years, I decided to try a foil type. I purchased this Arc3 at the beginning of 2014, and have been using it for two months now. It's much closer than I got with the rotary shavers. Also, it's a lot easier to clean than the rotary models I've owned. On the downside, the battery life isn't as good as the rotary models I've owned. Fortunately, it has an indicator showing how much battery life remains before it needs to be recharged.

So I researched on CR and saw that this was the best razor under a 100 dollars. It shaves super close to my skin, has an LCD to indicate how full the charge is, and lets me know when I need to clean it. By the way, cleaning this thing is a breeze! No small bristle brushes to rid the device of remnants... just turn it on and run it under the faucet.   913. After years of ho-hum shaving I had given up on the electric shavers and went back to a blade. On a whim I checked out Consumer Reports and saw this was a best buy.<br /><br />To be honest, I had rather low expectations about the shaver. But when it arrived I took it out of the box (didn't even clean it first) and gave it a go--and I have never looked back.<br /><br />If you are over the age of about 23, and looking at this review, you probably already have an opinion on electric razors. I have been shaving most of my life (and no one cares how long that is) and have primarily used the Braun suite of electric shavers at multiple price levels. This shaver puts them all to shame.<br /><br />This shaver is fast, smooth, and easy to use. It can be used dry or in the shower (it is waterproof). This is the only shaver I ever used that cuts closer than a blade. And it does not nick my face.<br /><br />I am convinced that, like most things in life, you need to try it for yourself. If you do not already know, shaving is different for most every man.<br /><br />That being said, I would have no hesitation recommending this product.
  914. Like others who have reviewed this, I have sensitive skin. Shaving has always aggravated it, but so does not shaving, as my skin is also very sensitive to my own beard. Now I shave every day in the shower. The Panazonic ES8103S saves my face and saves me time shaving. Along with an unbreakable shower mirror, I shave with soap lather and it takes me about 1-2 minutes for a close, smooth shave. My face loves me again and I'm out the door about 10 minutes faster in the morning with the time I save not shaving at the bathroom sink. This has held up great in the water after over six months. I only have to charge it about once every two weeks with daily use. I highly recommend this product for anyone considering switching to an electric razor or to a waterproof electric razor.
  915. I've had this a little over a month and I've had no problems. Easy to hold handle shaped body. Works well as a wet shaver; I use it once a day so at a full charge of 100% I can get approx eight 3 minutes shaves before it has to be recharged. I don't grow a beard easily so if you are in the market for a meduim priced shaver, I'd recommend this for the money.
  916. Despite my opinion at the end of the day everyone's face and shaving experience is different.<br /><br />After two weeks of using the Panasonic ES8103s shaver I must say its a good comfortable shaver for the price, but for me I'm going to pass. Although the shave is pretty close on the face, for me it struggled on the jaw and neck area. I guess I was hoping it would do a tad better since I shave daily and my hair isn't that thick. I know electric shavers don't give the closest shaves and by no means was it bad, it just took a little long considering my dull dying Norelco could do the same job in less time. With pre-shave oil and/or shaving gel it only improved the results by a little. Another big thing for me was the shaver head movement. The side to side pivot was fine, but I didn't care for the in and out motion (like a car shock) on my face. It felt like I needed to apply more pressure so I ended up leaving it in Locked position most of the time. Other than those two things I liked everything else, it was very easy to clean, built well, nice battery display, and most important little to no irritation. So for under $90 its a solid performer, and many people here have given it glowing reviews.<br /><br />I recommend this for a person who wants to try out electric shaving or someone who primarily uses a manual type razor, but is looking for an affordable and quick shave in between their normal routine. However my face is sensitive to manual razors and so electric shaving is currently my only way to shave. With that being said I'm going to pass on this shaver and maybe invest in the Panasonic LA63s or Braun series 7.

  919. This is the most amazing electric shaver I have ever had -- or used. It shaves as close as a blade, and can be used when the hair on your face is longer than most shavers; i.e., two days growth was the maximum length of my previous shaver. This one will shave with three or four days growth -- although I imagine that depends on the person and how fast their beard grows.<br /><br />My only negative comment is that it cannot be left charging for more than an hour. It has no \\"cradle\\" to sit in, so you have to watch the time when you charge it. I called Panasonic and asked! They said to leave it charging continuously can damage the batteries. Still, it is worth that small inconvenience since it gives such a great shave -- and I do mean as well as when I wet shave with a blade.

  928. I've had this shaver for nearly 2 years, and after recently replacing the blade and foil it is still going strong. I believe it provides one of the closest, smoothest shaves of any electric shaver I've owned (better than Norelco and Braun I've owned in the past).<br /><br />I love that it is wet/dry, since I often prefer to shave in the shower. Lathering my face with a dab of body wash before shaving seems to provide an even closer shave. I've usually let the battery go completely dead before recharging, as I believe this keeps the battery from developing the memory effect and shortening the duration of the charge before needing plugged in again. Even after 2 years, I only have to charge mine after 4 or 5 uses.<br /><br />As long as you keep a sharp blade in the shaver, I think this machine is a great value. You can clean it with soap and water instead of any expensive solution, the upfront purchase cost is reasonable, and the quality of the shave is very good. If mine ever dies, I will definitely be looking for another Panasonic shaver.

I like the small LCD that shows battery strength, and it didn't take very long before the shaver was completely charged. So, I fired it up and it was much quieter than my old Braun. I have pitted and bumpy skin from years of acne, so I have tough skin to manuever and get a close shave without getting nicked. This shaver did it all. Smooth skin and no nicks. I was impressed.   954. I am new to modern wet/dry shavers. I have an old Norelco with the round heads and it did an okay job, but for the most part, for the past 40 years I shaved with a blade. I decided to try a wet/dry electric razor and after several weeks of comparing went with the Panasonic. I have no experience with the Braun or other competitors.<br /><br />I have only used this shaver wet, with shaving cream.<br /><br />First use, just about tossed it in the trash. It felt fine, but it took forever and once I cleaned off my face, half of my beard was still there, and I don't have much of a beard each day.<br /><br />Second use, a little better. Took forever, but I made sure I got a clean shave.<br /><br />Since...I have used it for two months or so, and doubt I will return to a blade. I get a good shave with the Panasonic, the skin in not irritated, and it all works. The primary negative is the time it takes. It takes me easily three times longer to shave with this razor compared to my blade. If I had to shave each day before work, well, it would not work out. Luckily I shave whenever I want, as I work from home (the ugly).<br /><br />Regarding the time it takes to shave, it eats up about 20% of the charge. I charge the unit every five or six days. Surprised how quickly it charges. I have not used it to shave with the cord plugged in.<br /><br />The unit is simple to take apart for cleaning, and I dunk in water as I shave.<br /><br />So the good: it makes a clean shave. The bad: takes forever. The ugly: me!

I would recommend this razor to anyone who is either buying one for the first time or for anyone who is dissatisfied with their current razor. I think it is the most bang you can get for your buck. you cannot shave with it while the charging cord is plugged in but it charges in about an hour so I have not found this to be any drawback at all.

  980. Up till now I have been a dedicate Braun user. I have found that Panasonic shaves a lot closer than my previous shavers.
  981. My face took a while to get used to this shaver, but it's a very smooth feeling shave now. I'm very happy with it.
  982. best electric shaver I have had!
  983. I use this every day and it is great. The display will say 10% for weeks, so not sure how accurate that is. It provides a great shave though, and that's what it is all about.
  984. Great shaver. I replaced an old Panasonic with this one and it's been great. Cuts close like a razor and has a handy trim tool on the back. Works wet or dry or even in the shower. No issues at all.
  985. I would like to give some support to this line of shavers, because it seems to me like Braun and Norelco have managed to dominate, even though their products aren't very good, in my opinion. I wore a beard for many years but recently decided to go clean shaven. I remembered using a Norelco as well as one of these in the past. So first I went ahead and bought the top of the line Norelco a month ago, with the auto cleaner and all that, and what I found was that it didn't work very well. It takes forever with the circular movement and just doesn't shave all that close. I was getting 5 o'clock shadow at noon. As for the Panasonic, I remember that I picked this shaver up in college when my roommate said that it had the most powerful motor available and that meant it could cut the hairs quickly without snagging or causing any irritation. I don't know if that's true. What I do know is that I decided to revisit this shaver, and while it's not perfect, it really does shave close and it does it pretty quickly. So keep up the good work Panasonic.
  986. It doesn't cut quite a closely as the product info suggests.
  987. Razor is as described, works great and delivered on time, Provides a clean, smooth shave.
  988. Got what I paid for, pretty happy but it could be cheaper.
  989. Has worked well for me for several years. Shave is typical for electrics. Good battery life.
  990. I bought this razor about a year ago. It still holds a charge for a long time and recharges quickly. However it seems to take longer to shave my face and I have to go over it multiple times. It's also more noisy then previous shavers that I have owned. The price was good on it.

  999. If you let your facial hair grow out more than a day, this shaver will not do very well. It's a well made little machine, but, it doesn't like cutting into hair more than .0055334 microns long. For that I use my trusty $40 Norelco three-head shaver (which I keep hidden under the towels on the shelf). That thing works great all the time. But it isn't fancy. This shaver is fancy. So, if you shave every day, this thing does a nice job giving you a smooth shave.
  1000. Good razor. Holds a charge well. A little loud but overall great value for the cost. I would recommend this shaver.
  1001. Best razor I have ever used. Daily use for 2+ weeks on a single charge. I have been shaving daily for 3.5 years and the battery still holds a charge like the first day I got it. I replaced the blades last year and did not notice a performance benefit; I am guessing you could go almost 5 years without replacing the blades.<br /><br />NOTE: I did not figure out how to use the trimmer properly for the first 2 years of use. You have to press the trimmer switch as you are using it to get the trimmer to gear up with the motor. When this is done properly the trimmer is excellent.
  1002. I bought it for my boyfriend. He usually uses razors and because of that, it didn't give him a super close shave the first few times. Now that he's getting used to the shaver, he's getting a really nice close shave.

  1007. Shaves OK, but, I've had to replace the blades several times over the nearly 3 years I've had it . . . which is sort-of to be expected, but, I wish the blades would last longer (and I don't even have thick/coarse facial hair). Now I'm in the market again for a new shaver (not quite 3 years after buying this one!) because the display has gone totally dead . . . I have absolutely NO idea what % battery life is left anymore. Used to get a week's worth of shaving on a charge, and now it's down to 2 days (3 if I'm lucky).   1008. I got this for him to take to the field where there isn't water for him to shave. It's great and loves it.
  1009. Bought one for my son, and then bought one for me to replace my almost 20 year old Braun (which I love, but after a rebuild and a final death, I was ready for a more modern shave). This shave 2-3 times faster than my old Braun. Battery doesn't last quite as long between charges (4-5 days vs 7-ish days), but it recharges in less time.<br /><br />I also appreciate how the whiskers don't fall out like grey snow while shaving like with my Braun - they are retained much better in the head.<br /><br />The trimmer feature is not as beefy as the Braun trimmer. If it were hit while it was extended, I fear it would break easily. Body is plastic and not metal (again, the 20 year old Braun was all metal), so not expecting it to last 20 years. I'm sure Panasonic is not wishing that it lasts that long either.<br /><br />I'm not a fan of the shavers that you have to use the cleaning station for - I think that is a way for the shaver companies to be like the Ink Jet printers - another way to get a lot of money out of you for something that should not cost that much.<br /><br />I appreciate that you can use the shaver in the shower, but I have not gotten in the habit of doing this. Tried it once, was &#34;meh&#34; about it. Probably should try it for a week like suggested to get used to it before I judge it. I just think it is harder to shave without a mirror - takes longer, more damage to your face by going over spots multiple times due to not seeing what you must shave.

  1019. I've been shaving with a Phillips-Norelco rotary electric shaver for over 25 years, and it's always worked well for me. When the Panasonic ES8103S (Arc 3) was on sale, I decided for the first time to try a foil shaver. For the most part, I'm happy with it. It doesn't shave quite as close as my Phillips-Norelco, but it also does not irritate my skin at all like the rotary shaver sometimes does. The Panasonic's battery also does not last as long, but I can get a week's worth of shaves between chargings. A couple of other cons are that the Panasonic is made almost entirely of plastic, and I have my doubts it will last very long. It is also very noisy. It's buzzes like a giant mosquito and I'm trying to get used to it.<br /><br />The Panasonic ES8103S (Arc 3) is an overall good shaver for the price. It's not perfect and in several ways not better than my rotary shaver. I'm happy with it though and recommend it especially if you have sensitive skin.

Found the latter was even quieter and gave a closer shave on facial hair, but irritated the skin on my neck.   1037. Two disclosures that may affect my review or your evaluation of it: 1. I have a beard 2. I have been using Panasonic wet/dry shavers for over 20 years This shaver's head seems just the right size. And the flexibility (which you can lock out) seems well designed. The weight is good and the handle is comfortable in any position or grip. This may be the quickest charging model I own. {You may want to ignore this retrospective. I still have my original 8066 as a backup. It has worked fine for over 20 years. My RF41 4-head model works very well but for a beard it is not as good for edging. My ES8043 has been a workhorse for travel. Holds a week plus charge and is easy to pack.} The only downside is the trimmer. Panasonic seems to put this as a secondary feature and it rarely shows the same kind of careful design as the rest of the shaver. My 8043 has the best trimmer. The size is right, the blades stay sharp and it stays solid while in use. This 8103S seems just as good for size and, right now, for sharpness. However, when I use it, I have to keep my thumb on the actuator switch or it will collapse while in use. Not a deal-breaker for me. Panasonic and Amazon do a great job of giving side-by-side comparisons of the current shavers. You should be able to find the one that best fits your needs and lifestyle.
